GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 剩下的比萨饼谁要？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’ll be in a wheelchair for the rest of his life .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的余生将在轮椅上度过。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Use a singular verb after the rest if you are referring to an amount of something or a thing.
F2NBox.TRAN: 指某物中的一定数量或一件东西﹐the rest后用动词的单数形式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The rest of the money was used to pay for the wedding.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 余下的钱用于支付婚礼费用。
F2NBox.EXPL: Use a plural verb if you are referring to a group of people or things.
F2NBox.TRAN: 指一群人或一批物品﹐则用动词的复数形式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: One child goes out of the room while the rest sit in a circle.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个小孩走出房间﹐其余的则围坐成一圈。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel less anxious or worried
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you talk to him, and put his mind at rest?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不和他谈谈﹐好让他放心呢？

Subsense.DEF: to stop moving
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The aircraft skidded across the runway and finally came to rest in a cornfield.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机滑过跑道﹐最后在玉米地里停了下来。

Subsense.DEF: if your eyes come to rest on something, you stop looking around and look at that one thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My eyes came to rest on a photograph of a young man.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的目光停留在一个年轻人的照片上。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to stop talking about something because they are annoying you
Sense.TRAN: 安静一下〔用于因受到烦扰而叫对方停止说话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give it a rest, Jack!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别烦了﹐杰克！

Sense.DEF: to stop doing an activity
Sense.TRAN: 暂停某事﹐暂时不做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I gave the acting a rest for a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把演出工作暂停了一段时间。

Subsense.DEF: an expression meaning dead, and free from pain and problems
not moving

Sense.LEXUNIT: and all the rest of it
Sense.DEF: used at the end of a short list to mean other things of a similar type
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was paying the rent and the bills and all the rest of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要付房租﹐付账单等等。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize in a humorous way that a number or amount is really much higher than someone thinks
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’d say she’s about 40.’ ‘Yeah, and the rest!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我说她40岁左右。” “噢﹐不止吧！”

Sense.DEF: to stop people from worrying about or believing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The minister resigned, and the government hoped that the scandal would finally be laid to rest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长辞了职﹐政府希望这下丑闻终于要平息了。

Sense.DEF: an expression meaning to bury someone, used when you want to avoid saying this directly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was laid to rest beside her husband.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被安葬在她丈夫身边。

Subsense.DEF: a period of silence of a particular length in a piece of music
a written sign that shows how long the period of silence should be

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’m going upstairs to have a rest.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要上楼去休息一下。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: You’d better get some rest if you’re driving back tonight.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你今晚开车回来的话﹐最好休息一下。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I think we deserve a rest after all that hard work.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么辛苦地工作之后﹐我想我们该休息一下了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a rest after working hard
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Our players are taking a well-earned rest before the start of the new season.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 新赛季开始之前﹐我们的队员正在享受理所应当的休息。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The doctor had advised a complete rest for a fortnight.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生建议彻底休息两周。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a complete rest that relaxes you

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The crew had a three hour rest period before their next flight.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 下一个航班起飞之前﹐机组人员有三个小时休息时间。

Sense.DEF: to stop working or doing an activity for a time and sit down or lie down to relax
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’re tired, we’ll stop and rest for a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你累了﹐我们就停下来歇一会儿。

Sense.DEF: to support an object or part of your body by putting it on or against something, or to be supported in this way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rest your head on my shoulder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的头靠在我的肩上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Brassard rested his elbows on the table and leaned forward.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布拉萨德把胳膊肘支在桌子上﹐身体前倾。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their bikes were resting against the wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的自行车靠在墙上。

Sense.DEF: to stop using a part of your body because it is feeling sore or tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need to sit down and rest my legs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要坐下来歇歇腿。

Sense.DEF: to stop discussing or dealing with something
Sense.TRAN: 让事情结束〔指不再讨论或处理〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The man apologized, but Aunt Matilda refused to let the matter rest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个男人道歉了﹐但玛蒂尔达姑妈却不肯就此罢休。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone not to worry, because what you say about a situation is true
Sense.TRAN: 尽管放心〔表示叙述的事属实〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You may rest assured that it will be ready on time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你放心﹐到时候会准备好的。

Sense.DEF: if you will not rest until something happens, you will not be satisfied until it happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will not rest until the murderer is found.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 找不到凶手我们决不罢休。

Sense.DEF: if a dead person rests somewhere, they are buried there
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mother rests beside my father in the family graveyard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲长眠在家族墓地里我父亲的身边。

GramExa.GLOSS: the place where someone is buried
often written on a grave

Sense.DEF: to be satisfied with what you have done, so that you do not make any further effort
Sense.TRAN: 满足于既得的成就﹐安于小成﹐不再求上进

Subsense.DEF: used by a lawyer when they have finished trying to prove something in a court of law
Subsense.TRAN: 本人举证完毕﹔本人停止举证 〔律师出庭用语〕

Subsense.DEF: used when something happens or is said which proves that you were right – used humorously
Subsense.TRAN: 我不用多说了﹐还用我多说吗〔幽默用法﹐表示发生的事或所说的话证明自己是正确的〕

Sense.DEF: to relax and stop worrying
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can rest easy, knowing everything’s under control.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 知道一切都在掌控之中﹐我就放心了。

Sense.DEF: to depend on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Success in management ultimately rests on good judgment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理的成功最终有赖于良好的判断力。

Sense.DEF: to be based on a particular idea or set of facts
Sense.EXAMPLE: The case against my client rests entirely on circumstantial evidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用于指控我的当事人的证据都是间接证据。

Sense.DEF: if your eyes rest on something, you notice it and look at it
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyes rested on a small figure in the distance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的目光落在远处一个小小的身影上。

Sense.DEF: if a decision rests with someone, they are responsible for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The final decision rests with the President.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得由总统作最后的决定。

Sense.DEF: a place near a road where you can stop and rest, go to the toilet etc
to start something such as a machine, process etc again after it has stopped
Sense.EXAMPLE: attempts to restart the peace process
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重启和平进程的尝试

Sense.DEF: to say something again in a different way, so that it is clearer or more strongly expressed
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is not changing the rules; he is simply restating the policy that was established last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有改变规定﹐只是把去年定下来的政策重新表述了一下。

Sense.DEF: a place where you can buy and eat a meal

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We went to a little Italian restaurant near Leicester Square.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去了莱斯特广场附近的一家意大利小饭馆。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He took her out for a five-course dinner in a fancy restaurant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他带她到一家豪华餐厅吃了一顿有五道菜的晚餐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company runs a chain of restaurants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司经营连锁饭店。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A new restaurant has just opened across the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马路对面刚开了一家新饭馆。

Sense.DEF: a carriage on a train where meals are served
someone who owns and manages a restaurant
Sense.TRAN: 〔亲自管理餐馆的〕餐馆老板﹐饭店主人

Sense.DEF: feeling healthier, stronger, or calmer because you have had time to relax
Sense.TRAN: 〔休息之后感到〕精神的﹔有精力的﹔清醒的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We came back from holiday feeling rested and relaxed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们度假归来﹐感到轻松而精力充沛。

Sense.DEF: peaceful and quiet, making you feel relaxed
Sense.EXAMPLE: restful music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻松的音乐

Sense.DEF: a place where old or sick people can live and be taken care of
the act of giving back something that was lost or stolen to its owner, or of paying for damage
Sense.TRAN: 〔失物或被窃之物的〕归还﹔〔对损坏之物的〕赔偿

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the restitution of art treasures missing since World War II
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二次世界大战以来流失在外的艺术珍品的回归

Sense.EXAMPLE: The offender must make restitution for the hurt that he or she has caused.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 违法者必须为其所造成的伤害作出赔偿。

Sense.DEF: dissatisfied or bored with your situation, and impatient for it to change
Sense.EXAMPLE: Republican leaders struggled to rule over increasingly restive populations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人民不满情绪与日俱增﹐共和党领导人的统治举步维艰。

Sense.DEF: unwilling to keep still or stay where you are, especially because you are nervous or bored
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因紧张或厌烦而〕不安宁的﹐烦躁的﹐不耐烦的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children had been indoors all day, and were getting restless.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们在屋里待了一整天﹐开始不耐烦了。

Sense.DEF: unwilling to stay in one place, and always wanting new experiences
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a few weeks in Marseille, I grew restless and decided to move on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在马赛住了几星期后﹐我开始待不住了﹐决定换个地方。

Sense.DEF: a night during which you cannot sleep or rest
to bring in more supplies to replace those that have been used
when you repair something such as an old building or a piece of furniture, so that it looks the same as when it was first built or made
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧建筑或旧家具等的〕修复﹐整修

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fund for the restoration of historic buildings
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 历史建筑修复基金

Sense.EXAMPLE: Major restoration work will begin in May.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大规模的修复工作将在5月开始。

Sense.DEF: the act of bringing back a law, tax, or system of government
Sense.TRAN: 〔法律﹑税收﹑政体的〕重新采用﹐恢复

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re fighting for the restoration of democratic rights.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在为恢复民主权利而斗争。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the restoration of the monarchy in Spain
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 西班牙君主政体的复辟

Sense.DEF: the return of Charles II as King of England in 1660, and the period afterwards
Sense.TRAN: 王政复辟（时期）〔1660年英王查理二世复辟及其后的一段时期〕

GramExa.GLOSS: plays written during this time in England
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 王政复辟时期的喜剧/戏剧

Sense.DEF: the act of officially giving something back to its former owner

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an attempt to secure the restoration of their lands
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 争取使他们的土地物归原主的努力

Sense.DEF: making you feel healthier or stronger
Sense.EXAMPLE: the restorative power of sleep
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 睡眠的恢复功效

Sense.DEF: to make something return to its former state or condition

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government promises to restore the economy to full strength.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府承诺使经济完全复苏。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The National Guard was called in to restore order make people stop fighting and breaking the law when riots broke out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴乱爆发后﹐国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。
Sense.EXAMPLE: initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恢复中东和平的倡议

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Vietnam restored diplomatic relations with the Republic of Korea on December 22.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 越南于12月22日和韩国恢复了外交关系。

GramExa.GLOSS: make someone who cannot hear or who is blind, hear or see again

Sense.DEF: to bring back a positive feeling that a person or a group of people felt before
Sense.EXAMPLE: measures aimed at restoring public confidence in the education system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旨在恢复公众对教育体制信心的措施
Sense.EXAMPLE: a man whose kindness and sincerity really restored my faith in human nature helped me to believe that people can be good
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个以善良和真诚大大恢复了我对人性的信心的男人

Sense.DEF: to repair an old building, piece of furniture, or painting etc so that it is in its original condition
Sense.TRAN: 修复〔旧建筑﹑旧家具或旧画等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The church was carefully restored after the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后教堂得到了精心修复。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Victorian fireplace restored to its former glory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恢复了昔日华美的维多利亚时代的壁炉

Sense.DEF: to give back to someone something that was lost or taken from them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The treaty restored Okinawa to Japan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that someone gives something back to its former owner, rather than restores it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐表示将某物归还原主﹐人们一般说give back﹐而不说restore
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The treaty gave Okinawa back to Japan.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

Sense.DEF: to bring back a law, tax, right etc
Sense.TRAN: 恢复﹐重新采用〔法律﹑税收﹑权利等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a campaign to restore the death penalty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要求恢复死刑的运动

Sense.DEF: make someone king, queen, or president again, after a period when they have not been in power
Sense.TRAN: 使某人重新掌权/恢复王位

Sense.DEF: feeling better and stronger
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a cup of tea, she felt quite restored.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喝了一杯茶后﹐她感觉恢复了精力。

Sense.DEF: a person whose job is repairing old things
Sense.EXAMPLE: an art restorer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名艺术品修复者

Sense.DEF: someone who brings back something that existed before
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was described as a restorer of peace and order.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们说是他重新带来了和平与秩序。

Sense.DEF: to stop someone from doing something, often by using physical force

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had to restrain her from running out into the street.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只得阻止她跑到街上去。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had to be restrained from using violence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不得不制止他使用暴力。

Sense.DEF: to control your own emotions or behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 克制﹐控制﹐忍住〔情绪或行为〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Renwick restrained a feeling of annoyance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦威克忍住了不悦的情绪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She could barely restrain herself from hitting him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她差点就忍不住要去打他。

Sense.DEF: to control or limit something that is increasing too much
Sense.TRAN: 抑制﹐控制〔增长太多的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Price rises should restrain consumer spending.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格上涨会抑制消费支出。

Sense.DEF: behaviour that is restrained is calm and controlled
Sense.EXAMPLE: a restrained and cool-headed response to their criticisms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他们的批评作出的克制及冷静的回应

Sense.DEF: not too brightly coloured or decorated
Sense.EXAMPLE: The interior decoration is quite restrained.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 室内装饰颇为素雅。

Sense.DEF: an official legal document that prevents someone from doing something
calm sensible controlled behaviour, especially in a situation when it is difficult to stay calm
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police were praised for their restraint in handling the demonstrators.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方因对待示威者时所表现出的克制而受到赞扬。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He urged the millions of protesters to exercise restraint.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他呼吁数百万抗议者保持克制。

Sense.DEF: a rule or principle that limits what people can do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Opposition politicians have called for restraints on public spending.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对党政治家呼吁控制公共开支。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has imposed restraints on corporate mergers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府对公司合并实行了限制。

Sense.DEF: physical force that is used to hold someone back, especially because they are likely to be violent
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指对狂暴的人实行的〕约束﹐管制﹐管束
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes police officers have to use physical restraint to control dangerous prisoners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时警察不得不采取人身约束来控制危险的囚犯。

Sense.DEF:
something that prevents someone from moving freely, such as a rope or a
seat belt
Sense.TRAN: 安全装置﹔〔汽车的〕安全带

Sense.DEF: to limit or control the size, amount, or range of something
Sense.TRAN: 限制﹐控制〔大小﹑数量或范围〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new law restricts the sale of hand guns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新法规限制手枪的销售。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You may need to restrict access to certain files limit the number of people who can read them .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 某些档案可能需要限制查阅。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The agreement will restrict competition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个协议将限制竞争。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In future we will restrict class sizes to 20 students.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 以后我们会把班级规模限定在20人。

Sense.DEF: to limit someone’s actions or movements
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cramped living conditions severely restricted the children’s freedom to play.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拥挤的居住条件严重限制了孩子们玩耍的自由。

Sense.DEF: to allow yourself to have or do only a particular thing or amount of something
Sense.TRAN: 限制自己/某人只做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m restricting myself to two cigarettes a day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在限制自己每天只抽两支烟。

Sense.DEF: small or limited in size, area, or amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult trying to work in such a restricted space.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要在这么狭窄的空间里工作很困难。

Sense.DEF: limited or controlled, especially by laws or rules
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在法律或规则上〕受限制的﹐受约束的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Press freedom is severely restricted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻自由受到严格限制。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sale of alcohol is restricted to people over the age of 18.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只准售酒给18岁以上的人。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There is restricted access to this information only certain people can have it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能接触此信息的人员有限。

Sense.DEF: limited in your movements or in what you are able to do
Sense.TRAN: 〔活动﹑能做的事〕有限的﹐受限制的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The accident left her with restricted movement in her right leg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事故造成她右腿行动不便。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In those days women led very restricted lives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个时候﹐妇女的生活受到很大的限制。

Sense.DEF: a restricted area, document, or information can only be seen or used by a particular group of people because it is secret or dangerous
Sense.TRAN: 〔地区﹑文件或信息〕限某一类人使用[传阅]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: No Entry - restricted area for army personnel only.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 限制区——非军事人员不得入内。

Sense.DEF: to only affect a limited area, group etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The damage is restricted to the left side of the brain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 损伤仅限于左脑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eligibility for five weeks’ holiday is restricted to senior management.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有高级管理人员才有资格享受五周假期。

Sense.DEF: a rule or law that limits or controls what people can do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: restrictions on immigration
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 移民限制

Sense.EXAMPLE: a 50 mph speed restriction
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每小时50英里的限速

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The law imposed new financial restrictions on private companies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该法规对私营公司实施新的金融限制。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: tougher restrictions on alcohol advertising
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对酒类广告更严格的限制

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Restrictions on trade were lifted.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贸易限制取消了。

Sense.DEF: when you restrict the size, amount, or range of something
something that is restrictive stops people doing what they want to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many members thought the rules were too restrictive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多会员认为这些规定限制条件太多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a restrictive policy on admission to the college
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学入学的限制性政策

Sense.DEF: a part of a sentence that says which particular person or thing you are talking about. For example in ‘the man who came to dinner’, the phrase ‘who came to dinner’ is a restrictive clause.
Sense.TRAN: 限定性从句﹐限制性关系从句〔例如在the man who came to dinner中﹐who came to dinner是限制性从句〕

Sense.DEF:
unreasonable rules that are used by a
trade union
to limit the kind of work that members of other trade unions are allowed to do for a company
Sense.TRAN: 排他限制规定〔某一工会对其他工会工人在某公司中可从事的工作实行限制的不合理规定〕

Sense.DEF: an unfair trade agreement between companies that limits the amount of competition there is
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司之间不公平的〕限制竞争协议

Sense.DEF: a room with a toilet in a place such as a restaurant or cinema
to change the way in which something such as a government, business, or system is organized
Sense.EXAMPLE: proposals to radically restructure Britain’s electronics industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彻底整顿英国电子行业的提议

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the major restructuring of our armed forces
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们武装力量的重大调整

Sense.DEF: a place near a road where you can stop and rest, use the toilet etc
something that happens or exists because of something that happened before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Accidents are the inevitable result of driving too fast.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 开车过快的必然后果就是车祸。

Sense.EXAMPLE: High unemployment is a direct result of the recession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高失业率是经济衰退的直接后果。

GramExa.GLOSS: the result at the end of a long process
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The net result of all these changes is that schools should be able to deliver a better service to pupils.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有这些改革的最终结果就是学校应该能给学生提供更好的服务。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Growing plants from seed can produce disappointing results .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将种子培育成植株﹐有时会产生令人失望的结果。
Sense.EXAMPLE: With a little effort you should achieve the desired result .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要稍作努力﹐你就可以取得预期的效果。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: As a result of the pilots’ strike, all flights have had to be cancelled.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于飞行员罢工﹐所有航班都被迫取消。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sara wasn’t at school last week, with the result that she missed an important test.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉上星期没上学﹐结果错过了一次重要测验。

Sense.DEF: the final number of points, votes etc at the end of a competition, game, or election
Sense.TRAN: 〔比赛的〕成绩﹐比分﹔〔选举的〕结果
Sense.EXAMPLE: The results will be announced at midnight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结果将在午夜公布。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the football results
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球比赛的结果

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A lot depends on the result of this match.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多事情都取决于这场比赛的结果。

Sense.DEF: the answers that are produced by a scientific study or test
Sense.EXAMPLE: Results suggest that diet is very important.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究结果显示膳食十分重要。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Police are awaiting the results of a forensic examination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方在等待法医的鉴定结果。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The experiments gave positive results in all cases.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 实验结果均为阳性。

Sense.DEF: the mark you get in an examination
Sense.EXAMPLE: When do we get our exam results ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们什么时候能知道考试成绩？

Sense.DEF: the achievement of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She certainly knows how to get results .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她无疑知道如何达到目的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For best results, always use fresh ingredients when you are cooking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要想做出最美味的菜肴﹐用料一定要新鲜。

Sense.DEF: the accounts of a business that show how successful it has been over a period of time, usually a year
Sense.EXAMPLE: British Airways has announced disappointing results for the first half of the year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国航空公司公布了上半年令人失望的业绩。

Sense.DEF: to win a victory in a sports match
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were lucky to get a result on Saturday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们很幸运﹐星期六的比赛打赢了。

Exponent.DEF: something that happens because of something else
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The fire at the house was the result of a dropped cigarette.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子着火是由一个丢弃的烟头引起的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many people find that herbal remedies produce a good result.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人觉得草药很有效。

Exponent.DEF: something important that happens as the result of a decision or action
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Global warming will have serious consequences for the environment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 全球变暖将对环境造成严重后果。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Rising prices are the inevitable consequence of the grain shortage.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 涨价是粮食短缺的必然结果。

Exponent.DEF: the bad effects that happen later as a result of an event, often a long time afterwards
Exponent.TRAN: 〔长时间之后显现的不良〕后果
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The economic crisis in the US is likely to have serious repercussions for the rest of the world.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国经济危机可能给世界其他地区带来严重后果。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The scandal could have major repercussions for his career.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这起丑闻可能会给他的事业带来很大影响。

Exponent.DEF: the final result of a meeting, election, war etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The final outcome of the election remained in doubt for several days.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 几天来﹐大选的最终结果一直不确定。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: So, what is the likely outcome for Spain?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么﹐西班牙可能会怎样？

Exponent.DEF: the final result of a situation, especially when this was unexpected
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The upshot of all this was that the trial had to be delayed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一切的结果就是审判不得不延期。

Exponent.DEF: the things that have been achieved as a result of someone’s efforts – used especially in the following phrases
Exponent.TRAN: 某事物的成果〔尤用于以下短语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He did not live to see the fruits of his labours .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没能活着看到自己的劳动成果。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They can now enjoy the fruits of their success .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们现在可以享受自己的成功果实了。

Sense.DEF: if something results from something else, it is caused by it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We are still dealing with problems resulting from errors made in the past.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还在处理过去的失误所造成的问题。

Sense.EXAMPLE: How would you cope with unemployment and the resulting loss of income?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会如何应付失业及由此造成的收入损失？

Sense.DEF: to make something happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: an accident that resulted in the death of two passengers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 导致两名乘客死亡的事故

Sense.DEF: said when you have just done something successfully
happening or existing because of something
Sense.TRAN: 作为…的后果而发生[存在]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is still trying to get over the attack and the resultant injuries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她仍在努力从袭击以及由此造成的伤害中恢复过来。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something again after stopping or being interrupted
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hopes to resume work after the baby is born.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想生完孩子后继续工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rebels have resumed hostilities against government troops.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛乱分子继续与政府军发生冲突。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He will resume training as soon as the injury is better.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一旦伤势好转﹐他就会继续训练。

Sense.DEF: if an activity or process resumes, it starts again after a pause
Sense.TRAN: 〔活动或过程中断后〕重新开始
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peace talks will resume tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和平谈判明天重新启动。

Sense.DEF: to go back to the seat, place, or position where you were before
Sense.TRAN: 回到原来的座位/原地/原来的职位
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will the delegates please resume their seats?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请代表们回到座位上好吗？

Sense.DEF: a short account of something such as an article or speech which gives the main points but no details
Sense.EXAMPLE: a brief résumé of the day’s events
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当天活动的概述

Sense.DEF: a short written account of your education and your previous jobs that you send to an employer when you are looking for a new job
the act of starting an activity again after stopping or being interrupted

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Both countries are now hoping for a quick resumption of diplomatic relations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在两国都希望尽快恢复外交关系。

Sense.DEF: to appear again after being lost or missing
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of the missing paintings suddenly resurfaced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中一幅遗失的画作突然又出现了。

Sense.DEF: if an idea or problem resurfaces, it becomes important again
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nationalist tensions have resurfaced here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民族主义紧张关系又在这里抬头。

Sense.DEF: to put a new surface on a road
to come back up to the surface of the water
the reappearance and growth of something that was common in the past

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There has been a resurgence of interest in religion over the last ten years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近10年以来宗教热情重燃。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a resurgence in the popularity of 60s music
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪60年代音乐的再次流行

Sense.DEF: growing and becoming more popular, after a period of quietness
Sense.TRAN: 复兴的﹔复苏的﹔再度流行的
Sense.EXAMPLE: resurgent fascism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再次抬头的法西斯主义

Sense.DEF: to bring back an old activity, belief, idea etc that has not existed for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 使〔过去的活动﹑信仰﹑观点等〕复活﹐恢复
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Home Office have resurrected plans to build a new prison just outside London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内政部重新提出了在伦敦市外建一座监狱的计划。
Sense.EXAMPLE: another failed attempt to resurrect his career
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他重振事业的又一次失败尝试

Sense.DEF: a situation in which something old or forgotten returns or becomes important again
Sense.EXAMPLE: a resurrection of old jealousies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昔日嫉妒心的再次出现

Sense.DEF: to make someone breathe again or become conscious after they have almost died
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doctors managed to resuscitate him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生把他抢救了过来。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: mouth-to-mouth resuscitation when you breathe air into someone’s mouth to make them breathe

Sense.DEF: the sale of goods in shops to customers, for their own use and not for selling to anyone else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a manager with twenty years’ experience in the retail business
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个在零售业有20年经验的经理

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We are looking for more retail outlets for our products.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在为产品寻找更多的零售店。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a retail price of £8.99
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 8.99英镑的零售价
Sense.EXAMPLE: The retail value would be around $500.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 零售价在500美元左右。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Retail sales fell by 1.3% in January.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1月份零售额下降了1.3%。

Sense.DEF: to be sold for a particular price in a shop

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wine retails at £6.95 a bottle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种葡萄酒每瓶的零售价为6.95英镑。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The decoder is expected to retail for under $300.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种解码器的零售价预计在300美元以下。

Sense.DEF: to sell goods in shops
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their products are retailed all over Britain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的产品在英国各地都有零售。

Sense.DEF: to give other people private information about someone or something
if you buy or sell something retail, you buy or sell it in a shop
Sense.TRAN: 以零买方式﹔以零售方式
Sense.EXAMPLE: We only deal with wholesalers - we don’t sell any of our goods retail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只和批发商打交道﹐不做零售。

Sense.DEF: a person or business that sells goods to customers in a shop
the business of selling goods to customers in shops
Sense.EXAMPLE: There may be many job losses in retailing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 零售业可能会有很多人失业。

Sense.DEF: an area outside a town with many large shops and space for cars to park
Sense.TRAN: 购物中心〔位于城郊﹐设有众多大型商店和停车位〕

Sense.DEF: a list of certain goods and services and how much their prices change each month
the act of buying things that you do not need when you are unhappy because you think it will make you feel better – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 购物疗法〔指通过购物使心情愉快﹐常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What you need is a bit of retail therapy!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要来一点购物疗法！

Sense.DEF: to keep something or continue to have something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have the right to retain possession of the goods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有权保留这些物品。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The state wants to retain control of food imports.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府想保留对食品进口的控制权。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say keep rather than retain .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说keep﹐而不说retain

Sense.DEF: to store or keep something inside something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of information can be retained in your computer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑可以储存很多信息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Limestone is known to retain moisture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们知道石灰岩能储存水分。

Sense.DEF: to remember information
Sense.EXAMPLE: I find it very difficult to retain facts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得具体事实很难记住。

Sense.DEF: if you retain a lawyer or other specialist, you pay them to work for you now and in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has retained a lawyer to challenge the court’s decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他聘请了一名律师质疑法庭的判决。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had to pay a retaining fee an amount of money to keep someone working for you .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须预付聘金。

Sense.DEF: if a company retains workers, it continues to employ them for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s increasingly difficult to recruit and retain good staff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 招聘和留住优秀员工越来越难。

Sense.DEF: an amount of money paid to someone, especially a lawyer, so that they will continue to work for you in the future
a reduced amount of rent that you pay for a room, flat etc when you are not there, so that it will still be available when you return
Sense.TRAN: 〔为保留租房而支付的〕保留费

Sense.DEF: a plastic and wire object that you wear in your mouth to make your teeth stay straight
a servant
a wall that is built to prevent land from slipping or moving
to get control of an area again in a war
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to retake the city
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重夺该市的尝试

Sense.DEF: to take an examination again because you have previously failed it
an act of filming or photographing something again
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had to do several retakes before the director was satisfied.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不得不重拍了好几次才让导演满意。

Sense.DEF: an examination or test that you take again because you failed it
to do something bad to someone because they have done something bad to you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The British government retaliated by breaking off diplomatic relations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为报复﹐英国政府断绝了外交关系。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The army began to retaliate against the civilian population.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队开始报复平民。

Sense.DEF: action against someone who has done something bad to you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This action was undoubtedly in retaliation for last week’s bomb attack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个行动无疑是对上周炸弹袭击事件的报复。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the threat of massive retaliation against British troops
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要对英军进行大规模报复的威胁

Sense.DEF: done against someone because they have harmed you
Sense.EXAMPLE: a retaliatory attack
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次报复性攻击

Sense.DEF: to delay the development of something, or to make something happen more slowly than expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cold weather retards the growth of many plants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寒冷的天气使许多植物生长滞缓。

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for a stupid person
less mentally developed than other people of the same age. Many people think that this use is rude and offensive.
Sense.TRAN: 弱智的﹐智力发育迟缓的〔许多人认为这是粗鲁和冒犯用语〕

Sense.DEF:
to try to
vomit
Sense.EXAMPLE: The smell made her retch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个气味让她恶心。

Sense.DEF: to tell a story again, often in a different way or in a different language
Sense.TRAN: 〔常指以不同的方式或语言〕重讲﹐复述

Sense.DEF: the act of keeping something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The UN will vote on the retention of sanctions against Iraq.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国将投票决定是否继续制裁伊拉克。

Sense.DEF: the ability or tendency of something to hold liquid, heat etc within itself
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people with heart problems suffer from fluid retention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多有心脏病的人都有体液潴留。

Sense.DEF: the ability to keep something in your memory
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have a real problem with retention of information.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的记忆力大有问题。

Sense.DEF: a retentive memory or mind is able to hold facts and remember them
to think about a plan or idea again in order to decide if any changes should be made
Sense.EXAMPLE: an opportunity to rethink our policy on advertising
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重新思考我们广告政策的机会

RunOn.EXAMPLE: It’s time for a complete rethink of the way we farm our countryside.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 该彻底反思一下我们乡村地区的农耕方式了。

Sense.DEF: unwilling to talk about what you feel or what you know

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s strangely reticent about her son.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很奇怪﹐她不愿意多谈自己的儿子。

Sense.DEF: forming or covered with a pattern of squares and lines that looks like a net
the area at the back of your eye that receives light and sends an image of what you see to your brain

computer equipment that is used to examine someone’s retina in order to
identify
them. Retinal scanners are used by the police and
immigration
officials at some airports to check the information on someone’s
passport
or
id card
.
a group of people who travel with someone important to help and support them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He travelled with a huge retinue of servants.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他带着一大群仆从旅行。

Subsense.DEF: to stop working, usually because you have reached a certain age
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Most people retire at 65.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数人65岁退休。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He was forced to retire early because of poor health.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因为身体不好被迫提前退休。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I retired from teaching three years ago.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我三年前从教学岗位上退休。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: her decision to retire from her position as librarian of the law society
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从法律协会图书管理员职位上退下来的决定
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her drink problem has forced her to retire from public life .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的酗酒问题迫使她退出公众生活。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He retired as a GP last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去年从全科医生的职位上退休。

Subsense.DEF: to ask someone to stop doing their job, usually because of ill health
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He became ill and was retired early.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他生病了﹐提前退休。

Sense.DEF: to go away to a quiet place
Sense.TRAN: 退出﹐离开〔去安静的地方〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I retired to my room to think.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我躲进自己的房间去思考。

Sense.DEF:
when a
jury
in a law court retires, they go away to consider whether someone is guilty or not
to stop competing in a game or race because you are losing or injured
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had to retire with a neck injury in the second half.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下半场他因颈部受伤只得退出比赛。

Sense.DEF: to go to bed
to move back from a battle after being defeated
having stopped working, usually because of your age
Sense.EXAMPLE: a retired teacher
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 退休教师
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both my parents are retired now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母现在都已退休。

Sense.DEF: someone who has stopped working, usually because of their age
when you stop working, usually because of your age

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He became a keen golfer after his retirement from politics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从政坛退下后﹐热衷于打高尔夫球。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He announced his retirement as chief executive of the company.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他宣布从公司总裁的职位上退休。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She took early retirement retired at an earlier age than usual last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她去年提前退休了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad’s approaching retirement age .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸快到退休年龄了。

Sense.DEF: the period after you have stopped work
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope you enjoy a long and happy retirement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你好好享受悠长幸福的退休生活。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Will you be able to support yourself in retirement?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你退休后能养活自己吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: a retirement pension
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 退休金

Sense.DEF:
an
old people’s home
a system for saving money for when you stop work, done either through your employer or arranged by you
Sense.TRAN: 〔或通过雇主或由本人安排的〕退休金计划

Sense.DEF: someone who is retiring does not want to be with other people, especially people they do not know
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a child, Elizabeth was very shy and retiring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊丽莎白小时候非常腼腆害羞。

Sense.DEF: a president etc who is soon going to leave their job
Sense.TRAN: 即将卸任的总裁/经理/董事等

Sense.DEF: to organize something in a new way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The College Board has retooled the admission exams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学委员会重新调整入学考试。

Sense.DEF: to change or replace the machines or tools in a factory
to reply quickly, in an angry or humorous way
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It’s all your fault!’ he retorted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那都是你的错！”他反驳道。

Sense.DEF: a short angry or humorous reply
Sense.TRAN: 〔简短而愤怒或幽默的〕反驳﹐回嘴
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was about to make a sharp retort .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正要尖刻地反驳。

Sense.DEF: a bottle with a long narrow bent neck, used for heating chemicals
to improve a picture or photograph by painting over marks or making other small changes
Sense.EXAMPLE: postcards that have been retouched to cover the grey skies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过修饰把灰色天空掩盖起来的明信片

Sense.DEF: to go back exactly the way you have come
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a few minutes, he turned around and began to retrace his steps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几分钟后﹐他转身顺着原路返回。

Sense.DEF: to repeat exactly the same journey that someone else has made
Sense.EXAMPLE: We shall be retracing the route taken by Marco Polo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将重走马可·波罗走过的路线。

Sense.DEF: to find out where someone went
Sense.EXAMPLE: an investigation to retrace the dead man’s last known movements
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弄清死者最后行踪的调查

Sense.DEF: if you retract something that you said or agreed, you say that you did not mean it
Sense.TRAN: 收回﹐撤销〔已说的话或已答应的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He confessed to the murder but later retracted his statement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他承认谋杀﹐但后来又翻供了。

Sense.DEF: if part of a machine or an animal’s body retracts or is retracted, it moves back into the main part
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sea otter can retract the claws on its front feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海獭能缩回前掌上的爪子。

Sense.DEF: a retractable part of something can be pulled back into the main part
Sense.EXAMPLE: a knife with a retractable blade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把刀片可收起的刀

Sense.DEF: an official statement that something which you said previously is not true
Sense.TRAN: 〔对以前所说的话的〕正式收回[撤销]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The newspaper was forced to publish a retraction of its allegations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家报纸被迫发表声明收回指控。

Sense.DEF: the act of pulling one part of something back inside the main part
to learn or to teach someone the skills that are needed to do a different job
Sense.TRAN: 〔为从事新工作而〕接受再培训﹔对…再训练
Sense.EXAMPLE: One solution is to retrain the long-term unemployed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个解决办法是对长期失业的人进行再培训。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s hoping to retrain as a teacher.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她希望接受再培训当老师。

Sense.DEF: an old tyre which is given a new rubber surface
something that is made or done again, with a few changes added – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔只作少量改变的〕翻版〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: retreads of old TV shows
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新瓶旧酒的电视节目

Sense.DEF: someone who has been trained to do work which is different from what they did before
to move away from the enemy after being defeated in battle
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rebels retreated to the mountains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛乱分子撤退到山区。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were attacked and forced to retreat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们受到攻击﹐被迫撤退。

Sense.DEF: written

Subsense.DEF: to move away from someone or something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He saw her and retreated, too shy to speak to her.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看到她就躲开了﹐不好意思跟她讲话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Perry lit the fuse and retreated to a safe distance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 佩里点燃导火线﹐退至安全距离。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was not a conscious choice to retreat from public life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 退出公众生活并非有意为之。

Subsense.DEF: if an area of water, snow, or land retreats, it gradually gets smaller
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The flood waters are slowly retreating.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洪水正在慢慢退去。

Sense.DEF: to decide not to do something you were planning to do, because it was unpopular or too difficult

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Canadian government has retreated from a plan to kill 300 wolves.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加拿大政府取消了要杀死300头狼的计划。

Sense.DEF: to go away to a place that is quiet or safe

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After the noise of the city he was glad to retreat to his hotel room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经历了城市的喧嚣﹐他乐得躲进酒店的客房里。

Sense.DEF: to ignore what is happening around you and give all your attention to your private thoughts
if shares etc retreat, their value falls to a lower level
a movement away from the enemy after a defeat in battle
Sense.EXAMPLE: Napoleon’s retreat from Moscow
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拿破仑从莫斯科的撤退
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rebel forces are in full retreat retreating very fast .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛军全线溃退。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bugler sounded the retreat gave a loud signal for retreat .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 司号兵吹响撤退号。

Sense.DEF: a movement away from someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ten thousand years ago the ice began its retreat from Scotland.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一万年以前冰开始从苏格兰消退。

Sense.DEF: to leave a place quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw my aunt coming and beat a hasty retreat .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到我姨妈来了﹐便赶快离开。

Sense.DEF: when you change your mind about something because your idea was unpopular or too difficult

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a retreat from hard-line policies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 放弃强硬政策

Sense.DEF: a place you can go to that is quiet or safe
Sense.EXAMPLE: a country retreat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乡村静居所

Sense.DEF: a period of time that you spend praying or studying religion in a quiet place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I spent three weeks on retreat in Scotland.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在苏格兰静修了三个星期。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which the value of shares etc falls to a lower level
if a government or organization retrenches, it spends less money
a process of judging a law case in court again
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jury was dismissed and the judge ordered a retrial.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团被解散﹐法官下令复审案件。

Sense.DEF: severe punishment for something very serious

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Victims are demanding retribution for the terrorist attacks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 受害者要求严惩恐怖袭击行为。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上帝的惩罚

Sense.DEF: the process of getting back information stored on a computer system
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new system that should speed up information retrieval
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能加速信息检索的新系统

Sense.DEF: the act of getting back something you have lost or left somewhere
if a situation is beyond retrieval, it has become so bad that it cannot be made right again
to find something and bring it back
Sense.EXAMPLE: She bent down to retrieve her earring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她俯身去捡回耳环。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It took four days to retrieve all the bodies from the crash.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 花了四天时间才找回所有遇难者的尸体。

Sense.DEF: to get back information that has been stored in the memory of a computer
Sense.TRAN: 检索〔储存于计算机的信息〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new version of the software automatically retrieves digital information.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新版软件会自动检索数字信息。

Sense.DEF: to make a situation satisfactory again after there has been a serious mistake or problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: The general made one last desperate effort to retrieve the situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将军为挽回局面而孤注一掷。

Sense.DEF: a type of dog that can be trained to find and bring back birds that its owner has shot
Sense.TRAN: 〔经训练会衔回猎物的〕寻回犬

Sense.DEF: based on styles of fashion and design from the recent past
Sense.TRAN: 〔时装和设计〕复旧的﹐重新流行的﹐回归的
Sense.EXAMPLE: retro ’60s fashions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回归60年代的时尚

Sense.DEF:
a
retrospective
back towards the past or an earlier state
Sense.EXAMPLE: retroactive legislation laws which have an effect on things already done
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有追溯效力的法规
Sense.EXAMPLE: a retrograde step returning to a worse state
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 退步

Sense.DEF: a law or decision that is retroactive is effective from a particular date in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: a retroactive pay increase
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 补发的加薪

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The legislation is retroactive to 1st June.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条法规可溯及6月1日。

Sense.DEF: to improve a machine, piece of equipment, building etc by putting new and better parts in it after it has been used for some time
Sense.TRAN: 〔给机器﹑设备〕安装〔新部件〕﹔对…进行翻新改良
Sense.EXAMPLE: plans to retrofit oil boilers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 翻新改进燃油锅炉的计划

Sense.DEF: a retroflex speech sound is made with the end of your tongue pointing backwards and upwards
involving a return to an earlier and worse situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The closure of the factories is seen as a retrograde step .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工厂的关闭被认为是一个退步。

Sense.DEF: moving backwards
returning to an earlier and worse situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: retrogressive legislation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 倒退的法规

Sense.DEF: thinking back to a time in the past, especially with the advantage of knowing more now than you did then
Sense.EXAMPLE: In retrospect, I wonder if we should have done more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回过头看﹐我在想我们是否应该做得更多些。

Sense.DEF: thinking about the past
related to or thinking about the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: a retrospective study of 110 patients
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对110名病人进行的回溯研究

Sense.DEF: a law or decision that is retrospective is effective from a particular date in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: retrospective legislation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有追溯效力的法规
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teachers settled for a 4.2% pay rise with retrospective effect from 1 April.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师最后接受了4.2%的加薪幅度﹐追溯到4月1日生效。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The new rule will be applied retrospectively.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的规定将具有追溯效力。

Sense.DEF:
a show of the work of an
artist
, actor,
film-maker
etc that includes examples of all the kinds of work they have done
Sense.TRAN: 〔画家﹑演员﹑电影制作人等作品的〕回顾展
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Hitchcock retrospective
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希区柯克电影回顾展

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a retrospective of painter Hans Hofmann
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 画家汉斯·霍夫曼作品回顾展

Sense.DEF:
a
virus
of a type that includes some
cancer
viruses and the
aids
virus, but that also has a quality that makes it useful for
genetic engineering
to judge a person or a law case again in court
to do an action on a computer again after it has failed

a Greek wine that tastes of the
resin juice
of certain trees
to go or come back to a place where you were before
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was forty five minutes before she returned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了45分钟她才回来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you planning to return to Spain?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你打算回西班牙吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have just returned from five months in Zimbabwe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在津巴布韦待了五个月﹐刚刚回来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Alison decided to return home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾利森决定回家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He left his country, never to return.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他离开了祖国﹐一去不复返。

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of return, get/go/come back, and get/go/come home in spoken and written English. return﹐get/go/come back和get/go/come home在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。

This graph shows that it is much more usual in spoken English to use get/go/come back or get/go/come home rather than return. Return is much more common in written English than in spoken English.本图表显示﹐在英语口语中﹐get/go/come back和get/go/come home比return常用得多。return更常用于英语书面语中﹐在英语口语中用得较少。

Sense.DEF: to give or send something back, or to put something back in its place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Carson returned the notebook to his pocket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡森把笔记本放回口袋。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I returned the books to the library unread.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些书我没看就还给了图书馆。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Please complete the enclosed application form and return it in the envelope attached.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请填好随信所附的申请表并用所附信封寄回。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that they take something back , put it back , or bring it back , rather than return it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐表示送回﹑放回或拿回﹐人们一般说take back, put back或bring back﹐而不说return
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He put the key back in his pocket.
Did you take the books back to the library?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把书还回图书馆了吗？

Sense.DEF: if a feeling, situation etc returns, it starts to exist or happen again
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the pain returns, take two of the tablets with some water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果疼痛再次出现﹐就用水吞服两片药。
Sense.EXAMPLE: David could feel his anger returning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维感觉自己的怒气又上来了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: when peace finally returns to this country
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当这个国家终于恢复和平时

Sense.DEF: to do something to someone because they have done the same thing to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: He smiled at her warmly and she returned his smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他朝她热情地笑着﹐她也回报以热情的微笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I phoned him twice on Friday and left messages, but he never returned my call he didn’t phone me .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我星期五给他打了两次电话﹐还留了言﹐但他根本没有给我回电话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thanks very much. I’ll return the favour do something to help you some day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常感谢﹐总有一天我会报答你的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police did not return fire shoot back at someone who shot at them .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察没有开枪还击。

Sense.DEF: to answer someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Yes,’ he returned. ‘I’m a lucky man.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “是的。”他回答道﹐ “我是个幸运的人。”

Sense.DEF: to hit the ball back to your opponent in a game such as tennis
to elect someone to a political position, especially to represent you in parliament
Sense.TRAN: 选举﹐推选〔尤指议会议员〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Yeo was returned to Parliament with an increased majority.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约以更大的票数优势当选议会议员。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At the election, she was returned as MP for Brighton.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这次选举中﹐她当选为代表布赖顿市的下议院议员。

Sense.DEF:
when a
jury
return their
verdict
, they say whether someone is guilty or not
to make a profit
Sense.EXAMPLE: The group returned increased profits last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该集团去年获得了更高的利润。

Exponent.DEF: to go back or come back to a place where you were before. Return sounds more formal than go back or come back , and is more commonly used in written English.
Exponent.TRAN: 返回﹐回来﹐回去〔return听上去比go back和come back正式﹐更常用于英语书面语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She returned to the hotel hoping to find a message.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她回到酒店﹐希望会有留言。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Alastair returned from the office late that night.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天晚上阿拉斯泰尔很晚才从办公室回来。

Exponent.DEF: to go to the place where you were before, or to the place where you usually live
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s cold out here – shall we go back inside?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 外面冷﹐我们回屋去好吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When are you going back to Japan?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你什么时候回日本？

Exponent.DEF: to go to your home again, or to the country where you were born, after you have been away from it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I did a bit of shopping and then went home.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我买了点东西﹐然后回家。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Are you going home to Hong Kong when the course finishes?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 课程结束后你会回香港吗？

Exponent.DEF: to come to the place where you are again, after going away from it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll be away for two days – coming back on Thursday night.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要出去两天﹐星期四晚上回来。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s just come back from a vacation in Miami.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他刚从迈阿密度假回来。

Exponent.DEF: to arrive somewhere where you were before, especially your home or the place where you are staying
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We got back at about 9 o’clock.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们9点左右回来的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She couldn’t wait to get back to London.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她等不及要回伦敦了。

Exponent.DEF: to turn around and go back in the direction you came from
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We took the wrong road and had to turn back.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们走错了路﹐只得掉头回去。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He ordered the soldiers to turn back and march south.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他命令士兵调转方向﹐往南行进。

Sense.DEF: to change back to a previous state or situation, or to change something back
Sense.EXAMPLE: David waited for a moment to let his breathing return to normal .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维等了一会儿﹐让呼吸恢复正常。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new chairman made the cuts necessary to return the company to profitability.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新任董事长作了必要的开支削减﹐以使公司恢复赢利。

Sense.DEF: to start doing an activity, job etc that you were doing before you stopped or were interrupted
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nicholas looked up, grinned, then returned to his newspaper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼古拉斯抬起头﹐咧嘴笑了笑﹐然后继续看他的报纸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children return to school next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子下星期开学。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ellie needed to return to work soon after the birth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃莉生下孩子后需要马上回去上班。

Sense.DEF: to start discussing or dealing with a subject that you have already mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 再讨论﹐重新处理〔某个主题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I will return to this problem in a moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我马上就会再谈这个问题。

Sense.DEF: the act of returning from somewhere, or your arrival back in a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re all looking forward to your return!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都盼着你回来！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I need to know the date of her return from Europe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要知道她从欧洲回来的日期。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Malcolm decided to delay his return to York.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马尔科姆决定推迟返回约克的时间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On his return from Canada, he joined the army.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从加拿大回来就参军了。

Sense.DEF: the act of giving, putting, or sending something back

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A mother is appealing for the safe return of her baby son.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位母亲在恳求把她那还是婴孩的儿子安全送还。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Police have arranged for the return of the stolen goods.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察已经安排好赃物的归还工作。

Sense.DEF: a change back to a previous state or situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The United States called for a return to democracy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国呼吁恢复民主制度。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a return to normal
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 回复正常

Sense.DEF: when someone starts an activity again after they had stopped

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rose’s return to the teaching profession
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗丝重返教职
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jean is well enough now to consider her return to work .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼现在身体好多了﹐可以考虑回去上班。

Sense.DEF: the amount of profit that you get from something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The markets are showing extremely poor returns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场现在回报极差。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How can you get the best return on your investment?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你如何让你的投资得到最大的回报？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The returns from farming are declining.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 农耕的收益在下降。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The average rates of return were 15%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平均回报率为15%。

Sense.DEF: as payment or reward for something
Sense.TRAN: 作为（某事物的）报酬﹔作为（某事物的）回报
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is always helping people without expecting anything in return.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直在不求任何回报地帮助他人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We offer an excellent all-round education to our students. In return, we expect students to work hard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们向学生提供优质全面的教育﹐同时也希望学生努力学习。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liz agreed to look after the baby in return for a free room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利兹同意照看婴儿﹐条件是要有一间免费房间。

Sense.DEF: when a feeling, situation etc starts to exist or happen again

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt a return of her old anxiety.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感觉原来的那种焦虑又回来了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: David had noticed the return of worrying symptoms in the last few days.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近几天戴维注意到令人担心的症状又出现了。

Sense.DEF: the key that you press on a computer at the end of an instruction or to move to a new line
Sense.EXAMPLE: Key in the file name and press return.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 键入文档名﹐然后按回车键。

Sense.DEF: a statement giving written information in reply to official questions
Sense.EXAMPLE: an analysis of the 1851 census returns
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对1851年人口普查报告的分析

Sense.DEF: a vote in an election
Sense.EXAMPLE: What are the returns from last night’s voting?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚的投票结果如何？

Sense.DEF: if you reply to a letter by return, you send your reply almost immediately
a ticket for a journey from one place to another and back again
used or paid for a journey from one place to another and back again
Sense.EXAMPLE: a return ticket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来回票
Sense.EXAMPLE: a return fare
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来回票价

Sense.DEF: something that is returnable can be taken back to a shop and used again
an amount of money that is returnable will be given back to you later
Sense.EXAMPLE: a returnable deposit of £50
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可退还的50英镑押金

Sense.DEF: the address of the person who is sending a letter or package, that is written on the envelope or package
a person who returns to their own country after living in another country
someone who goes back to work after a long time away, especially a woman who left work to look after her children
Sense.TRAN: 重返工作者〔尤指曾因照顾子女而离职的妇女〕

Sense.DEF: the official in each town or area of Britain who arranges an election to Parliament and announces the result
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国城镇或地区的〕议会选举监察官

Sense.DEF: the second of two matches that are played by the same teams or players
Sense.TRAN: 〔相同对手间的〕第二回合比赛

Sense.DEF: a visit to someone who has visited you, or to a place where you have been before
to join the parts of something together again, especially a country that was divided
Sense.TRAN: 使〔尤指曾分裂的国家〕重新统一

Sense.DEF: a social meeting of people who have not met for a long time, especially people who were at school or college together
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指同学久别后的〕聚会﹐重聚联欢会
Sense.EXAMPLE: an annual reunion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一年一度的聚会
Sense.EXAMPLE: a family reunion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭聚会
Sense.EXAMPLE: a high-school reunion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高中同学联谊聚会

Sense.DEF: when people are brought together again after a period of being separated

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Joseph’s eventual reunion with his brother
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约瑟夫和他弟弟的最终团聚

Sense.DEF: to come together again or to bring people, parts of an organization, political party, or country together again
Sense.TRAN: （使）再联合﹐（使）重新结合﹔（使）重聚

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children were finally reunited with their families.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们终于和家人重聚了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The band will reunite for a US tour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队将重聚作美国巡演。

Sense.DEF: to use something again
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bottles are designed to be reused up to 20 times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些瓶子最多可供重复使用20次。

Sense.DEF: if you rev an engine, or if an engine revs, you make it work faster
if you rev up a system or organization, or if it revs up, it becomes more active

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They are revving up for one of the biggest fund-raising events ever organized.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在积极筹备最大的募捐活动中的一场。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Investors keep putting money in U.S. companies, revving up the economy even more.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 投资者持续投资美国公司﹐更加促进了经济的发展。

Sense.DEF: a complete turn of a wheel or engine part, used as a unit for measuring the speed of an engine
Sense.TRAN: 〔轮子或发动机的〕旋转一周〔转速单位〕

Sense.DEF: a title used before the name of a minister of the Christian church
Sense.TRAN: 牧师〔对基督教教士的称谓﹐用于姓名前〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rev D Macleod
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: D. 麦克劳德牧师

Sense.DEF: to examine something again in order to calculate its present value
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s land has been revalued at £16.9m.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的土地重新估价为1,690万英镑。

Sense.DEF: to increase the value of a country’s money in relation to that of other countries
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dollar has just been revalued.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美元刚刚升值。

Sense.DEF: to change something in order to improve it and make it seem more modern
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many older companies are revamping their image.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多老牌公司都在更新公司形象。

Sense.DEF:
a British form of
rev
to make known something that was previously secret or unknown
Sense.EXAMPLE: He may be prosecuted for revealing secrets about the security agency.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他可能因泄露安全部门的机密而被起诉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a test that can reveal a teacher’s hidden skills
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能够展现老师潜在技能的测试

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He revealed that he had been in prison twice before.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他透露自己曾两次入狱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The violinist revealed himself as a talented interpreter of classical music.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位小提琴手显示了演绎古典音乐的卓越才能。

Sense.DEF: to show something that was previously hidden
Sense.EXAMPLE: The curtain opened to reveal the grand prize.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大幕拉开﹐大奖展现在眼前。

Exponent.DEF: to let someone know about something that is secret or has not been known until now
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Doctors are not allowed to reveal confidential information.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生不得透露保密的信息。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was revealed that he had smoked marijuana at college.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人透露说他在大学里吸过大麻。

Exponent.DEF: to talk about something to someone, so that they know about it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Don’t tell anyone about this just yet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事现在谁也不能告诉。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Shall I tell you a secret?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 跟你说个秘密好吗？

Exponent.DEF: to publicly reveal something such as a fact or a name that has been kept secret
Exponent.TRAN: 泄露﹔公开〔被隐瞒的事实﹑姓名等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The terms of the agreement have not yet been disclosed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 协议条款尚未披露。

Exponent.DEF: to reveal important or personal information which was previously secret or unknown
Exponent.TRAN: 泄露〔重要的或个人的秘密信息〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bank has refused to divulge its plans.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行拒绝透露其计划。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid I cannot divulge what was said to me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕我不能把他们跟我说的话泄露出去。

Exponent.DEF: to tell people about important information, especially after it has been kept secret
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Apparently they were engaged for some time before making it public.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然﹐他们订婚一段时间之后才将此公开。

Exponent.DEF: to deliberately give secret information to a newspaper, television company etc, when a government or other organization wants to keep it secret
Exponent.TRAN: 透露〔政府等机构的秘密给报纸﹑电视台等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The contents of the email were leaked to the press.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子邮件内容被人透露给了新闻界。

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone something that you want to keep secret
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was careful not to give away any trade secrets.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他非常谨慎﹐以免泄露生意上的秘密。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m not going to give away how much I paid for it!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不会透露我的买价！

Exponent.DEF: to accidentally tell someone about something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He let slip that he was envious of his older brother.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他无意中说出自己嫉妒哥哥。

Sense.DEF: a remark or event that is revealing shows you something interesting or surprising about a situation or someone’s character
Sense.EXAMPLE: a revealing insight into her life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对她生活经历的深刻揭示

Sense.DEF: revealing clothes allow parts of your body to be seen which are usually kept covered
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very revealing dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常暴露的连衣裙

Sense.DEF: a special tune played as a signal to wake soldiers in the morning, or the time at which it is played
Sense.TRAN: 〔军队的〕起床号﹔吹起床号的时间

Sense.DEF: to spend time dancing, eating, drinking etc, especially at a party
to enjoy something very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: He revelled in his new-found fame.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新近成名令他飘飘然。

Sense.DEF: a surprising fact about someone or something that was previously secret and is now made known
Sense.TRAN: 被揭露[披露]的（惊人）真相

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He resigned after revelations about his affair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因私情被揭发而辞职。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: startling revelations about his background
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被揭露出来的有关他背景的惊人真相

GramExa.EXAMPLE: revelations that two senior officers had lied in court
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名高官被曝在法庭上说谎的事实

Sense.DEF: the act of suddenly making known a surprising fact that had previously been secret

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the revelation of previously unknown facts
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 之前不为人知的事实的披露

Sense.DEF: something that is surprisingly good, enjoyable, or useful
Sense.TRAN: 出乎意料的好东西[乐趣﹐用处]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Alice Walker’s novel was a real revelation to me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾丽斯·沃克的小说真使我大开眼界。

Sense.DEF: an event, experience etc that is considered to be a message from God

RunOn.EXAMPLE: His playing has many moments of revelatory insights.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的演奏有许多地方都体现出深悟的理解。

Sense.DEF: someone who is having fun singing, dancing etc in a noisy way
wild noisy dancing, eating, drinking etc, usually to celebrate something
Sense.TRAN: 狂欢﹐欢宴作乐〔通常为庆祝某事〕

Sense.DEF: something you do in order to punish someone who has harmed or offended you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She wanted revenge for the insult.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想报受辱之仇。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At his wife’s funeral, he vowed revenge against her killer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在妻子的葬礼上﹐他发誓要报复杀害她的凶手。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a bomb attack in revenge for the imprisonment of the terrorists
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为报复恐怖分子被囚禁而发动的炸弹袭击

Sense.DEF: the defeat of someone who has previously defeated you in a sport
Sense.TRAN: 雪耻〔指在比赛中战胜曾击败自己的对手〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Australians took revenge for their defeat here last time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 澳大利亚队报了上次在这里被击败的一箭之仇。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a revenge match
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雪耻之战

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He dreamed of taking revenge on his father’s killers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他梦想着报复杀父凶手。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Louise eventually got her revenge by reporting him to the immigration service.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 路易斯向移民局举报他﹐终于报了仇。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: One day I’ll have my revenge.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 总有一天我会报仇的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: take revenge
promise to take revenge

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Caesar returned to Rome to exact a terrible revenge.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 恺撒回到罗马进行疯狂的报复。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The camp was burned down, apparently in a revenge attack.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 营地被烧毁﹐显然是报复性袭击。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The men were shot dead in an act of revenge for Khan’s assassination.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了给遇刺的可汗报仇﹐就将这些人枪杀了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: said when someone feels good because they have got revenge
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It took me a long time, but revenge is sweet.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我花了很长时间﹐不过复仇是甜蜜的。

Sense.DEF: to punish someone who has done something to harm you or someone else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The terrorist group is still looking to revenge itself on its attackers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖组织仍在寻找时机报复攻击者。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The poor murdered girl must be revenged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要为被害的可怜女孩报仇。

Sense.DEF: money that a business or organization receives over a period of time, especially from selling goods or services
Sense.EXAMPLE: advertising revenue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 广告收入
Sense.EXAMPLE: Strikes have cost £20 million in lost revenues .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罢工造成的收入损失达到2,000万英镑。

Sense.DEF: money that the government receives from tax
Sense.EXAMPLE: an increase in tax revenues of 8.4%
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 8.4%的税收增长

Sense.DEF: if a loud sound reverberates, it is heard many times as it is sent back from different surfaces

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bang reverberated through the house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 砰的一声响彻整栋房子。

Sense.DEF: if a room, building etc reverberates, it seems to shake because of a loud sound
Sense.TRAN: 〔房间﹑建筑物等因巨响而〕震荡

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The room reverberated with laughter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里笑声回荡。

Sense.DEF: if an event, action, or idea reverberates, it has a strong effect over a wide area and for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔事件﹑活动或思想〕产生广泛而长久的影响

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The events of 9/11 will reverberate through history.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “九一一”事件将在历史过程中产生持续影响。

Sense.DEF: a severe effect that is caused by a particular event and continues for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: the scandal’s political reverberations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丑闻的政治影响

Sense.DEF: a loud sound that is heard again and again as it is sent back from different surfaces
to respect and admire someone or something very much

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is revered as a national hero.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被尊为民族英雄。

Sense.DEF: great respect and admiration for someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: reverence for tradition
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对传统的尊重

Sense.DEF: a minister of a Christian church
a title of respect used before the name of a minister in the Christian church
Sense.TRAN: 牧师〔对基督教牧师的尊称﹐用于姓名前〕

Sense.DEF:
a title of respect for the woman in charge of a
convent
Sense.TRAN: 女院长〔对女修道院主管的尊称〕

Sense.DEF: showing a lot of respect and admiration
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hushed reverent voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毕恭毕敬的低语声

Sense.DEF: showing a lot of respect and admiration
Sense.TRAN: 充满敬意的﹐恭敬的﹐满怀崇敬的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spoke in reverential tones.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说话时语气恭敬。

Sense.DEF: a state of imagining or thinking about pleasant things, that is like dreaming
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was startled out of her reverie by a loud crash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哗啦一声巨响把她从幻想中惊醒。

Sense.DEF: a change to an opposite arrangement, process, or way of doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sudden reversal of government policy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府政策的突然转变

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dramatic reversal in population decline
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人口数量下降的急剧逆转

Sense.EXAMPLE: Some Internet firms have suffered a painful reversal of fortune they were successful but now they are not .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些网络公司遭逢厄运。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some carers and dependants find it difficult to adapt to a role reversal .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些照料者和被照料者觉得难以适应角色对换。

Sense.DEF: a failure or other problem that prevents you from being able to do what you want
Sense.TRAN: 〔使人不能达到目的的〕失败﹐麻烦﹐厄运
Sense.EXAMPLE: In spite of setbacks and reversals, his business was at last making money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管有挫折和失败﹐他的生意最后还是赚了钱。

Sense.DEF: to change something, such as a decision, judgment, or process so that it is the opposite of what it was before
Sense.TRAN: 推翻﹐彻底改变〔决定﹑判决﹑过程等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The decision was reversed on appeal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个判决上诉后被撤销了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: More changes are required to reverse the trend towards centralised power.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要想扭转权力集中的趋势就得进行更多的改革。

Sense.DEF: if a vehicle or its driver reverses, they go backwards

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bob reversed into a parking space.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍勃把车倒进一个车位。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I reversed the car into a side road.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把车倒着驶进一条旁道。

Sense.DEF: to change around the usual order of the parts of something, or the usual things two people do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our roles as child and guardian had now been reversed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们作为孩子和监护人的角色现在对换了。

Sense.DEF: to turn something over or around, in order to show the back of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reverse the paper in the printer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把打印机中的纸翻过来。

Sense.DEF: to change your opinion or position in an argument
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly, he reversed himself completely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然﹐他彻底改变了立场。

Sense.DEF: to make a telephone call which is paid for by the person you are telephoning
the exact opposite of what has just been mentioned

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I didn’t mean to insult her – quite the reverse in fact, I meant to praise her .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没想侮辱她——其实我是想赞扬她。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I owe you nothing. If anything, the reverse is true you owe me .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不欠你什么。 如果说欠的话﹐是你欠我才对。

Sense.DEF: in the opposite way to normal or to the previous situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: US video recorders cannot play European tapes, and the same applies in reverse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国录像机不能播放欧洲制造的录像带﹐反之亦然。

Sense.LEXUNIT: go into reverse/put sth into reverse
Sense.DEF: to start to happen or to make something happen in the opposite way
Sense.TRAN: 发生逆转/使某事发生逆转
Sense.EXAMPLE: The incident threatened to put the peace process into reverse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一事件可能会使和平进程发生逆转。

Sense.DEF:
the position of the
gear s
in a vehicle that makes it go backwards

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Put the car into reverse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把车挂上倒挡。

Sense.DEF: a defeat or a problem that delays your plans
Sense.EXAMPLE: Losing the Senate vote was a serious reverse for the President.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参议院中的投票失利对总统来说是一个重大挫折。

Sense.DEF: the less important side or the back of an object that has two sides

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The British ten-pence coin has a lion on the reverse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国十便士硬币的背面图案是一头狮子。

Sense.DEF: the opposite order etc to what is usual or to what has just been stated
Sense.TRAN: 相反的顺序/局势/过程等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The results were read out in reverse order with the worst first and the best last .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成绩是按逆序宣读的。

Sense.DEF: the back of something
the practice of giving unfair treatment to a group of people who usually have advantages, in order to be fair to the group of people who were unfairly treated in the past
Sense.TRAN: 逆向歧视〔为了公平对待过去受歧视的团体而以不公平的方式对待通常占优势的团体〕

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a product is examined to see how it is made, so that it can be copied
Sense.TRAN: 反向工程﹐逆向工程﹐倒序制造〔指研究某种产品的结构继而进行仿制〕

Sense.DEF:
the position of the
gear s
in a vehicle that makes it go backwards
the idea that things that well-educated or upper-class people like must be bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a lot of reverse snobbery about opera.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 歌剧因拥有高端受众而常常受到抱有反向势利心态者的鄙薄。

Sense.DEF: a change that is reversible can be changed back to how it was before
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of chemical reactions are reversible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多化学反应都是可逆的。

Sense.DEF: a piece of clothing or material that is reversible can be worn with either side showing on the outside
Sense.TRAN: 可两面穿的﹐正反两用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a reversible jacket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可两面穿的夹克

Sense.DEF: a light on the back of a car which comes on when the car is going backwards
a return to a former condition or habit
Sense.TRAN: 〔以前情况或习惯的〕恢复﹐回复

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the country’s reversion to a traditional monarchy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国恢复传统的君主制

Sense.DEF: the return of property to a former owner
to change back to a situation that existed in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city reverted to its former name of St Petersburg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该市恢复了原名圣彼得堡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a few weeks, everything reverted to normal .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个星期后﹐一切恢复正常。

Sense.DEF: to return to an earlier subject of conversation
Sense.EXAMPLE: To revert to the question of exams, I’d like to explain further.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回到考试的问题﹐我想再解释一下。

Sense.DEF: if land or a building reverts to its former owner, it becomes their property again
a surface of stone or other building material added for strength to a wall that holds back loose earth, water etc
a careful examination of a situation or process

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She sent us her review of the research.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把她对这个研究所作的审查结果送交给我们。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company hired Bob to conduct an independent review of their workplace procedures.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司聘请鲍勃对他们的工作规程进行独立审查。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Teachers’ Pay Review Body
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师薪资评审机关

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re keeping this policy under review we are continuing to examine it .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们继续审议这项政策。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The policy comes up for review will be reviewed in April.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项政策将在4月份予以审议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All fees are subject to reviewmay be reviewed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有费用有待审查。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Crowther asked for judicial review of the decisionan examination of the decision by a judge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克劳瑟先生要求对判决进行司法审查。

Sense.DEF: an article in a newspaper or magazine that gives an opinion about a new book, play, film etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔报纸或杂志上的〕评论（文章）﹔书评﹔剧评﹔影评
Sense.EXAMPLE: a film review
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影评

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The paper published a review of her book.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸刊登了一篇对她的书的评论。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The band’s new album has had very good reviews.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队的新专辑备受好评。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The film opened to rave reviews reviews that praised it a lot .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影好评如潮。

Sense.DEF: the work of writing reviews for a newspaper or magazine

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book was sent to the press for review in September.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书9月份送到报社供评论。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The journal receives review copies free copies to review of most new software products.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家杂志会收到大多数新软件产品的赠样以作评论之用。

Sense.DEF: a report on a series of events or a period of time, that mentions the most important parts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a review of the year
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这一年的回顾

Sense.DEF: an official show of the army, navy etc so that a king, president, or officer of high rank can see them
Sense.EXAMPLE: a naval review
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海军检阅

Sense.DEF: to examine, consider, and judge a situation or process carefully in order to see if changes are necessary
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will review your situation and decide how we can help you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会研究你的情况﹐然后决定如何帮助你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The decision will be reviewed by the Supreme Court.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个判决将由最高法院复核。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team manager’s position will be reviewed at the end of the season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队主教练的人选将在赛季末重新考虑。

Sense.DEF: to write a short article describing and judging a new book, play, film etc
Sense.TRAN: 给〔书﹑戏剧﹑电影等〕写评论
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bradman will review the best of the new children’s books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布拉德曼将为这些新的儿童读物中最优秀的作品撰写书评。

Sense.DEF: to look again at something you have studied, such as notes, reports etc
to examine and describe the most important parts of a series of events or period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a journalist who will review the events of the past six months
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将对过去六个月里所发生的事件进行回顾的记者

Sense.DEF: to officially watch a group of soldiers, ships etc at a military show
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President will review the soldiers on parade.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统将检阅士兵。

Sense.DEF: someone who writes about new books, plays, films etc in a newspaper or magazine
Sense.TRAN: 〔新书﹑新戏剧﹑新电影等的〕评论家

Sense.DEF: to express hatred of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President was now reviled by the same party he had helped to lead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今谩骂总统的正是他曾经协助领导的那个政党。

Sense.DEF: to change something because of new information or ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: The college has revised its plans because of local objections.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于地方上的反对﹐学院已经修改了计划。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have revised our estimates of population growth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已修正了对人口增长的估计。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Forecasts of economic growth are being revised downwards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济增长的预测正在下调。

Sense.DEF: to study facts again, in order to learn them before an examination
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got to revise my geography.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得复习一下地理。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s revising for her history exam.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她正在温习﹐准备历史考试。

Sense.DEF: to change a piece of writing by adding new information, making improvements, or correcting mistakes
Sense.EXAMPLE: A couple of sections of the book will need to be revised.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书部分章节需要修订。

Sense.DEF: the process of changing something in order to improve it by correcting it or including new information or ideas

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The judge wants to see a revision of the procedures.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官希望对程序进行修改。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m making some revisions to the book for the new edition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正在对这本书进行修订﹐准备出新版。
