Sense.DEF: a piece of writing that has been improved and corrected
the work of studying facts again in order to learn them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know I haven’t done enough revision for tomorrow’s exam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道我对明天的考试准备不足。

Sense.DEF: ideas which are changing away from the main beliefs of a political system, especially a Marxist system
Sense.TRAN: 修正主义〔尤指对马克思主义的篡改〕

Sense.DEF: to return to a place you once knew well
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ten years later, I revisited the school to find out what had changed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十年后﹐我重回学校﹐看看它的变化。

Sense.DEF: to consider or discuss something again
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to revisit this proposal as soon as the budget is clearer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一旦预算更明确了﹐我们就需要重新讨论这个提案。

Sense.DEF: to put new strength or power into something
Sense.TRAN: 使恢复元气﹐给…注入新的活力
Sense.EXAMPLE: They hope to revitalize the neighborhood by providing better housing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们希望通过提供更好的住房条件使这个社区恢复活力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a revitalizing massage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让人恢复精神的按摩

Sense.DEF: a process in which something becomes active or strong again
Sense.EXAMPLE: The US and the UK have expectations of economic revival.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国和英国对经济复苏有所期待。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A revival of the timber industry is needed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 木材工业需要复兴。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There has been a revival of interest in Picasso’s work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 毕加索的作品重获关注。

Sense.DEF: when something becomes popular again

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the recent revival in medieval music
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近中世纪音乐的再度流行
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a revival of organized religion
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有组织的宗教的再次兴起

Sense.EXAMPLE: Traditional English food seems to be enjoying a revival at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这阵子传统的英国菜似乎又流行了。

Sense.DEF: a new production of a play that has not been performed for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Neeson was excellent in a revival of Eugene O’Neill’s ‘Anna Christie’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在尤金·奥尼尔《安娜·克丽丝蒂》的重排剧中﹐尼森演得非常出色。

Sense.DEF:
a
revival meeting
organ-ized attempts to make a religion more popular
a public religious meeting with music, famous speakers etc, which is intended to make people interested in Christianity
to bring something back after it has not been used or has not existed for a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Local people have decided to revive this centuries-old tradition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地人决定复兴这一延续了数个世纪的传统。

Sense.DEF: to become healthy and strong again, or to make someone or something healthy and strong again
Sense.EXAMPLE: The economy is beginning to revive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济开始复苏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to revive the steel industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 复苏钢铁工业的努力
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctors revived her with injections of glucose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生给她注射葡萄糖﹐使她苏醒过来。

Sense.DEF: to produce a play again after it has not been performed for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: A London theatre has decided to revive the 1950s musical ‘In Town’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦的一家剧院决定重新排演20世纪50年代的音乐剧《在镇上》。

Sense.DEF: to give new life and health to someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 使恢复活力﹐使恢复生气
Sense.EXAMPLE: The aim was to strengthen and revivify the Labour Party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目的是要让工党强盛起来﹐恢复活力。

Sense.DEF: the act of revoking a law, decision, or agreement
Sense.TRAN: 〔法律﹑决定或协议的〕废除﹐撤销﹐取消

Sense.DEF: to officially state that a law, decision, or agreement is no longer effective
Sense.TRAN: 废除﹐取消〔法律﹑决定或协议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their work permits have been revoked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的工作许可证被吊销了。

Sense.DEF: a refusal to accept someone’s authority or obey rules or laws
Sense.TRAN: 〔对权威﹑规定或法律的〕反抗﹐违抗
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prime minister is now facing a revolt by members of his own party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相现在面临着党内倒戈。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a revolt against authority
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对权威的反抗

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a revolt over the proposed spending cuts
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对缩减开支提案的反对

GramExa.EXAMPLE: French farmers are in revolt over cheap imports.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国农场主正在抵制廉价的进口产品。

Sense.DEF: strong and often violent action by a lot of people against their ruler or government
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Polish revolt of 1863
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1863年的波兰起义

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a revolt against the central government
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对中央政府的反叛

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the successful revolt of the American colonies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美洲殖民地的成功反抗

GramExa.GLOSS: use military force to stop it
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Troops loyal to the President crushed the revolt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 忠于总统的军队镇压了叛乱。

Sense.DEF: if people revolt, they take strong and often violent action against the government, usually with the aim of taking power away from them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was feared that the army would revolt against the government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人担心军队会挥戈反对政府。

Sense.DEF: to refuse to accept someone’s authority or obey rules or laws
Sense.TRAN: 反抗﹐拒绝服从〔权威﹑规定或法律〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some members of the government may revolt against this proposed legislation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些政府成员可能会反对这项拟议中的法规。

Sense.DEF: if something revolts you, it is so unpleasant that it makes you feel sick and shocked
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was revolted by the smell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那气味让他恶心。

Sense.DEF: extremely unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 使人厌恶的﹐令人作呕的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The food was revolting!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些食物令人作呕！
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a revolting colour!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多么令人讨厌的颜色！

Sense.DEF: a complete change in ways of thinking, methods of working etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔思想﹑工作方式等的〕彻底变革﹐革命

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the last ten years there has been a revolution in education.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 近十年来﹐教育发生了巨大的变化。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the biggest social revolution we have had in this country
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们国家所经历的最大的社会变革
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the sexual revolution of the 1960s
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪60年代的性革命

Sense.DEF: a time when people change a ruler or political system by using force or violence
Sense.EXAMPLE: the French Revolution of 1789
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1789年法国大革命
Sense.EXAMPLE: The role of women has changed since the revolution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 革命以后妇女的角色已有改变。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country seems to be heading towards revolution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国似乎在走向革命。

Subsense.DEF: a circular movement around something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the planets’ revolution around the sun
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 行星围绕太阳的公转

Subsense.DEF: one complete circular spinning movement, made by something such as a wheel attached to a central point
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a speed of 100 revolutions per minute
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每分钟100转的转速

Exponent.DEF: an attempt by a large group of people at revolution

EXAMPLE.GLOSS: involving ordinary people, not the army

Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 民变

Exponent.DEF: an occasion when a group of people, especially soldiers, suddenly take control of a country
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a military coup
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 军事政变

Sense.DEF: completely new and different, especially in a way that leads to great improvements
Sense.TRAN: 革命性的﹐突破性的﹐创新的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new cancer drug is a revolutionary breakthrough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种抗癌新药是一个革命性突破。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a revolutionary new drug
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种革命性的新药

Sense.DEF: relating to a political or social revolution
Sense.EXAMPLE: a revolutionary leader
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 革命领袖

Sense.DEF: someone who joins in or supports a political or social revolution
Sense.EXAMPLE: a band of young revolutionaries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群年轻的革命者

Sense.DEF: the American Revolutionary War in which the US became independent of Britain
to completely change the way people do something or think about something
Sense.TRAN: 使彻底变革﹐给…带来革命
Sense.EXAMPLE: New technology is going to revolutionize everything we do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新科技将彻底改变我们做的每一件事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His work revolutionized the treatment of this disease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的研究成果给这种疾病的治疗带来了革命。

Sense.DEF: to move around like a wheel, or to make something move around like a wheel
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wheel began to revolve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮子开始旋转。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The restaurant slowly revolves, giving excellent views of the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 餐厅缓缓旋转﹐城市美景尽收眼底。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Using graphics software, you can revolve the image on the screen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用绘图软件可以旋转屏幕上的图像。

Sense.DEF: to have something as a main subject or purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jane’s life revolves around her children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简的生活就是围着孩子转。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The argument revolved around costs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 争论的焦点是费用问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She seems to think that the world revolves around her that she is the only important person .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她似乎认为整个世界都以她为中心。

Sense.DEF: to move in circles around something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The moon revolves around the Earth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月亮绕着地球转。

Sense.DEF: a type of small gun. The bullets are in a case which turns around as you fire the gun, so that when you fire one bullet the next bullet is ready to be fired.
a revolving object is designed so that it turns with a circular movement
Sense.EXAMPLE: The theatre has a revolving stage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剧院有个旋转舞台。

Sense.DEF: a type of door in the entrance of a large building, which goes around and around as people go through it
used to say that the people involved in a situation, organization etc change often
Sense.EXAMPLE: The park director position has been a revolving door for seven appointees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公园主管一职已经接连换了七个人。

Sense.DEF: used to say that people return to a situation, position etc often, but usually for a different reason
Sense.TRAN: 旋转门〔用于表示常常有人出于另外的原因而回到某种情形或某个位置〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: This could mean that we end up with a revolving door Congress, in which former members return as lobbyists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这可能意味着我们的国会最后成了一道旋转门﹐前任议员再度返回﹐摇身一变成了说客。

Sense.DEF: a show in a theatre that includes songs, dances, and jokes about recent events
Sense.TRAN: 〔穿插歌舞和时事讽刺的〕表演剧

Sense.DEF: a strong feeling of shock and very strong dislike
Sense.EXAMPLE: News of the atrocities produced a wave of anger and revulsion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于暴行的报道激起了愤怒和憎恶的浪潮。

Sense.DEF: something that you get because you have done something good or helpful or have worked hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school has a system of rewards and punishments to encourage good behaviour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校有奖惩制度以鼓励良好行为。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Parents often give their children rewards for passing exams.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子通过考试﹐父母常会给他们奖励。

Sense.DEF: money that is offered to people for helping the police to solve a crime or catch a criminal
Sense.TRAN: 〔要求人们协助破案或捉拿罪犯而提供的〕赏金﹐悬赏金

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A reward of $20,000 has been offered.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 已悬赏两万美元。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a reward for information leading to the capture of the murderers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 因提供情报令凶手落网而得到的赏金

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The rewards for those who invested at the right time are high.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 投资时机正确的人会得到高回报。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They have to work very hard for very little reward.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不得不辛苦工作﹐得到的报酬却非常少。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s a difficult job, but the financial rewards are considerable.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这工作很辛苦﹐但报酬很可观。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: money or possessions that you get
things that are obviously worth having
great rewards

Collocate.EXAMPLE: If you work hard, you will get your reward.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 努力就会有回报。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: get them
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She is now reaping the rewards of all her hard work.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她现在正在收获她所有的辛勤付出所带来的回报。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: cause someone to get rewards

Sense.DEF: to give something to someone because they have done something good or helpful or have worked for it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The club’s directors rewarded him with a free season ticket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 俱乐部的董事们奖给他一张免费季票。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She wanted to reward the cleaners for their efforts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想酬谢清洁工们的努力。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He gave the children some chocolate to reward them for behaving well.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给孩子们一些巧克力﹐奖励他们表现好。

Sense.DEF: to achieve something through hard work and effort
Sense.TRAN: 得到回报﹔获得 （某事物的）奖励
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team have worked hard and their efforts have been rewarded with success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队很努力﹐他们的付出收获了成功。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Finally, Molly’s patience was rewarded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫莉的耐心终于有了回报。

Sense.DEF: making you feel happy and satisfied because you feel you are doing something useful or important, even if you do not earn much money
Sense.TRAN: 值得做的﹐有益的﹐有意义的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teaching can be a very rewarding career.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教书可以是一种很有意义的职业。

Sense.DEF:
to make a
cassette
tape or
video
go backwards in order to see or hear it again
to put new electric wires in a building, machine, light etc
to say or write something again in different words, in order to make it easier to understand or more suitable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let me reword my question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我换个说法来提问。

Sense.DEF: to make changes in something such as music or a piece of writing
Sense.EXAMPLE: I plan to rework the whole song.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打算把整首歌改编一下。

Sense.DEF: to change something that has been written, especially in order to improve it, or because new information is available
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为了改进或因为有新资料而〕重写﹐改写
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll have to rewrite most of the essay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇论文大部分我都得重写。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Software packages may need complete rewrites to match new hardware.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 软件包可能需要全部重写以便与新的硬件相配。

Sense.DEF: a title used in official writing after the name of a king, when the king’s name has been written in Latin
Sense.TRAN: 王﹐君王﹐国王〔公文中用于国君拉丁文名字之后的称谓〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Henricus Rex King Henry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利国王

Sense.DEF: a word meaning the state, used in the names of law cases in Britain when a king is ruling
Sense.TRAN: 王国政府〔英国国王在位时用于讼案的名称中﹐代表国家〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rex v Jones
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 王国政府诉琼斯案

Sense.DEF: to talk about something in an eager, excited, and approving way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I could hear Sophie rhapsodizing about her new job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到索菲在使劲夸赞她的新工作。

Sense.DEF: a piece of music that is written to express emotion, and does not have a regular form
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gershwin’s Rhapsody in Blue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盖希文的《蓝色狂想曲》

Sense.DEF: an expression of eager and excited approval
Sense.EXAMPLE: The performance was greeted with rhapsodies of praise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众对这场演出好评如潮。

Sense.DEF: a substance that some people have in their blood
a small monkey from northern India that is often used in medical tests
Sense.TRAN: 恒河猴〔产于印度北部﹐常用于医学实验〕

Sense.DEF: language that is used to persuade or influence people, especially language that sounds impressive but is not actually sincere or useful
Sense.TRAN: 辞令﹔巧辩﹔〔尤指〕花言巧语﹐浮夸之词
Sense.EXAMPLE: The speech was dismissed by some people as merely political rhetoric .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人认为这场演讲只是华而不实的政治空谈。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the rhetoric of reform
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于改革的空谈

Sense.DEF: the art of speaking or writing to persuade or influence people
a question that you ask as a way of making a statement, without expecting an answer
using speech or writing in special ways in order to persuade people or to produce an impressive effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: a speech full of rhetorical phrases
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满华丽辞藻的演讲

Sense.DEF: someone who is trained or skilful in the art of persuading or influencing people through speech or writing
Sense.TRAN: 修辞学家﹔雄辩家﹔演说家

Sense.DEF: relating to rheumatism
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rheumatic disease
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风湿性疾病
Sense.EXAMPLE: rheumatic pain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风湿痛

Sense.DEF: suffering from rheumatism
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s old and rheumatic and can’t manage the stairs any longer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他年纪大﹐又有风湿病﹐再也爬不动楼梯了。

Sense.DEF: a serious infectious disease that causes fever, swelling in your joints, and sometimes damage to your heart
a disease that makes your joints or muscles painful and stiff
a disease that continues for many years and makes your joints painful and stiff, and often makes them lose their proper shape

the
rhesus factor
a jewel made from glass or a transparent rock that is intended to look like a diamond
a rhinoceros
a large heavy African or Asian animal with thick skin and either one or two horns on its nose

plastic surgery
on your nose
the thick stem of some plants, which lies under the ground and has roots and leaves growing out of it
a bush with bright flowers which keeps its leaves in winter
a shape with four sides whose opposite sides are equal in length
shaped like a rhombus
a shape with four equal straight sides, especially one that is not a square
a plant with broad leaves. It has thick red stems that can be cooked and eaten.
a word repeated by actors to make a sound like many people talking
Sense.TRAN: 〔演员模仿人声嘈杂时重复说的一个词〕

Sense.DEF: a short poem or song, especially for children, using words that rhyme
Sense.TRAN: 押韵短诗﹔〔押韵的〕儿歌﹐童谣
Sense.EXAMPLE: a collection of traditional rhymes with illustrations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带插图的经典童谣集

Sense.DEF: a word that rhymes with another word

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you think of a rhyme for ‘bicycle’?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能想出一个和bicycle同韵的词吗？

Sense.DEF: words or lines of poetry that rhyme
Sense.EXAMPLE: I love his use of rhyme and rhythm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢他对韵律和节奏的运用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole story is written in rhyme.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个故事都是用韵文写的。

Sense.DEF: no sensible reason or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: There seems to be no rhyme or reason for the school’s behaviour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校的行为似乎莫名其妙。

Sense.DEF: if two words or lines of poetry rhyme, they end with the same sound, including a vowel

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Hat’ rhymes with ‘cat’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: hat和cat押韵。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The song has rhyming couplets pairs of lines that end in words that rhyme .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这首歌有同韵的对句。

Sense.DEF: to put two or more words together to make them rhyme

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can’t rhyme ‘box’ with ‘backs’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: box和backs不押韵。

Sense.DEF:
a way of talking, used especially by
cockney s people from east London
, in which you use words or phrases that rhyme with the words you mean, instead of using the normal words. For example, ‘plates of meat’ is rhyming slang for ‘feet’.
Sense.TRAN: 同韵俚语〔尤为伦敦东区人使用的说话方式﹐以同韵的词语代替正常的词﹐如用plates of meat表示feet〕

Sense.DEF: a regular repeated pattern of sounds or movements
Sense.EXAMPLE: Drums are basic to African rhythm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非洲音乐节奏少不了鼓。
Sense.EXAMPLE: complicated dance rhythms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 复杂的舞蹈节奏

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She started moving to the rhythm of the music.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始随着音乐的节奏舞动。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the steady rhythm of her heartbeat
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她平稳的心跳节律

Sense.DEF: a regular pattern of changes
Sense.EXAMPLE: the body’s natural rhythms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人体的自然节律

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jim liked the rhythm of agricultural life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆喜欢农耕生活的节奏。

Sense.DEF: having a strong rhythm
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rhythmic thud of the bass drum
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低音鼓有节奏的咚咚声

Sense.DEF:
a method of
birth control
which depends on having sex only at a time when the woman is not likely to become
pregnant

the part of a band that provides a strong
rhythm
with drums and other similar instruments
the standard unit of money in Saudi Arabia and some other Arab countries
Sense.TRAN: 里亚尔〔沙特阿拉伯和其他一些阿拉伯国家的货币单位〕

Sense.DEF: one of the 12 pairs of curved bones that surround your chest
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was taken to hospital with a broken arm and ribs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她胳膊和肋骨断了﹐被送进医院。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was punched and kicked in the ribs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的肋部遭到拳打脚踢。

Sense.DEF: a piece of meat that includes an animal’s rib
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rib of beef
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛肋条肉
Sense.EXAMPLE: barbecued ribs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烤肋条肉

Sense.DEF: a curved piece of wood, metal etc that is used as part of the structure of something such as a boat or building
to make jokes and laugh at someone so that you embarrass them, but in a friendly way
ribald remarks or jokes are humorous, rude, and about sex
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ribald remark
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粗俗的言论
Sense.EXAMPLE: ribald humour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猥亵的幽默

Sense.DEF: ribald remarks or jokes
Sense.TRAN: 粗俗下流的言论﹔猥亵的笑话

Sense.DEF: something that is ribbed has raised lines on it
Sense.TRAN: 有罗纹的﹔有凸起条纹的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ribbed woollen sweater
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗纹套头羊毛衫

Sense.DEF: friendly jokes and laughter about someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took a lot of ribbing from other members of the crew.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是遭到其他船员的取笑。

Sense.DEF: raised lines, especially on a piece of woollen clothing
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指羊毛织物上的〕棱纹﹐罗纹﹐凸条图案

Sense.DEF: a narrow piece of attractive cloth that you use, for example, to tie your hair or hold things together
Sense.EXAMPLE: little girls with ribbons in their hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头发上系着丝带的小姑娘们
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bundle of letters tied with pale blue ribbon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一捆用淡蓝色丝带扎好的信
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ribbon was cut and the new station was officially open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剪彩后﹐新车站正式开始运营。

PIC.HEADING: RIBBON 花结﹔丝带
PIC.PICCONTENT: ribbon AmE 【美】/rosette BrE 【英】花结；ribbon 丝带

Sense.DEF: a piece of ribbon with a special pattern on it that you wear to show that you have received a military honour
a length of coloured ribbon, sometimes arranged in the form of a flat flower, that is given as a prize in a competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: For the second time she won the blue ribbon first prize .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是她第二次赢得一等奖。

Sense.DEF: something that is long and narrow

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a winding ribbon of water
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一道弯弯曲曲的水流

Sense.DEF: to be cut or torn in a lot of places
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her legs were bruised and her feet were cut to ribbons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的腿青了﹐脚上也划了一道道的伤痕。

Sense.DEF:
a long narrow piece of cloth or plastic with ink on it that is used in a
typewriter
long lines of houses along the sides of a main road leading out of a town or city
Sense.TRAN: 〔城市沿着干道两侧向郊外开发的〕带状住宅区

Sense.DEF:
the structure of
rib s
in your chest

vitamin
B2, a substance that exists in meat, milk, and some vegetables, and that is important for your health
a food that consists of small white or brown grains that you boil in water until they become soft enough to eat
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tasty sauce served with rice or pasta
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 配米饭或意面的美味酱汁
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plate of brown rice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一盘糙米饭
Sense.EXAMPLE: Serve with plain boiled rice .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 配白米饭一起上桌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a few grains of rice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几粒大米

Sense.DEF: the plant that produces rice
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rice is the main crop grown in the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水稻是这个地区的主要作物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: rice fields
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稻田

Sense.DEF: a field in which rice is grown
a type of thin paper that is made especially in China and used by painters there
a type of thin paper that can be eaten and is used in cooking
a sweet dish made of rice, milk, and sugar cooked together
Sense.TRAN: 大米布丁〔用大米﹑牛奶和糖制成的甜食〕

Subsense.DEF: someone who is rich has a lot of money and valuable possessions
Subsense.EXAMPLE: one of the richest women in America
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国最富有的女人之一
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She found herself a rich husband.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她找了一个有钱的丈夫。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He thought this was the easiest way to get rich .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以为这是最容易的致富办法。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the rich nations of the world
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界上富有的国家

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was both beautiful and fabulously rich.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不仅漂亮﹐而且极其富有。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: His brother’s stinking rich very rich, in a way that you do not approve of .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他哥哥富得流油。

Subsense.DEF: people who are rich
Subsense.EXAMPLE: houses belonging to the rich and famous
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 属于富翁和名流的房子

Sense.DEF: containing a lot of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Citrus fruits are rich in vitamin C.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 柑橘类水果富含维生素C。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pregnant women should eat protein-rich foods.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孕妇应该吃富含蛋白质的食物。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Rich mineral deposits have been found in the sea bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海底发现有丰富的矿床。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Red meat is a rich source of iron.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红肉含有大量铁质。

Sense.DEF: full of interesting or important facts, events, or ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rich literary tradition of England
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰深厚的文学传统
Sense.EXAMPLE: The area has a very rich history.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区有非常灿烂的历史。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a story that was rich in detail
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有大量细节描写的故事

Sense.DEF: rich food contains a lot of butter, cream, or eggs, which make you feel full very quickly
Sense.TRAN: 〔因含大量牛油﹑奶油或鸡蛋而〕容易让人感到饱的﹐油腻的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rich fruit cake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油腻的水果蛋糕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sauce was very rich.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调味汁很浓。

Sense.DEF: a rich smell or flavour is strong and pleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rich scent of the pine trees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 松树的浓郁香气
Sense.EXAMPLE: meat with a wonderfully rich flavour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 味道香浓的肉
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rich, fruity wine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带浓郁果香的葡萄酒

Sense.DEF: a rich colour is strong and attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rich dark brown colour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浓重的深棕色

Sense.DEF: a rich sound is low and pleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rich tone of a cello
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大提琴的浑厚音色
Sense.EXAMPLE: He laughed with a rich, throaty chuckle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他轻声笑了笑﹐声音浑厚低沉。

Sense.DEF: rich soil is good for growing plants in
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vegetables grow well in the rich, black soil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蔬菜在肥沃的黑土地里长得好。

Sense.DEF: rich cloth is expensive and beautiful
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stroked the rich velvet of the dress enviously.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她羡慕地抚摸着裙子那华贵的天鹅绒。

Sense.DEF: used to say that what someone has said is unreasonable and that they are criticizing you for doing something that they do themselves
Sense.TRAN: （他/你等这么说）实在可笑[荒谬]
Sense.EXAMPLE: He accused me of being dishonest, which was a bit rich coming from him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说我不诚实﹐这话从他嘴里说出来真是有点可笑。

Exponent.DEF: having a lot of money – used about people and places
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She married a rich Greek shipowner.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她嫁了个有钱的希腊船主。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: one of the world’s richest nations
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界最富有的国家之一

Exponent.DEF: rich – used about people and places, especially when they have been rich for a long time
Exponent.TRAN: 〔人或地方〕富有的〔尤指长久以来都很富有〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: wealthy landowners
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 富有的地主
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Orange County is a very wealthy area.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥兰治县是个很富有的地区。

Exponent.DEF: rich – used about societies, groups of people, or areas where people live, where people have nice houses and a lot of expensive possessions
Exponent.EXAMPLE: today’s affluent society
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 当今的富裕社会
Exponent.EXAMPLE: affluent young professionals
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 富有的年轻专业人士
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an affluent suburb of Boston
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 富裕的波士顿郊区

Exponent.DEF: rich – used about places and groups of people, especially when their money is related to success in business
Exponent.TRAN: 〔地方或社会群体〕富足的﹐兴旺的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sales have grown fastest in the more prosperous areas of the south.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在南方更为富足的地区﹐销量增长最快。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: prosperous merchants and bankers
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 富裕的商人和银行家

Exponent.DEF: fairly rich compared to other people, so that you can live very comfortably
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her parents are pretty well-off.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的父母很有钱。

Exponent.DEF: rich – used especially in the past about families and people who had a fairly high position in society
Exponent.TRAN: 〔旧时尤指社会地位较高的家庭和人〕富裕的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Only well-to-do families could afford to send their children to university.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有富裕家庭才有钱送子女上大学。

Exponent.DEF: having special advantages because your family have a lot of money and a high position in society
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He comes from a privileged background.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他出身于特权阶层。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The sport was only played by a privileged few .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 涉足这项运动的只有少数特权人物。

Exponent.DEF: having enough money to have a nice life without having to worry about money
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t say that we were rich – just comfortably off.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不能说我们有钱——只是小康罢了。

Exponent.DEF: to be extremely rich
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They’ve got two houses and a boat – they must be rolling in it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有两栋房子和一条船——肯定有的是钱。

Sense.DEF: expensive possessions and large amounts of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was enjoying his new-found riches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在尽情享受新得到的财富。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the story of her rise from rags to riches from being poor to being rich
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她白手起家的故事

Sense.DEF: if something is richly decorated, it is decorated a lot, in a way that is beautiful
Sense.EXAMPLE: a richly carved ceiling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雕刻得富丽堂皇的天花板
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cloak richly embroidered with gold thread
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有华丽的金线刺绣的斗篷

Sense.DEF: if someone is richly dressed, they are dressed in expensive clothes
having beautiful strong colours
Sense.EXAMPLE: the richly coloured mosaic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 色彩浓艳的镶嵌图案

Sense.DEF: having a strong pleasant taste or smell
Sense.TRAN: 味道浓郁的/香气馥郁的
Sense.EXAMPLE: richly scented flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芬芳馥郁的花朵

Sense.DEF: to completely deserve something such as success or punishment
Sense.TRAN: 完全应该得到〔成功﹑惩罚等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They got the punishment they so richly deserved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们真是罪有应得。

Sense.DEF: containing large amounts of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a richly wooded valley
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树木茂盛的山谷
Sense.EXAMPLE: an area that is richly endowed with wildlife
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 野生动植物繁多的地区

Sense.DEF: giving you a strong feeling of pleasure
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a richly rewarding relationship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一种令人非常愉快的关系。

Sense.DEF: if something has richness, it contains a lot of interesting things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the richness and diversity of the Amazonian rain forests
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚马孙雨林的丰富多样
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a literary work of remarkable richness and vitality
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 内容丰富﹑充满活力的文学作品

Sense.DEF: the richness of a colour, taste, smell, or sound is the quality that makes it rich
Sense.TRAN: 〔颜色〕浓烈﹔〔味道或气味〕浓郁﹔ 〔声音〕低沉浑厚

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the richness of the autumn colours
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 秋色的浓艳

Sense.DEF:
a system of numbers used for measuring how powerful an
earthquake
is
Sense.EXAMPLE: a severe earthquake measuring 7.2 on the Richter scale
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 里氏7.2级的大地震

Sense.DEF:
a very strong poison, which has sometimes been used by
terrorist s

a large pile of
straw
or grass that is kept in a field until it is needed
to twist and slightly injure your back or neck
Sense.EXAMPLE: I ricked my back moving the furniture around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在搬家具时扭伤了后背。

Sense.DEF:
a disease that children get in which their bones become soft and bent, caused by a lack of
vitamin
D
Sense.TRAN: 〔儿童由于缺乏维生素D而患的〕佝偻病

Sense.DEF: a rickety structure or piece of furniture is in very bad condition, and likely to break easily
Sense.TRAN: 〔结构或家具〕快要散架的﹐摇摇晃晃的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rickety old wooden chair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把摇摇晃晃的旧木椅
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rickety bridge
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座摇摇欲坠的桥

Sense.DEF: a small vehicle used in South East Asia for carrying one or two passengers. It is pulled by someone walking or riding a bicycle.
if a bullet, stone, or other object ricochets, it changes direction when it hits a surface at an angle
Sense.TRAN: 〔子弹﹑石块等运动物体〕回跳﹐反弹

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bullets ricocheted off the boulders around him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一颗颗子弹从他周围的巨石上弹飞。

Sense.DEF: something such as a bullet or a stone that has ricocheted
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was hit in the arm by a ricochet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被一颗跳弹击中胳膊。

Sense.DEF: a type of soft white Italian cheese
Sense.TRAN: 乳清干酪〔一种白色的意大利干酪〕

Subsense.DEF: to throw away or destroy something you do not want any more
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s time we got rid of all these old toys.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们该把这些旧玩具全部丢掉了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Governments should be encouraged to get rid of all nuclear weapons.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该鼓励各国政府销毁所有核武器。

Subsense.DEF: to take action so that you no longer have something unpleasant that you do not want
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I can’t get rid of this cough.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我咳嗽老是不好。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He opened the windows to get rid of the smell.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打开窗户把气味散出去。

Subsense.DEF: to make someone leave because you do not like them or because they are causing problems
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Are you trying to get rid of me?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是想赶我走吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It can be difficult for schools to get rid of poor teachers.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 解聘不称职的老师对学校来说会很难。

Sense.DEF: to have taken action so that something or someone is no longer there to worry or annoy you
Sense.EXAMPLE: The clerical part of his job was tedious, and he was glad to be rid of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他负责的文书工作部分枯燥乏味﹐他很高兴摆脱了这项差事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a bully, and we’re well rid of him it is good that he has gone .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个恶霸﹐他走了我们觉得是件好事。

Sense.DEF: to want to get rid of someone or something that is annoying you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could tell that he wanted rid of me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看得出来他想摆脱我。

Sense.DEF: to take action so that a person, place etc is no longer affected by something bad or no longer has it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a promise to rid the country of nuclear weapons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 销毁本国核武器的承诺
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will science finally rid us of this disease?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学最终会使我们摆脱这种疾病吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He struggled to rid himself of his fears.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拼命克服恐惧。

Sense.DEF: a rude way of saying you are glad someone has left
Sense.TRAN: 总算摆脱了（某人）〔表示庆幸某人离开的粗鲁说法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was awful. Good riddance to her, I say!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很讨厌。 我说啊﹐她滚蛋了真好！

Sense.DEF: very full of something unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 充斥…的﹐全是〔讨厌事物〕的
Sense.EXAMPLE: mosquito-ridden swamps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蚊虫为患的沼泽
Sense.EXAMPLE: disease-ridden slums
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疾病多发的贫民窟

Sense.DEF: a question that is deliberately very confusing and has a humorous or clever answer
Sense.EXAMPLE: See if you can solve this riddle .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看看你能不能猜出这个谜语。

Sense.DEF: something that you do not understand and cannot explain

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police have been unable to solve the riddle of her disappearance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方至今未能解开她的失踪之谜。

Sense.DEF: to say things in a mysterious way that other people cannot understand
Sense.TRAN: 打哑谜〔指说话让人难以理解〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop talking in riddles and explain what’s going on!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别打哑谜了﹐说说是怎么回事！

Sense.DEF: a wire container with holes in it that is used to separate earth from stones
to make a lot of small holes in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two gunmen riddled the bus with gunfire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个持枪歹徒把公共汽车打得千疮百孔。

Sense.DEF:
to shake the coal or wood in a fire, in order to remove
ash es
very full of something bad or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 充斥[布满]某物〔指坏的或讨厌的事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole house was riddled with damp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个房子都潮乎乎的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: By this time her body was riddled with cancer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此时癌细胞已扩散至她全身。

Sense.DEF: full of small holes
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wall of the fort was riddled with bullet holes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 堡垒的墙壁上弹孔累累。

Sense.DEF: to sit on an animal, especially a horse, and make it move along
Sense.EXAMPLE: She learned to ride when she was seven.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她七岁时学会了骑马。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was riding a large grey mare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他骑着一匹灰色的大母马。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She arrived riding on a white horse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她骑着一匹白马来了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He rode away across the marshes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他骑马穿过湿地走了。

Sense.DEF:
to travel on a bicycle or
motorbike
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had never learned to ride a bicycle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直没有学过骑自行车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They mounted their bikes and rode off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们骑上自行车走了。

Sense.DEF: to travel in a bus, car, or other vehicle that you are not driving
Sense.EXAMPLE: We got onto the bus and rode into San Francisco.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们上了公共汽车﹐到旧金山去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The kids were riding in the back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们坐在后座。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ann rides the bus to work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安乘公共汽车上班。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not use ride to talk about someone controlling a car or other vehicle. Use drive. 驾驶车辆用drive﹐不用ride: the man who was driving the stolen car 开着赃车的那名男子

Sense.DEF:
to travel up or down in a
lift

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He rode the elevator down to the first floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他乘电梯下到一楼。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I rode up to the tenth floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我乘电梯上到十楼。

Subsense.DEF: to be floating in water or in the air
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The smaller boat was lighter and rode higher in the water.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条较小的船更轻﹐吃水也更浅。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The moon was riding high in the sky.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月亮高高挂在天空。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There was a large ship riding at anchor in the bay.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一艘大船抛锚停泊在海湾里。

Subsense.DEF: to float on a wave and move forward with it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: surfboarders riding the waves
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 踏浪而行的冲浪者

Sense.DEF: to feel very happy and confident
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were still riding high after their election victory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选举获胜﹐他们至今依然踌躇满志。

Sense.DEF: to take no action about something that is wrong or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 对某事物听之任之[放任自流]
Sense.EXAMPLE: What he had said was wrong, and I knew I shouldn’t just let it ride.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说的话都是错的﹐我知道我不能听之任之。

Sense.DEF: to ignore someone else’s feelings or ideas because you have the power or authority to do this
Sense.TRAN: 轻蔑地对待〔别人的感受或意见〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The planning authorities should not ride roughshod over the wishes of local people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 规划部门不应无视当地人的意愿。

Sense.DEF: to annoy someone by often criticizing them or asking them to do things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why are you riding her so hard?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么这么数落她？

Sense.DEF: if a child rides on someone’s shoulders or back, they are carried in that way
to move back slightly when someone hits you, so that you are not hit with so much force
Sense.EXAMPLE: He managed to ride the punch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他躲开了来拳的大部分力量。

Sense.DEF: to be doing something unwise which could result in failure
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had a feeling he was riding for a fall, and tried to tell him so.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感觉他在蛮干﹐于是设法告诉他这一点。

Sense.DEF: if one thing is riding on another, it depends on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He knew he had to win – his reputation was riding on it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他知道他必须赢﹐他的名声全系于此。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a lot riding on this match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场比赛事关重大。

Sense.DEF: if a ship rides out a storm, it manages to keep floating until the storm has ended
if you ride out a difficult situation, you are not badly harmed by it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most large companies should be able to ride out the recession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数大公司应能熬过经济衰退期。

Sense.DEF: if a piece of clothing rides up, it moves upwards so that it is no longer covering your body properly
a journey in a vehicle, when you are not driving

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He invited me to go for a ride in his new car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他邀请我坐他的新车去兜风。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you give me a ride back to town?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能捎我回镇上吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sammy had promised to take me for a ride in his truck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨米答应让我坐他的卡车去兜风。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I managed to get a ride down to the station.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我设法搭了便车去车站。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We hitched a ride got a free ride from a passing vehicle into town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们拦了一辆便车进城。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A fifteen minute taxi ride will take you to the airport.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐出租车15分钟就能到机场。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new model offers a lovely smooth, comfortable ride.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这款新车乘坐平稳舒适。

Sense.DEF: a journey on a bicycle, a horse, or a similar animal

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can I have a ride on your bike?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能骑一下你的自行车吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shall we go for a bike ride this afternoon?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天下午我们骑自行车去兜兜风好吗？

Sense.DEF: if people give someone, especially someone in authority, a rough or an easy ride, they make a situation difficult or easy for them
Sense.TRAN: 〔让某人﹐尤指掌权者〕不好过/好过
Sense.EXAMPLE: Journalists gave the Prime Minister a rough ride at the press conference.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记者在新闻发布会上让首相很难堪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chairman will face a rough ride from shareholders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 董事长将面临股东们的发难。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President will not have an easy ride when he gives his account of events.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统自己来说这些事情会很难堪。

Sense.DEF: if something has a bumpy ride, it experiences a lot of problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shares had a bumpy ride yesterday, falling by an average of 15%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股票昨日遭遇重挫﹐平均下跌了15%。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new bill could be in for a bumpy ride when it is put before parliament.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新法案提交议会时可能会起风波。

Sense.DEF: to trick someone, especially in order to get money from them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d just begun to realise he was taking me for a ride.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这才开始意识到他在骗我。

Sense.DEF: to join what other people are doing just for pleasure, not because you are seriously interested in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: A couple of friends had come along for the ride.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个朋友过来一起凑热闹。

Sense.DEF:
a large machine that people ride on for fun at a
fair
Sense.TRAN: 〔游乐场中供玩乐的〕乘骑设施
Sense.EXAMPLE: We went on loads of rides .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们玩了很多游乐设施。

Sense.DEF: a path for riding on a horse in the countryside
Sense.EXAMPLE: a grassy ride
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长满草的小道

Sense.DEF: someone who rides a horse, bicycle etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a horse and rider
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马匹和骑师

Sense.DEF: an extra or more detailed piece of information that is added to an official document and changes it slightly
a long area of high land, especially at the top of a mountain
Sense.EXAMPLE: We made our way carefully along the ridge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们沿着山脊小心前行。

Subsense.DEF: something long and thin that is raised above the things around it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A small ridge of sand separated the field from the beach.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条小小的沙脊把田野和海滩分隔开来。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The ridges on the soles give the shoes a better grip.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鞋底上的棱纹可以更好地防滑。

Subsense.DEF: the part at the top of a roof, where the two sides meet

Sense.DEF:
a long area of high air pressure in the
atmosphere
, which has an effect on the weather
something that is ridged has ridges on its surface
Sense.TRAN: 隆起的﹐皱起的﹔有棱纹的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ridged sand of the river bottom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 河床上的沙垄

Sense.DEF: unkind laughter or remarks that are intended to make someone or something seem stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ridicule of his peers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他同龄人的奚落
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government’s proposals were held up to ridicule suffered ridicule by opposition ministers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的提案遭到反对党部长们的嘲笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had become an object of ridicule among the other teachers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他成了其他教师嘲笑的对象。

Sense.DEF: to laugh at a person, idea etc and say that they are stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the time, his ideas were ridiculed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当时他的观点被人讥笑。

Sense.DEF: very silly or unreasonable
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s a ridiculous idea!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那主意很荒唐！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be ridiculous!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别傻了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d look ridiculous in a dress like that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我穿那样的裙子会显得很可笑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s an absolutely ridiculous decision.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个决定荒谬绝伦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s ridiculous that we have to wait six weeks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得等六个星期﹐这太荒谬了。

Sense.DEF: the sport or activity of riding horses
Sense.EXAMPLE: horse riding
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 骑马
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shall we go riding on Saturday?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们星期六去骑马好吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: place where people learn to ride horses

Sense.DEF: if something bad or unpleasant is rife, it is very common
Sense.TRAN: 〔不良或令人讨厌的事物〕普遍存在的﹐流行的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Violent crime is rife in our inner cities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力犯罪在我们的旧城区非常猖獗。

Sense.DEF: full of something bad or unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crowded factories are rife with disease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拥挤的工厂疾病流行。

Sense.DEF: to spread quickly in an uncontrolled way
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one knew exactly what he had done, but speculation ran rife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人确切知道他的所作所为﹐但是各种猜测层出不穷。

Sense.DEF:
a repeated series of notes in popular or
jazz
music
Sense.TRAN: 〔流行音乐或爵士乐中的〕重复乐段
Sense.EXAMPLE: a guitar riff
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉他重复乐段

Sense.DEF: a piece of speech in which someone talks about a subject in an entertaining way that does not seem planned
Sense.EXAMPLE: He goes off on a riff about the problems of being middle-aged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他即兴说了一番关于中年问题的妙语。

Sense.DEF:
to play different notes related to the main tune in popular or
jazz
music
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was riffing on his guitar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在用吉他演奏重复乐段。

Sense.DEF: to talk about a subject in an entertaining way that does not seem planned
Sense.EXAMPLE: During her show, she riffs about everything from her family to global warming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在自己的节目里随兴而谈﹐从自己家庭到全球变暖无所不涉。

Sense.DEF: to move and quickly look at pieces of paper or the pages of a book, magazine etc
Sense.TRAN: 快速翻阅〔纸张﹑书﹑杂志等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He riffled through the papers on his desk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他迅速翻阅了桌上的文件。

Sense.DEF: an insulting word for people who are noisy, badly-behaved, or of low social class
Sense.TRAN: 地痞流氓﹔乌合之众〔侮辱性用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We charge high prices to keep the riff-raff out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们收取高价﹐好让不三不四的人离远一点。

Sense.DEF: a long gun which you hold up to your shoulder to shoot
to search a place or container quickly because you are looking for something, especially something to steal
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sally rifled through her wardrobe looking for a dress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨莉翻遍衣橱找一件连衣裙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The killer had rifled his wallet and stolen £200.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凶手翻了他的钱包﹐偷走200英镑。

Sense.DEF: a man who uses a rifle
a place where people practise shooting with rifles
a situation in which two people or groups have had a serious disagreement and begun to dislike and not trust each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Party officials have denied that there is any rift between ministers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政党官员否认部长之间存在不和。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Today’s announcement could lead to a further rift over public spending.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天的公告有可能导致公共开支方面的更大分歧。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He set out to heal the rifts in the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他着手弥合党内的裂痕。

Sense.DEF: a crack or narrow opening in a large mass of rock, cloud etc
a valley with very steep sides, formed by the cracking and moving of the Earth’s surface
to dishonestly arrange the result of an election or competition before it happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some international observers have claimed the election was rigged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些国际观察员声称选举受到操纵。

Sense.DEF: if people rig prices or rig financial markets, they unfairly agree with each other the prices that will be charged
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two of the largest oil companies have been accused of rigging prices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两大石油公司被指控操纵价格。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some investors feel that the market is rigged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些投资者感觉市场被人操纵。

Sense.DEF: to put ropes, sails etc on a ship
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ship was fully rigged and ready to sail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船已装备就绪﹐等待起航。

Sense.DEF: to dress someone in special or unusual clothes
Sense.TRAN: 给〔某人〕穿上特别[奇异]的衣服
Sense.EXAMPLE: young children who are rigged out in designer clothes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身穿名牌服饰的小孩

Sense.DEF: to make a piece of equipment, furniture etc quickly from objects that you find around you
Sense.TRAN: 〔就地取材〕仓促拼凑出﹐草草做成
Sense.EXAMPLE: We rigged up a simple shower at the back of the cabin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在小木屋的后面凑合着搭了一个简易淋浴间。

Sense.DEF: a large structure that is used for getting oil from the ground under the sea
a large truck
Sense.EXAMPLE: We drove the rig down to Baltimore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们开着大卡车朝着巴尔的摩驶去。

Sense.DEF: the way in which a ship’s sails are arranged

an American spelling of
rigmarole

a type of
pasta
in the shape of short tubes
all the ropes, posts, and chains that hold up a ship’s sails

Subsense.DEF: a statement or piece of information that is right is correct and based on true facts
Subsense.TRAN: 〔说法或信息〕正确的﹐对的﹐如实的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Yes, that’s the right answer .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对﹐回答正确。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Is that the right time ?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个时间对吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I got most of the questions right .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分问题我都答对了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His ideas have now been proved right .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的观点现已证明是对的。

Subsense.DEF: if you are right, you have said something that is correct and based on true facts
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I think you’re right. We should have set out earlier.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你是对的﹐我们本该早点出发的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You were right about the hotel being too crowded.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你说对了﹐这家酒店是太拥挤了。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: I think the Prime Minister is only half right .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为首相只说对了一半。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Am I right in thinking that you two have met before?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们两个以前见过﹐我说得对吗？

Sense.DEF: the right thing, person, method etc is the one that is most suitable or effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think you’ve made the right decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为你作出了正确的决定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think she’s definitely the right person for the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为她绝对是这份工作的合适人选。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A huge development like this isn’t right for such a small village.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如此大规模的开发项目不适合这么小的一个村庄。

Subsense.DEF: your right side is the side with the hand that most people write with
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He had a knife in his right hand.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他右手拿着一把刀。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a scar on the right side of her face
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她右颊上的疤痕

Subsense.DEF: on the same side of something as your right side
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Take the next right turn.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在下一个路口往右拐。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the right bank of the river
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 河的右岸

Sense.DEF: something that is not right is not in the state it should be in
Sense.EXAMPLE: The engine’s not quite right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引擎不太对劲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This cheese doesn’t smell right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这干酪闻起来不对劲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Things haven’t been right between me and James for some time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和詹姆斯之间出现问题已经有一段时间了。

GramExa.GLOSS: correct something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It didn’t take long to find the fault and put it right.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不久就找到毛病并纠正了。

Sense.DEF: if someone is right to do something, their action is morally correct or sensible

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you think I was right to report them to the police?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得我向警方告发他们做得对吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It can’t be right to keep lying to your family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老是欺骗你的家人是不对的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think it’s right that the people who work hardest should earn the most.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作最努力的人报酬最高﹐我认为这是合理的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s only right completely right that he should get his share of the money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拿他应得的那份钱是理所当然的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company wants to do the right thing and offer compensation to all the injured workers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司希望正确行事﹐对所有受伤的工人作出赔偿。

Subsense.DEF: used to agree with what someone says or to answer ‘yes’ to a question
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘I gather you work in the sales department?’ ‘That’s right.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我猜你在销售部工作？”“没错。”
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Some people find it very difficult to work quickly.’ ‘That’s right, and they often find exams very stressful.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “有些人觉得很难做得快。” “是呀﹐他们还常常觉得考试压力很大。”

Subsense.DEF: used when you are telling someone that you are angry about what they are doing
Subsense.TRAN: 行啦﹐够啦〔用于表示对别人所做的事感到愤怒〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: That’s right! Just blame me for everything, as usual!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 行啦！什么事都来怪我好了﹐总是这样！

Sense.DEF: used to say ‘yes’ to a request, order, or suggestion
Sense.TRAN: 是﹐好的〔用于回答要求﹑命令或建议〕

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how bad someone or something is
Sense.TRAN: 完全的〔用于强调某人或某物很糟糕〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sounds like a right idiot!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听起来像个十足的傻瓜！
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house was in a right mess when we got back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们回来的时候﹐屋里一片狼藉。

Sense.DEF: if you are not feeling right, you are not feeling completely well
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t been feeling right all day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一整天都觉得不舒服。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A few days in bed will soon put you right .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卧床休息几天﹐你很快就会好的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll soon be as right as rain completely healthy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你很快就会完全康复。

Sense.DEF: the right people, places, schools etc are considered to be the best or most important
Sense.TRAN: 〔人﹑地方﹑学校等〕最好的﹔最重要的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sonia’s always careful to be seen with the right people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 索尼娅总是很注意﹐出入都要和体面的人在一起。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in the right place at the right time
Sense.DEF: to be in the place where something useful becomes available or is being offered
Sense.TRAN: 在恰当的时间出现在恰当的地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: Being a news photographer is all about being in the right place at the right time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当新闻摄影师﹐就是要在恰当的时间出现在恰当的地点。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He was convinced of the rightness of his cause.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坚信他的事业是正义的。

Exponent.DEF: not wrong – used about something someone says, or about the person who says it
Exponent.TRAN: 〔说的内容或说话的人〕正确的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the right answer
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 正确答案
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You were right about the colour.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 颜色你说对了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘He’s about thirty, isn’t he?’ ‘That’s right.’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “他三十上下﹐对不对？”“对。”

Exponent.DEF: right. Correct sounds more formal than right.
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the correct answer
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 正确答案
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He is absolutely correct.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他完全正确。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Unfortunately, this information is not correct.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不幸的是﹐这条信息不正确。

Exponent.DEF: right – used about information, measurements, descriptions etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Make sure that your measurements are accurate.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 尺寸一定要量准确。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an accurate description of the suspect
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对疑犯的准确描述

Exponent.DEF: an exact number, amount, or time is completely correct, and is no more and no less than it should be
Exponent.TRAN: 〔数字﹑数量或时间〕精确的﹐确切的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The exact time is 9.28 a.m.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 确切时间是上午9点28分。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The exact weight of the baby was 3.3 kilos.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 婴儿的确切重量为3.3公斤。

Exponent.DEF: exactly right – used especially about guesses or things people say
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指猜测及人们说的话〕完全正确的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His answer was spot-on.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的回答完全正确。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You’re spot-on.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你完全正确。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you have understood or agree with what someone has just said
Sense.TRAN: 好的﹐对〔用于表示明白或同意某人的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You need to be there by ten o’clock.’ ‘Right.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你要在10点前到那儿。”“好的。”

Sense.DEF: used to get someone’s attention before starting to say or do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Right, open your books on page 16.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好﹐大家把书翻到第16页。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Right, is everyone listening?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好﹐大家都在听吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Right, I think we’re ready to go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好﹐我觉得我们准备好可以走了。

Sense.DEF: used to check if what you have said is correct
Sense.TRAN: 对吗〔用于确认自己说的话是否正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: So we’re meeting in the pub, right?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么我们在酒吧见面﹐对吧？

Sense.DEF: used to check that the person you are speaking to is listening and understands what you are saying
Sense.TRAN: 对不对﹐懂吗 〔用于确认对方是否在听并明白你说的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: So I handed him the camera, right, and asked him to take our photograph.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 于是我就把相机递给他﹐懂吗﹐叫他给我们照相。

Sense.DEF: exactly in a particular position or place
Sense.TRAN: 正好〔在某个位置或地方〕

GramExa.PROPFORM: right in/in front of/by etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was standing right in the middle of the room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她就站在房间的正中央。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s the house, right in front of you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就是那所房子﹐就在你面前。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I left my bags right here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把包就放在这里的。

Sense.DEF: immediately and without any delay
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s on right after the six o’clock news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 6点钟新闻之后马上播出。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll phone him right away immediately .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我马上就打电话给他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could tell right off that something was wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我马上明白出事了。

GramExa.GLOSS: immediately, without having to think carefully
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kay answered right off the bat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯毫不犹豫地作出了回答。

Sense.DEF: correctly
Sense.EXAMPLE: We guessed right; they’d gone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们猜对了——他们已经走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I thought you’d be cross.’‘You thought right!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我以为你会生气。” “你说对了！”

Sense.DEF: in a way that is good or satisfactory
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everything’s going right for him at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前他一切顺利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll work out right in the end.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最终一切都会好起来的。

Sense.DEF: towards the direction or side that is on the right
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn right at the crossroads.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在十字路口向右拐。

Sense.DEF: now, or immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you need me right now?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你现在就要我来吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to deal with this problem right now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要立即解决这个问题。

Sense.DEF: all the way along, through etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go right to the end of the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿这条路一直走到尽头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We don’t have to go right into town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不需要径直进城。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I slept soundly right through the night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我整晚都睡得很香。

Sense.DEF: to completely support someone in their ideas or in what they are trying to achieve
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re all right behind you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都很支持你。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I’ll be right with you/right there/right back
Sense.DEF: used to ask someone to wait because you are coming or returning very soon
Sense.TRAN: 我马上就来/就到/就回来
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Lunch is ready!’ ‘I’ll be right there.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “午饭好啦！”“我就来。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t go away; I’ll be right back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要走开﹐我很快就回来。

Sense.DEF: to be as good or as important as the very best
Sense.TRAN: （与某人/某事物）不相上下﹔（与某人/某事物）同等重要
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s definitely right up there with all the world-class footballers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他绝对和世界级的足球运动员不相上下。

Sense.DEF: everywhere or in every way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s losing money right, left and centre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司处处在亏损。

Sense.DEF: something that you are morally, legally, or officially allowed to do or have

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new charter establishes the rights and duties of citizens.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新宪章确定了公民的权利和义务。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everyone should have the right to freedom of expression.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都应该有言论自由的权利。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You have the right to consult a lawyer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有权咨询律师。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The money is yours by right.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔钱理应是你的。

GramExa.GLOSS: legally or morally allowed
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You would be within your rights to sue the company for negligence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有权起诉公司没有尽责。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a right to be angry/concerned/suspicious etc
Sense.DEF: to have a good reason for being angry, concerned etc
Sense.TRAN: 有理由生气/担心/怀疑等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think you have a right to feel very disappointed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为你有理由感到很失望。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You had every right to be angry with them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你完全有理由生他们的气。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have no right to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone’s action is completely unreasonable or unfair
Sense.EXAMPLE: You had no right to take money from my purse!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你无权从我的钱包里拿钱！
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has no right to speak to me like that!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他无权那样对我说话！

Sense.DEF: the side of your body that has the hand that most people write with, or this side of anything else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our car is just to the right of that white van.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的车就在那辆白色货车的右侧。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Take the first turning on the right.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在第一个转弯处向右拐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The school is on your right as you come into the village.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 进了村子后﹐学校就在你的右边。

Sense.DEF:
political parties or groups that support the ideas and beliefs of
capitalism
. They usually want low taxes and to encourage private business rather than businesses owned by the state.
Sense.EXAMPLE: The campaign is being supported by the Right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场运动得到了右翼政党的支持。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Conservative Party seems to be moving even further to the right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保守党好像更加右倾了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: politicians on the extreme right
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 极右翼政客

Sense.DEF: behaviour that is morally good and correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some kids don’t seem to know the difference between right and wrong .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些孩子好像不能分辨是非。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The protesters believe that they have right on their side.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抗议者认为正义在他们一边。

Sense.DEF: if someone has the rights to a book, film, television programme etc, they are allowed to sell it or show it
Sense.TRAN: 〔书﹑电影﹑电视节目等的〕版权﹐发行权

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The studio bought the rights to his new book.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影公司买下了他新书的版权。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company paid £2 million for film rights to the book.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司花了200万英镑买下了这本书的电影改编权。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the television rights to the Olympic Games
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥林匹克运动会的电视转播权

Sense.DEF: to have the best reasons, arguments etc in a disagreement with someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both sides are convinced that they are in the right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方都认为自己有理。

Sense.DEF: used to describe what should happen if things are done fairly or correctly
Sense.EXAMPLE: By rights, the house should be mine now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按理说﹐这房子现在应该归我。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you have something or achieve something on your own, without depending on other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a very wealthy woman in her own right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她凭自己的能力成为十分富有的女人。

Sense.DEF: to make a place or situation return to normal again
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took ages to put the room to rights again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把房间收拾好花了很长时间。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the rights and wrongs of sth
Sense.DEF: the subject of what or who is right or wrong in a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to spend ages discussing the rights and wrongs of all this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想浪费时间来讨论这一切的是与非。

Sense.DEF: a hit made with your right hand

Collocate.EXAMPLE: People have a right to know the truth.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 民众有权了解真相。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: stop them doing something they have a right to do
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Imprisoning the men without trial violated their rights.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 未经审讯就把那些人关进监狱﹐这侵犯了他们的权利。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do what you have a right to do
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The insurance company decided not to exercise its right of appeal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 保险公司决定不行使其上诉的权利。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not allow someone to do something they have the right to do
ask for it firmly
take action to stop a right being taken away
defend their rights
the rights that everyone should have
Collocate.EXAMPLE: This company always operates with respect for human rights.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司的经营始终以尊重人权为本。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the rights that every person in a society should have
Collocate.EXAMPLE: As a young man, he was deeply involved in the struggle for civil rights.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻时﹐他积极投身争取民权的斗争。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Women demanded equal rights.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性要求权利平等。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the right to ask for an official decision to be changed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: In these circumstances, there is no right of appeal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这些情况下没有上诉权。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the right to be free from public attention
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The judge decided that the media’s actions violated the couple’s right to privacy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官判定﹐媒体的行为侵犯了那对夫妇的隐私权。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the right to enter a place, use something, or see someone
the right to say or write something in answer to a criticism

Sense.DEF: to do something to prevent a bad situation from continuing
Sense.EXAMPLE: He seems to think he can right all the wrongs of the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他好像认为自己能尽扫天下不平之事。

Sense.DEF: to put something back into the state or situation that it should be in
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must try to right the balance between taxation and government spending.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须设法恢复税收与政府支出之间的平衡。

Sense.DEF: to put something, especially a boat, back into its correct upright position
Sense.TRAN: 把〔尤指小船〕扶正﹔使直立
Sense.EXAMPLE: I finally managed to right the canoe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我终于把独木舟扶正了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She righted herself and picked up her bag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她站稳后拿起了自己的包。

Sense.DEF: an angle of 90˚, like the angles at the corners of a square
if two things are at right angles, they make a 90˚ angle where they touch
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hold the brush at right angles to the surface.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刷子要和表面垂直。

Sense.DEF:
a
triangle
which has an angle of 90°

to press the right-hand button on a computer
mouse
to make the computer do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Right-click on the image to save it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在图像上点击鼠标右键进行保存。

Sense.DEF: strong feelings of anger when you think a situation is not morally right or fair
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was full of righteous indignation about the attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对这次袭击事件义愤填膺。

Sense.DEF: morally good and fair
Sense.EXAMPLE: a righteous God
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正义的上帝

Sense.DEF: according to what is correct or what should be done legally or morally
Sense.EXAMPLE: George sat at the head of the table, in his rightful place as their leader.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治坐在桌子上首﹐作为他们的领导﹐这是他理所当然的位子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll return the money to its rightful owner .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会把钱还给其合法的主人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rightful heir to the throne
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 王位的合法继承人

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I’m only claiming what is rightfully mine.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是在要求理应属于我的东西。

Sense.DEF: on the right side of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the right-hand side of the body
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身体的右侧

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the bottom right-hand corner of the page
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 页面右下角

Sense.DEF: a right-hand drive vehicle is one in which the driver sits on the right
Sense.TRAN: 〔交通工具〕右御的﹐右座驾驶的

Sense.DEF: a right-handed person uses their right hand for writing, throwing etc
someone who uses their right hand for writing, throwing etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was the only right-hander among his team’s top six batsmen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是他们队里排名前六位的击球手中唯一的一个右手球员。

Sense.DEF: a hit using your right hand
the person who supports and helps you the most, especially in your job
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指工作中的〕得力助手﹐左右手
Sense.EXAMPLE: John is Bill’s right-hand man and has put a lot of time into the team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰是比尔的得力助手﹐为这个团队的工作投入了大量的时间。

Sense.DEF: used when formally announcing or talking about a British member of Parliament
Sense.TRAN: 阁下〔对英国议会议员的尊称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Right Honourable Giles Williams MP
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贾尔斯·威廉斯议员阁下

Sense.DEF:
supporting
right-wing
ideas or groups
Sense.EXAMPLE: rightist demonstrators
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 右翼示威者

Sense.DEF: correctly, or for a good reason
Sense.TRAN: 正确地﹔有道理地﹐有充分理由地
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was, as you rightly said , the smallest boy in the class.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你说的没错﹐我是班级里最小的男孩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As you so rightly pointed out , things are getting worse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你说得很对﹐情况越来越不妙了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have been treated badly, and they are rightly upset.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们受到了不公正的对待﹐生气是理所当然的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a lot of talk, quite rightly, about the dangers of smoking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有很多关于吸烟危害的言论﹐说得都很有道理。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This photo was taken in Paris, if I remember rightly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我没记错的话﹐这张照片是在巴黎拍的。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone else thinks that something they did was right, but you think it was wrong
Sense.TRAN: 且不问对还是错﹐不管对不对
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prime minister was widely judged, rightly or wrongly, to be an honest man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管对不对﹐大多数人都认为首相是个诚实的人。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a decision or action you have just described is fair and morally right, in your opinion
Sense.TRAN: 有理由这样〔用于表示认为某个决定或行为合理并合乎道德〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of people round here were furious, and rightly so.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这儿有很多人都很愤怒﹐这是情理之中的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I can’t rightly say/don’t rightly know
Sense.DEF: used to say that you are not sure whether something is correct or not
a right-minded person has opinions, principles, or standards of behaviour that you approve of
Sense.EXAMPLE: All right-minded people will support us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有有正义感的人都会支持我们。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you agree with a suggestion that someone has made
Sense.TRAN: 行﹐好的〔用于表示同意对方的建议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Righto, I’ll see you at six.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好的﹐6点钟见。

Sense.DEF: the legal right to ask for a court’s decision to be changed
supporting ideas and aims that are between the centre and the right in politics
the right to drive into or across a road before other vehicles
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never know who has right of way at this junction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来搞不清楚这个交叉口谁有先行权。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The law here says that pedestrians always have the right of way .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这儿的法律规定永远是行人优先通行。

Subsense.DEF: the right to walk across someone else’s land
Subsense.TRAN: 〔在他人土地上的〕通行权﹐穿行权
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Walkers are often quite aggressive about their rights of way.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 步行者经常很在意自己的通行权。

Subsense.DEF: a path that people have the right to use
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The path is not a public right of way .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条小路不是公共通道。

Sense.DEF: someone who is right on supports social justice, equal rights, the protection of the environment etc – often used to show disapproval because someone does this in an extreme way
Sense.TRAN: 伸张正义的﹔主张平等的﹔支持环境保护的〔常含贬义﹐因行为极端〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s one of those annoyingly right-on magazines about the environment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这就是那种过于关注环境问题而让人反感的杂志之一。

Sense.DEF: someone is right on when they say something that is correct or that you completely agree with
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parker’s column on teenage sexuality is right on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕克关于青少年性问题的专栏写得很在理。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you agree with what someone says or does
Sense.TRAN: 很对〔用于强调同意某人所说或做的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Power to the people!’ ‘Yeah, right on.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “还政于民！”“对﹐没错。”

Sense.DEF:
an offer of company
share s
at a cheaper price than usual, to people who own some already
Sense.TRAN: 股票认购权发行﹐配股〔公司以优惠价格向现有股东发售新股〕

Sense.DEF: if a company or organization rightsizes, or if it rightsizes its operations, it reduces the number of people it employs in order to reduce costs – used especially by companies to make the reduction in the number of workers sound good and sensible
Sense.TRAN: 裁减（员工人数）﹔缩减（编制）﹔精简（人员）〔此词尤为公司所用﹐以使裁员行为听上去合理〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have been given one year to rightsize their workforce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有一年时间来精简职工人数。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Many workers lost their jobs as a result of rightsizing.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多工人因为公司精简人员而失去了工作。

Sense.DEF: a right-thinking person has opinions, principles, or standards of behaviour that you approve of
Sense.EXAMPLE: I condemn this killing, as all right-thinking people must.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我谴责这样的杀戮﹐所有正直的人都应该这么做。

Sense.DEF: supporting the right of people who are extremely ill, injured, or unconscious to refuse to use machines or methods that would keep them alive
Sense.TRAN: 支持死亡权利的〔指支持垂危病人有权拒绝以机器维持生命〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the growing right-to-die lobby within the USA
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国国内越来越庞大的支持死亡权利的游说团体

Sense.DEF: if you talk about a baby’s right to life, you mean that a baby has the right to be born, even if there are problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every unborn child has a right to life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有未出生的孩子都有生的权利。

Sense.DEF:
a
triangle
which has an angle of 90°
on or towards the right
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rightward glance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 向右一瞥

Sense.DEF: on or towards the right
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane’s course was veering rightwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机航线突然右偏。

Sense.DEF:
a right-wing person or group supports the ideas and beliefs of
capitalism
Sense.EXAMPLE: right-wing parties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 右翼政党
Sense.EXAMPLE: The organization is very right-wing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个组织非常右倾。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the right wing of the Conservative party
a prominent right-winger in the party
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 党内一位著名的右翼人士

Sense.DEF: rigid methods, systems etc are very strict and difficult to change
Sense.TRAN: 〔方法﹑体制等〕严格死板的﹐僵化的
Sense.EXAMPLE: rigid and authoritarian methods of education
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 死板﹑专断的教育方法

Sense.DEF: someone who behaves in a rigid way is very unwilling to change their ideas or behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: rigid adherence to old-fashioned ideas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对旧观念的固守
Sense.EXAMPLE: She maintained rigid control over her emotional and sexual life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对自己的情感生活和性生活一直严加克制。

Sense.DEF: stiff and not moving or bending
Sense.TRAN: 僵硬的﹔不动的﹔不弯曲的
Sense.EXAMPLE: rigid plastic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 硬塑料

Sense.DEF: used to describe someone who cannot move, especially because they are very frightened, shocked, or angry
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因惊吓﹑震惊或生气而〕身体僵直的﹐呆住的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I heard a noise and woke up rigid with terror.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到一个声音后惊醒过来﹐吓得身子都僵了。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: rigidly opposed to all new ideas
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 顽固地反对一切新观念

Sense.DEF: a long confusing process or description
Sense.TRAN: 繁琐复杂的过程﹔冗长杂乱的描述
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to go through the rigmarole of taking him to court.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可不想走那些繁琐的程序去起诉他。

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
rigour
the condition in which someone’s body becomes stiff after they die
careful, thorough, and exact
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rigorous analysis of defence needs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对国防需求的缜密分析
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rigorous standards required by the college
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学规定的严格标准

Sense.DEF: very severe or strict
Sense.EXAMPLE: rigorous army training
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严苛的军训

Sense.DEF: the problems and difficulties of a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: all the rigors of a Canadian winter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加拿大冬天的严寒
Sense.EXAMPLE: the stresses and rigours of modern life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代生活的压力和艰辛

Sense.DEF: great care and thoroughness in making sure that something is correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their research seems to me to be lacking in rigour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的研究在我看来不够严谨。

Sense.DEF: to make someone extremely angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was the calmest guy I ever knew – nothing ever riled him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是我认识的最冷静的人——没有什么事能让他生气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That class gets me so riled up .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个班级把我气死了。

Sense.DEF: the outside edge of something circular

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the rim of a glass
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玻璃杯口
GramExa.EXAMPLE: plates with a gold band around the rim
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 镶了一圈金边的盘子

Sense.DEF: with a gold, red etc rim
Sense.EXAMPLE: gold-rimmed spectacles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金边眼镜
Sense.EXAMPLE: red-rimmed eyes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼眶红红的眼睛

Sense.DEF: to be around the edge of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyes were rimmed with fatigue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的眼里满是倦意。

Sense.DEF: the thick outer skin of some types of fruit, such as oranges
Sense.EXAMPLE: grated lemon rind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 磨碎了的柠檬皮

Sense.DEF:
the thick outer skin of some foods, such as
bacon
or cheese
a piece of jewellery that you wear on your finger
Sense.EXAMPLE: a diamond ring
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钻戒
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plain silver ring
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一枚素面银戒指

Subsense.DEF: an object in the shape of a circle
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a rubber ring for children to go swimming with
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童游泳用的橡皮圈
Subsense.EXAMPLE: onion rings
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洋葱圈
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a key ring
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钥匙环

Subsense.DEF: a circular line or mark

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She left a dirty ring around the bath.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在浴缸里留下了一圈污渍。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a ring round the moon
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 月亮的光晕

Subsense.DEF: a group of people or things arranged in a circle

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A ring of armed troops surrounded the building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 武装士兵围成一圈包围了大楼。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The city was overlooked by a ring of high-rise buildings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从四周的高楼大厦可以俯瞰这座城市。

Sense.DEF: to make a telephone call to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll give you a ring later in the week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个星期晚些时候我会给你打电话。

Sense.DEF: the sound made by a bell or the act of making this sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ring at the doorbell
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门铃声

Sense.DEF: a group of people who illegally control a business or criminal activity
Sense.TRAN: 〔从事非法交易或犯罪活动的〕团伙﹐帮派
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you aware that a drugs ring is being operated in the club?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有发现俱乐部里有贩毒团伙在活动？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Secret files reveal an Oxford spy ring .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 秘密文件揭露牛津有个间谍网。

Sense.DEF: if a statement or argument has a ring of truth, confidence etc, it seems as if it has this quality
Sense.TRAN: 〔话语或论点〕看来有某种特性
Sense.EXAMPLE: His explanation has the ring of truth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的解释似乎是真的。

Sense.DEF: if something has a familiar ring, you feel that you have heard it before
Sense.EXAMPLE: His voice had a strangely familiar ring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的声音听起来不可思议地耳熟。

Sense.DEF: to be able to do something much better than someone else can
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure you can run rings round him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我肯定你会比他强得多。

Sense.DEF:
one of the circular areas on top of a
cooker
that is heated by gas or electricity
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gas ring
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煤气炉头

Subsense.DEF:
a small square area surrounded by ropes, where people
box
or
wrestle

the sport of
boxing
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He retired from the ring at 34.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他34岁退出拳坛。

Sense.DEF:
a large circular area surrounded by seats at a
circus

Subsense.DEF: to make a bell make a sound, especially to call someone’s attention to you or to call someone to help you
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I rang the doorbell but no one came.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我按了门铃﹐但没有人来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sign said, ‘Ring for service’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 牌子上写着:“需要服务请按铃”。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Instead of ringing for the maid, she made the tea herself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有按铃叫女仆﹐而是自己沏了茶。

Subsense.DEF: if a bell rings, it makes a noise
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The bell rang for the end of break.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铃声响了﹐休息时间结束。

Subsense.DEF: to make a telephone call to someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I was going to ring you but I don’t have your number.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想给你打电话﹐但没有你的电话号码。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sally rang for a taxi.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨莉打电话叫出租车。

Subsense.DEF: if a telephone rings, it makes a sound to show that someone is telephoning you
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The phone hasn’t stopped ringing all day.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话铃整天响个不停。

Subsense.DEF: if your ears ring, they make a continuous sound that only you can hear, after you have been somewhere very noisy or heard a loud sound
Subsense.TRAN: 〔因去过吵闹的地方或听到很大的声响而耳朵〕鸣响﹐嗡嗡作响
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The explosion made our ears ring.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爆炸声震得我们耳朵嗡嗡作响。

Subsense.DEF: if a place rings with a sound, it is full of that sound

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole room rang with their laughter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个房间回荡着他们的笑声。

Sense.DEF: if something rings a bell, it reminds you of something, but you cannot remember exactly what it is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her name rings a bell but I can’t remember her face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的名字听起来耳熟﹐但是她的面孔我却记不得了。

Sense.DEF: if something does not ring true, you do not believe it, even though you are not sure why
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a possible explanation, but it didn’t quite ring true.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这也许是个理由﹐但听上去不像真的。

Sense.DEF: to make changes to something, not because it needs changing but just in order to make it more interesting, more attractive etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔为了装饰或增加趣味而〕推出新花样﹐作出不同的安排
Sense.EXAMPLE: Choose a variety of foods and ring the changes with meals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要选择不同种类的食物﹐每顿饭换换花样。

Sense.DEF: if something that someone says rings hollow, you do not feel that it is true or sincere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Assurances that things have changed ring hollow in many ears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所谓情况已有改观的保证在很多人听来都是空话。
