Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摇滚乐之王埃尔维斯

Sense.LEXUNIT: sth is the new rock ’n’ roll
Sense.DEF: used to say that a particular activity has become very popular and fashionable and is being discussed a lot on television, in newspapers etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hadn’t Mark heard that cooking was the new rock ’n’ roll?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难道马克没听说吗？ 现在烹饪最时髦了。

Sense.DEF: a small pool of water between rocks by the sea
a type of salt which is obtained from under the ground
rock-solid things can be depended on and trusted not to change
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rock-solid guarantee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可信赖的保证

Sense.DEF: very hard and not likely to break
covered with rocks or made of rock
Sense.TRAN: 岩石覆盖的﹔由岩石形成的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rocky cliff
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 岩石嶙峋的峭壁
Sense.EXAMPLE: They hurried over the rough rocky ground .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们匆匆穿过那崎岖不平的石头地。

Sense.DEF: a relationship or situation that is rocky is difficult and may not continue or be successful
Sense.TRAN: 〔关系或情形〕难以维持的﹐可能失败的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rangers got off to a rocky start this season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 流浪者队本赛季出师不利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company faces a rocky road ahead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司面临一条坎坷的发展道路。

Sense.DEF: rococo buildings and furniture have a lot of curly decoration and were fashionable in Europe in the 18th century
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑和家具〕洛可可式的〔18世纪流行于欧洲的一种装饰风格〕

Sense.DEF: a long thin pole or bar

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The walls are reinforced with steel rods.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙体都用钢筋加固。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a measuring rod
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 测量杆

Sense.DEF: a long thin pole used with a line and hook for catching fish

Crossrefto.REFLEX: rule sb/sth with a rod of iron

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
ride
any small animal of the type that has long sharp front teeth, such as a rat or a rabbit

a type of entertainment in which
cowboy s
ride wild horses, catch cattle with ropes, and ride in races
fish eggs eaten as a food

a small European and Asian
deer
that lives in forests
Sense.TRAN: 狍〔产于欧亚森林的一种小鹿〕

Sense.DEF: used in radio conversations to say that a message has been understood
Sense.TRAN: 已收到﹐明白〔无线电对话用语〕

Sense.DEF: to have sex with someone
a man or boy who behaves badly, but who you like in spite of this – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 捣蛋鬼﹐淘气鬼〔指男人或男孩﹐常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the old rogue done now, I wonder?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这回那个捣蛋鬼干了些什么呀？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lovable rogue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可爱的捣蛋鬼

Sense.DEF: a man who is dishonest and has a bad character
not behaving in the usual or accepted way and often causing trouble
Sense.EXAMPLE: rogue moneylenders
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胡作非为的放高利贷者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Officials are concerned about rogue regimes that may have nuclear weapons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 官员们对可能拥有核武器的无赖政权感到忧心忡忡。

Sense.DEF: a rogue wild animal lives apart from the main group and is often dangerous
someone with a roguish expression or smile looks amused, especially because they have done something slightly dishonest or wrong

a drug that makes you sleep, which is sometimes used to make someone unable to defend themselves against
rape
Sense.TRAN: 罗眠乐﹐氟硝安定〔一种安眠药﹐有时被用作迷奸药〕

Sense.DEF: the way in which someone or something is involved in an activity or situation, and how much influence they have on it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: women’s role in society
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性的社会角色
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the role of diet in the prevention of disease
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮食在疾病预防中的作用

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They want to limit the role of government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想限制政府的作用。

Sense.DEF: the character played by an actor in a play or film

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Matthews plays the role of a young doctor suspected of murder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马修斯扮演一名涉嫌谋杀的年轻医生。

GramExa.GLOSS: the most important role
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A young actor named Johnny Depp was given the leading role.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位名叫约翰尼·德普的年轻演员获演主角。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was Johansson’s first major movie role.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是约翰逊首次在影片中担任主角。

GramExa.GLOSS: the role of the character whose name is in the title of a film or play
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The film features Paul Schofield in the title role.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片的同名角色由保罗·斯科菲尔德担纲。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which two people, especially a man and a woman, each do what is traditionally expected of the other
Sense.TRAN: 角色倒转〔尤指男女交换传统角色〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He played a prominent role in the company’s success.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在公司的成功之路上扮演了重要角色。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: start having it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Mr Jones took on the role of spokesperson for the organization.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼斯先生就任该机构发言人一职。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Britain began to take a more active role in the affairs of Europe.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国开始在欧洲事务中发挥更加积极的作用。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She played an important role in her husband’s political career.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在丈夫的政治生涯中起了重要作用。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The report recognized the key role of teachers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报告承认了教师的关键作用。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Every member of the team has a vital role to play.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 队里的每一名成员都极其重要。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when you do practical things to achieve particular aims
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She took an active role in the community.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她积极参与社区事务。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the most important role
when someone or something does two things
one based on ideas that have existed for a long time, without changing

Sense.DEF: someone whose behaviour, attitudes etc people try to copy because they admire them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want to be a positive role model for my sister.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想成为我妹妹的好榜样。

Sense.DEF: an exercise in which you pretend to be in a particular situation, especially to help you learn a language or deal with problems
Sense.TRAN: 角色扮演〔尤指帮助学习语言或处理问题的练习〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Language teachers often use role-play in the classroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言教师经常在课堂上使用角色扮演的方法。

Sense.DEF: if something rolls, especially something round, or if you roll it, it moves along a surface by turning over and over

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ball rolled into the street.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 球滚到了街上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: One of the eggs rolled off the counter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中一只鸡蛋滚下了柜台。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Roll the chicken breasts in flour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把鸡胸脯肉在面粉里滚一下。

Sense.DEF: to turn your body over one or more times while lying down, or to turn someone else’s body over

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children rolled down the hill, laughing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们笑着从山坡上滚下来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ralph rolled onto his stomach.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉尔夫翻身趴着。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I tried to roll him onto his side.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试图让他翻过身侧卧。

Sense.DEF: to make something into the shape of a tube or ball

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Roll the dough into small balls.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把面团搓成小丸子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like the paper rolled or folded?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这纸你要卷起来﹐还是折叠起来？

Sense.DEF: to make something flat by rolling something heavy over it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pizza dough should be rolled thinly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做比萨饼的面团要擀得薄薄的。

Sense.DEF: to fold the sleeves or legs of something that you are wearing upwards, so that they are shorter
Sense.EXAMPLE: His sleeves were rolled above his elbows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的袖子卷到了胳膊肘的上面。

Sense.DEF: to move on wheels, or make something that has wheels move

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her car was slowly rolling away from the curb.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的车慢慢驶离路缘。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The waitress rolled the dessert trolley over to our table.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女服务员把甜点车推到我们的桌前。

Sense.DEF: to move over a surface smoothly without stopping

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tears rolled down her cheeks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 泪珠顺着她的脸颊滚落。

Sense.DEF: to move continuously in a particular direction

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mist rolled in from the sea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雾从海上滚涌而来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We watched the waves rolling onto the beach.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看着波浪涌上海滩。

Sense.DEF:
if you roll
dice
, you throw them as part of a game

if drums or
thunder
roll, they make a long low series of sounds
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thunder rolled in the distance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 远处雷声隆隆。

Sense.DEF:
if a machine such as a film camera or a
printing press
rolls, it operates
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was silence as the cameras started to roll.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摄影机开始转动﹐大家安静了下来。

Sense.DEF: if a ship or plane rolls, it leans one way and then another with the movement of the water or air
Sense.TRAN: 〔随着水流或气流〕左右摇晃﹐摇摆

Sense.DEF:
to make your own cigarette, using tobacco or
marijuana
and special paper
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben rolled a joint a cigarette containing marijuana and lit it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本卷了一支大麻烟点上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s cheaper to roll your own make your own cigarettes .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自己动手卷烟比较便宜。

Sense.DEF: to move your shoulders forward, up, and back down
Sense.EXAMPLE: He rolled his shoulders back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他转动双肩。

Sense.DEF: to move your eyes around and up, especially in order to show that you are annoyed or think something is silly
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤表示不快或认为某事愚蠢而〕翻〔白眼〕﹐骨碌碌地转动〔眼球〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lucy rolled her eyes as Tom sat down beside her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆在露西身旁坐下﹐露西翻了个白眼。

Sense.DEF: to rob someone, especially when they are drunk and asleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kids on the streets rolled drunks for small change.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 街头流浪儿在醉汉身上偷零钱。

Sense.DEF: if someone or something is several different things rolled into one, they include or do the work of all those things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mum was cook, chauffeur, nurse, and entertainer all rolled into one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈既要做饭又要开车﹐既要照料家人又要逗大家开心﹐真是一身数职。

Sense.DEF: to start happening or make something start happening in a smooth and successful way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The business didn’t really get rolling until 1975.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司直到1975年才真正开始运作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have a good breakfast to get your day rolling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好好地吃一顿早餐﹐开始新的一天。

Sense.DEF: to have or earn a lot of money
Sense.TRAN: 非常富有﹔财源滚滚﹔腰缠万贯
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘He’s rolling in it,’ said the girl, pointing at Lewis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他可有钱啦。”女孩指着刘易斯说。

Sense.DEF: if people in a theatre, cinema etc are rolling in the aisles, they are laughing a lot
Sense.TRAN: 〔剧院﹑电影院等的观众〕笑得东倒西歪

Sense.DEF: to be ready to start doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car was packed and we were ready to roll.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车子满了﹐我们准备出发。

Sense.DEF: used to suggest to a group of people that you all begin doing something or go somewhere
to deal with problems or difficulties by doing whatever you need to do, rather than by trying only one method
Sense.EXAMPLE: Strong industries were able to roll with the punches during the recession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实力雄厚的行业在经济衰退时期灵活应变挺了过来。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you wish a time or event would come quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Roll on the weekend!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 但愿周末早点来到！

Sense.DEF: to pronounce the sound /r/ using your tongue in a way that makes the sound very long

Sense.LEXUNIT: a rolling stone gathers no moss
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone who often changes jobs, moves to different places etc is not able to have any permanent relationships or duties
Sense.TRAN: 滚石不生苔〔形容经常换工作﹑搬迁等的人不能有长久的关系或责任〕

Sense.DEF: if a time, event etc that happens regularly rolls around, it arrives or takes place again
Sense.TRAN: 〔时间﹑事件等定期出现的事物〕到来﹐如期而至
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the time Wednesday rolled around , I still hadn’t finished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期三到来时﹐我仍然没有完成。

Sense.DEF: to reduce the influence or power of a law, system, government etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a threat to roll back the legislation of the past 12 years
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 削弱这项已实施12年的法律的威胁

Sense.DEF: to reduce a price, cost etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the administration’s promise to roll back taxes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府减税的承诺

Sense.DEF: to force your opponents in a war to move back from their position
to make someone remember something from the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: Looking at those old photos really rolled back the years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看着那些老照片﹐往事历历在目。

Sense.DEF: to open a car window
to unfold the ends of your sleeves or trouser legs so that they are their usual length
Sense.EXAMPLE: He rolled down his sleeves and buttoned the cuffs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他捋下袖子﹐扣上袖口的纽扣。

Sense.DEF: to happen or arrive in large numbers or quantities
Sense.EXAMPLE: As the result of our appeal, the money came rolling in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我们的呼吁之下﹐捐款不断地涌来。

Sense.DEF: to arrive, especially later than usual or expected
Sense.TRAN: 到达﹐抵达〔尤指迟于正常或预期〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chris finally rolled in at about 4:00 am.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凌晨4点左右﹐克里斯总算来了。

Sense.DEF: if mist, clouds etc roll in, they begin to cover an area of the sky or land
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fog rolled in from the sea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雾从海上滚涌而来。

Sense.DEF:
to make food that you are preparing flat and thin by pushing a
rolling pin
over it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Roll out the dough on a floured surface.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把面团放在撒过面粉的台面上擀薄。

Sense.DEF: to make a new product available for people to buy or use
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company expects to roll out the new software in September.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司希望在9月推出这款新软件。

Sense.DEF: to leave a place, especially later than expected
Sense.TRAN: 离开〔通常比预期的要晚〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We used to hear people rolling out of the pubs at closing time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们以前经常听到人们到了打烊时间才离开酒吧。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He finally rolled out of bed at noon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了中午﹐他终于起床了。

Sense.DEF: to put something flat on the ground or a surface, when it was previously rolled into a tube shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: We rolled out our sleeping bags under the stars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在星空下铺开睡袋。

Sense.DEF: to make special preparations for an important visitor
to turn your body over once so that you are lying in a different position, or to turn someone’s body over
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben rolled over and kissed her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本翻过身来吻她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The guards rolled him over onto his front.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看守们把他翻过身让他趴着。

Sense.DEF: to make something into the shape of a tube or ball, or to become this shape

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Painters arrived and rolled up the carpet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 油漆工来了﹐把地毯卷了起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many animals roll up into a ball for warmth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多动物缩成一团保暖。

Sense.DEF: to turn the ends of your sleeves or trouser legs over several times so that they are shorter
to start doing a job even though it is difficult or you do not want to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s time to roll up our sleeves and get some work done on the basics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该动手做点正事了。

Sense.DEF: to close the window of a car
to arrive somewhere, especially late or when you were not expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: Max rolled up just after 9 o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克斯竟然9点刚过就来了。

Sense.DEF:
used to call people to come and watch or buy things at a
circus
or
fair
Sense.TRAN: 快来呀！ 快来看！〔在马戏表演或集市上用于招徕观众〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper, camera film, money etc that has been rolled into the shape of a tube

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I used up three rolls of film on holiday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次度假我用了三卷胶卷。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a new roll of silver foil in there.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 里面有一卷新铝箔。

Sense.EXAMPLE: wallpaper costing £3 a roll
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 3英镑一卷的壁纸

Sense.DEF:
a small round
loaf
of bread for one person
Sense.EXAMPLE: hot soup served with crusty rolls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 配有酥皮面包卷的热汤
Sense.EXAMPLE: bread rolls with butter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黄油面包卷

GramExa.GLOSS: one that is filled with ham, cheese etc

Sense.DEF: an official list of names

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a school with 300 pupils on the roll
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有300名注册学生的学校

GramExa.GLOSS: say the list of names to check who is there
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The teacher called the roll.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师点名了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Three senators missed the roll call.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 点名时有三名参议员缺席。

GramExa.GLOSS: a list of the people who are allowed to vote
a list of people without jobs who claim money from the state
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Thompson said he had cut welfare rolls by 39%.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆森说他已经将救济金名单上的人数减少了39%。

Sense.DEF: to be having a lot of success with what you are trying to do
Sense.TRAN: 连连取得成功﹔连交好运
Sense.EXAMPLE: Midvale High was on a roll, having won their last six basketball games.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米德韦尔中学鸿运当头﹐最近六场篮球赛他们都赢了。

Sense.DEF:
the action of throwing
dice
as part of a game
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you get a 7 or 11 on your first roll, you win.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你第一次就掷出7点或11点﹐那你就赢了。

Sense.DEF: a thick layer of skin or fat, usually just below your waist
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常指腰部下方的〕赘皮﹐赘肉

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the rolls of fat on her stomach
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她腹部的赘肉

Subsense.DEF: a movement in which you roll forward or back in a controlled way with your body curled so that your head is near your feet, often done as part of a sport
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a forward roll
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前滚翻
Subsense.EXAMPLE: gymnasts doing rolls and handsprings
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在做滚翻和手翻的体操运动员

Subsense.DEF: the action of turning your body over one or more times while lying down
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a young horse having a roll in the field
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在田野里打滚的小马

Sense.DEF: a long low fairly loud sound made by drums etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a roll of thunder , and the rain started pelting down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷声滚滚﹐大雨开始倾盆而下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a drum roll
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咚咚的鼓声

Sense.DEF: the movement of a ship or plane when it leans from side to side with the movement of the water or air
when you have sex with someone – used humorously
an occasion when a tax, price, law etc is reduced to a previous level or changed so that it is the way it used to be
Sense.TRAN: 〔税收﹑价格等的〕回调﹐回落﹔〔法律的〕回复﹐恢复

Sense.DEF: the act of reading out an official list of names to check who is there
a piece of equipment consisting of a tube-shaped piece of wood, metal etc that rolls over and over, used for painting, crushing, making things smoother etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于油漆﹑碾压﹑平整等的〕碾子﹔滚筒﹔滚轴
Sense.EXAMPLE: a paint roller
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刷漆滚筒
Sense.EXAMPLE: a garden roller
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 碾草坪机

Sense.DEF: a tube-shaped piece of metal or wood, used for moving heavy things that have no wheels
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于移动无轮重物的〕滚棒﹐滚杆﹐滚柱
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boats are taken down to the sea on rollers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船只用滚柱移到海里。

Sense.DEF: a small plastic or metal tube used for making hair curl
a long powerful wave
Sense.EXAMPLE: great Atlantic rollers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大西洋的巨浪

Sense.DEF:
a special boot with a single row of wheels fixed under it, used for
skating
on hard surfaces
Sense.TRAN: 罗勒布雷德﹐直排轮滑鞋[旱冰鞋]

Sense.DEF: a piece of cloth or other material that can be rolled up and down to cover a window

a track with very steep slopes and curves, which people ride on in small carriages at
fair s
and
amusement park s
a situation that changes often
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their relationship was an emotional roller coaster.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的感情时好时坏。

Sense.DEF:
a special boot with four wheels fixed under it, used for
skating
on hard surfaces
Sense.TRAN: 四轮旱冰鞋﹔滚轴溜冰鞋

Sense.DEF: noisy and cheerful
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rollicking song
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欢乐喧闹的歌

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone angrily for something they have done
rolling hills have many long gentle slopes
done or happening regularly over a period of time, not all at once

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们推荐一个逐步实施的机器升级方案。

a long tube-shaped piece of wood used for making
pastry
flat and thin before you cook it
all the trains, carriages etc that are used on a railway

Sense.DEF: a list of people who are officially praised, especially because they were brave in battle

Sense.DEF:
a bottle which contains liquid that you rub under your arms in order to stop your

a roll-on roll-off ship is one that vehicles can drive straight on and off

Sense.DEF: an occasion when a new product is made available for people to buy or use

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 升阳公司只得取消推出514型号的原定计划。

Subsense.DEF:
when money is moved from one bank account or
investment
to another without any tax or other
fee s
having to be paid
Subsense.TRAN: 〔银行账户的〕转期﹔〔投资的〕转仓

Subsense.DEF:
the action of making a bank account,
investment
etc do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The law allows a rollover of retirement money from a company pension to an IRA.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律允许把退休金从公司养老金账户转到个人退休账户上。

Sense.DEF:
if there is a rollover in a competition or
lottery
, nobody wins the biggest prize that week, and the money is added to the prize that can be won the following week
Sense.TRAN: 〔比赛或彩票奖金的〕滚入下期

Sense.DEF: an accident in which a car turns over onto its roof

Sense.DEF: a very expensive and comfortable car made by a British company

Sense.DEF: something that is regarded as the highest quality example of a particular type of product

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啤酒中的极品

Sense.DEF: a cigarette that you make yourself
a roly-poly person is round and fat

a British sweet food made of
jam
that is rolled up inside

Sense.DEF: the part of a computer where permanent instructions and information are stored

a type of bitter-tasting
lettuce
with long leaves
the ordinary style of printing that uses small upright letters, like the style used for printing these words
relating to ancient Rome or the Roman Empire

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古罗马的道路
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Roman occupation of Britain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗马帝国对不列颠的占领

Sense.DEF: relating to the city of Rome

a
novel
based on the actions of real people, who are given different names in the novel so that they seem to be invented characters and not real
the alphabet used in English and many other European languages, which begins with the letters A, B, C
Sense.TRAN: 罗马字母表〔以字母 A﹐B﹐C开始﹐用于英语和欧洲许多其他语言中〕

Sense.DEF: belonging or relating to the part of the Christian religion whose leader is the Pope
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Roman Catholic priest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名天主教神父

Sense.DEF: an exciting and often short relationship between two people who love each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hemingway’s romance with his nurse inspired him to write ‘A Farewell to Arms’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海明威和他护士之间的罗曼史赋予他灵感写出《永别了﹐武器》。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Michelle married him after a whirlwind romance one that happens very suddenly and quickly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过一场旋风式的恋爱﹐米歇尔嫁给了他。

GramExa.GLOSS: one that happens during a holiday
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 假日罗曼史﹔夏日罗曼史
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a short holiday romance
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 短暂的假日罗曼史

Sense.DEF: love, or a feeling of being in love
Sense.EXAMPLE: The romance had gone out of their relationship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们之间已经没有了爱意。

Sense.DEF: the feeling of excitement and adventure that is related to a particular place, activity etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the romance of Hollywood
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好莱坞的传奇色彩

Sense.DEF: a story about the love between two people
Sense.EXAMPLE: romance novels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 言情小说

Sense.DEF: a story that has brave characters and exciting events
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Medieval romance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中世纪的传奇故事

Sense.DEF: to describe things that have happened in a way that makes them seem more important, interesting etc than they really were

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an old man romancing about the past
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 天花乱坠地大谈往事的老人

Sense.DEF: to try to persuade someone to love you
a language that comes from Latin, for example French or Spanish
Sense.TRAN: 罗曼语〔由拉丁语演变而成的语言﹐如法语或西班牙语〕

Sense.DEF:
in the style of building that was popular in Western Europe in the 11th and 12th centuries, and had many round
arch es
and thick
pillar s
Sense.TRAN: 罗马式的〔多用圆拱顶和粗圆柱的建筑风格﹐流行于11和12世纪的西欧〕

Sense.DEF: a nose that curves out near the top
a number in a system first used in ancient Rome that uses combinations of the letters I, V, X, L, C, D, and M to represent numbers
ancient Roman and something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Romano-British society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗马帝国统治时期的不列颠社会

Sense.DEF: showing strong feelings of love
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Tom always sends me red roses on my birthday.’ ‘How romantic!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我过生日时汤姆总是给我送红玫瑰。”“多浪漫啊！”

Sense.DEF: relating to feelings of love or a loving relationship
Sense.EXAMPLE: After dinner, they took a romantic stroll by the sea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚饭后﹐他们浪漫地沿着海边散步。
Sense.EXAMPLE: real old-fashioned romantic love
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真正老派的浪漫爱情
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not ready for a romantic relationship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没准备好谈恋爱。

Sense.DEF: a romantic story or film is about love
Sense.EXAMPLE: a romantic comedy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱情喜剧

Sense.DEF: beautiful in a way that affects your emotions and makes you think of love or adventure
Sense.TRAN: 富有浪漫情调的﹔充满传奇色彩的
Sense.EXAMPLE: romantic music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富有情调的音乐
Sense.EXAMPLE: The castle is set in one of England’s most romantic landscapes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城堡坐落在英格兰最富浪漫气息的风景区之一。

Sense.DEF: romantic ideas are not practical or not based on reality
Sense.TRAN: 不切实际的﹐耽于幻想的﹐空想的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: romantic notions about becoming a famous actress
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望成为著名女演员的幻想
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Like many New Yorkers, he had a romantic image of country life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 像许多纽约人一样﹐他对乡村生活也有一种不切实际的美好幻想。

Sense.DEF: art or literature that is based on the ideas of romanticism
someone who shows strong feelings of love and likes doing things that are related to love such as buying flowers, presents etc
someone who is not practical, and bases their ideas too much on an imagined idea of the world
Sense.TRAN: 爱幻想的人﹐浪漫主义者
Sense.EXAMPLE: a romantic who longed for adventure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 渴望冒险的浪漫主义者

Sense.DEF: a writer, painter etc whose work is based on romanticism
a film which is intended to make people laugh and which involves a love story
a way of writing or painting that was popular in the late 18th and early 19th century, in which feelings, imagination, and wild natural beauty were considered more important than anything else
Sense.TRAN: 浪漫主义〔18世纪末19世纪初流行的写作或绘画风格〕

Sense.DEF: ideas which are not practical or not based on reality
to talk or think about things in a way that makes them seem more romantic or attractive than they really are
Sense.TRAN: 使浪漫化﹐使具有浪漫色彩
Sense.EXAMPLE: a romanticized image of life during the war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对战时生活的浪漫化描写

Sense.DEF:
a
gypsy

the language traditionally used by the
gypsy
people

a
romantic comedy

a man who tries to attract all the women he meets in a
romantic
or sexual way – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 罗密欧式的男人﹐浪漫多情的男子〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: one of William Shakespeare’s best-known plays, a sad romantic story about two young people, Romeo and Juliet, who fall in love although their families are great enemies. They marry secretly, but are prevented from being together, and finally they both kill themselves. They are considered to be typical examples of unlucky young lovers.
Sense.TRAN: 《罗密欧与朱丽叶》〔威廉·莎士比亚最著名的剧本之一﹐讲述一对青年男女不顾两家世仇而真心相爱的悲剧故事。 罗密欧与朱丽叶被认为是不幸的青年恋人的典型〕

Sense.DEF: to play in a noisy way, especially by running, jumping etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They could hear the children romping around upstairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们听到孩子们在楼上蹦跳打闹。

Sense.DEF: to win a race, competition, election etc very easily

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The women’s team romped to a 132-81 win over Ireland.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女队以132比81轻取爱尔兰队。

Sense.EXAMPLE: In 1906 the Liberal Party romped back to power.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1906年自由党轻松获胜﹐重新掌权。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The favourite, Badawi, romped home in the first race.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 夺冠呼声最高的巴达维轻松拿下了第一场比赛。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in doing or finishing something quickly and easily
a piece of amusing entertainment which has a lot of exciting scenes
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘A Royal Scandal’ is an hour-long romp that pokes fun at British royal marriages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《王室丑闻》是一部一小时长的揶揄英国王室婚姻的闹剧。

Sense.DEF: a period of sexual activity – used humorously, especially in newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 调情〔幽默用法﹐尤用于报纸上〕

Sense.DEF: when one sports team defeats another one very easily – used in newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 〔体育比赛中的〕轻易取胜〔用于报纸上〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Yankees’ 12-1 romp over the Red Sox
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 扬基队12比1轻松战胜红袜队

Sense.DEF: a piece of music in which the main tune is repeated several times
if something passes the Ronseal test, it successfully does what it claims it can do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will the new legislation pass the Ronseal test?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项新法规会收到预期成效吗？

Sense.DEF:
a decorated wooden or stone wall in a Christian church which divides the part where the
choir
sit from the part where other people sit
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教教堂中把唱诗班与会众隔开的〕圣坛（隔）屏

Sense.DEF: the structure that covers or forms the top of a building, vehicle, tent etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物﹑汽车﹑帐篷等的〕顶﹐顶部
Sense.EXAMPLE: They finally found the cat up on the roof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们最后在屋顶上找到了那只猫。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We can probably strap the cases to the roof of her car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们也许可以把箱子捆在她的车顶上。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 石板瓦/瓦片/茅草等屋顶

Sense.EXAMPLE: a flat roof
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平顶
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pitched roof sloping roof
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斜顶

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a wooden-roofed theatre
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 木屋顶的戏院

PIC.HEADING: ROOF 屋顶
PIC.PICCONTENT: chimney 烟囱；gable 三角墙；beam 梁；slate 石板瓦；gutter 檐沟；roof 屋顶；skylight 天窗

Sense.DEF: the top of a passage under the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly, the whole tunnel roof caved in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然间﹐隧道顶部整个塌陷。

Sense.DEF: somewhere to live
Sense.EXAMPLE: I may not have a job, but at least I’ve got a roof over my head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是没有工作﹐但我至少还有个住的地方。

Subsense.DEF: to suddenly become very angry
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Put that back before Dad sees you and hits the roof!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赶紧放回去﹐免得爸爸看见了大发雷霆！

Subsense.DEF: if a price, cost etc goes through the roof, it increases to a very high level

Sense.DEF: the hard upper part of the inside of your mouth

Sense.LEXUNIT: under the same roof/under one roof
Sense.DEF: in the same building or home
Sense.EXAMPLE: If we’re going to live under the same roof , we need to get along.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要想住在同一个屋檐下﹐就得和睦相处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here you can buy food, clothes, and electrical goods all under one roof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在这一家店里你可以买到食物﹑衣服和电器。

Sense.DEF: in your home
Sense.EXAMPLE: As long as you live under my roof, you’ll do as I say.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要你住在我家里﹐就得照我说的办。

Sense.DEF: if the roof falls in or caves in, something bad suddenly happens to you when you do not expect it
to put a roof on a building

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a cottage roofed with the local slate
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用当地的石板瓦做房顶的小屋

Sense.DEF: to cover an open space by putting a roof over it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re going to roof in the yard to make a garage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们打算给院子加个顶当车库。

Sense.DEF:
an illegal drug that is sometimes used to make someone unconscious so they can be
rape d
Sense.TRAN: 罗眠乐﹐氟硝安定〔有时被用作迷奸药〕

Sense.DEF: material used for making or covering roofs
the job of building or repairing roofs
a metal frame fixed on top of a car and used for carrying bags, cases etc
the upper surface of a roof
Sense.EXAMPLE: Spectators stood on rooftops to watch the parade.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众站在屋顶上观看庆祝游行。

Sense.DEF:
a large black European bird like a
crow

one of the pieces in a game of
chess
someone who has just started doing a job and has little experience
Sense.EXAMPLE: rookie cops
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新手警察

Sense.DEF: someone who is in their first year of playing a professional sport
Sense.TRAN: 〔第一年参加职业体育比赛的〕新选手

Sense.DEF: a part of the inside of a building that has its own walls, floor, and ceiling
Sense.EXAMPLE: I looked around the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我四下看了看房间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She nodded toward a man who was standing across the room on the other side of the room .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她朝站在屋子另一头的一个男人点点头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone was laughing in the next room the one beside the one you are in .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 隔壁房间有人在笑。

GramExa.GLOSS: someone’s bedroom
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Beth, it’s time to clean up your room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝丝﹐你该收拾你的房间了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the doctor’s waiting room
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生的候诊室

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a three-room apartment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有三个房间的公寓

GramExa.GLOSS: a room in a hotel for one person or for two
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d like to book a double room for two nights.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想预订一个双人房间住两个晚上。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Here’s your key - room 348.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是你的钥匙——348号房间。

Sense.DEF: space somewhere for a particular thing, person, or activity
Sense.TRAN: 〔供某物﹑某人或某个活动使用的〕空间﹐地方

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I hope there’s going to be enough room in the fridge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 但愿冰箱里有足够的空间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My suitcase was so full I didn’t have room for anything else.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的手提箱塞得满满的﹐没有地方再放其他东西了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The museum doesn’t have enough room to show everything in their collection.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 博物馆没有足够的空间展示所有藏品。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s plenty of room in the boot for your luggage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 车后的行李箱有足够的空间装你的行李。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m trying to make room for a vegetable garden in the backyard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想在后院腾出地方做菜园。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Step back, leave room for people to get past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 往后退一退﹐让出地方给人通过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old wardrobe took up too much room .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧衣橱太占地方了。

GramExa.GLOSS: space for your legs or head in a vehicle
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔交通工具内的〕腿部/头部活动空间

Sense.DEF: the chance to do something, or the possibility that something exists or can happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s little room for innovation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有多少创新的空间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The evidence was clear, and there was little room for doubt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 证据确凿﹐几乎无可怀疑。

GramExa.GLOSS: the possibility of changing what you do or decide
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Teachers feel they have little room for manoeuvre when the curriculum is so demanding.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 课程要求这么严格﹐教师感到没有多少回旋余地。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Children need to have room to develop their natural creativity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童需要空间来发挥他们天生的创造力。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Make room in your day for exercise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每天要留出锻炼的时间。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is not perfect and needs to be improved
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report shows that there is room for improvement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告表明还有改进的余地。

Sense.LEXUNIT: there’s not enough room to swing a cat
Sense.DEF: used humorously to say that an area or room is not very big
Sense.TRAN: 〔地方或空间〕小得无法转身〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: two or more rooms that you rent in a building, or stay in at a college
Sense.TRAN: 〔租住的或大学里的〕居室﹔寓所

Sense.DEF: all the people in a room

GramExa.EXAMPLE: started singing ‘Happy Birthday’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里的人都唱起了生日快乐歌。

Sense.DEF: to rent and live in a room somewhere
to share a room or house with someone, especially at college
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在大学里〕与…同住一室 [处]
Sense.EXAMPLE: I roomed with Al at UCSD.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在加州大学圣迭戈分校的时候我和阿尔同住一个房间。

Sense.DEF: a room to sleep in, with food provided
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll receive free room and board with the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个工作提供免费食宿。

Sense.DEF: someone who pays rent to live in a house with its owner
a large number of things or people that are all together in one room

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a roomful of reporters
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一屋子的记者

Sense.DEF: a house where people can rent a room to live in
someone who you share a room with, especially at college
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of my college roommates
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我大学里的一个室友

Sense.DEF: someone you share an apartment or house with
Sense.TRAN: 同住一套公寓[一幢房子]的人

Sense.DEF: a service provided by a hotel, by which food and drinks can be sent to a guest’s room
the normal temperature inside a house
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wine should be served at room temperature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种葡萄酒应该在常温下饮用。

Sense.DEF: a house, car etc that is roomy is large and has a lot of space inside it
a place where birds rest and sleep
if a bird roosts, it rests or sleeps somewhere

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb’s chickens come home to roost
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone’s past mistakes are causing problems for them now
Sense.EXAMPLE: After years of overspending, the chickens have come home to roost.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年复一年地超支﹐现在终于尝到苦果了。

Sense.DEF: a male chicken
the part of a plant or tree that grows under the ground and gets water from the soil
Sense.EXAMPLE: tree roots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树根
Sense.EXAMPLE: These plants produce a number of thin roots.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些植物会长出一些细根。

Sense.DEF: the main cause of a problem

GramExa.PROPFORM: be/lie at the root of sth
GramExa.GLOSS: be the cause of something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Allergies are at the root of a lot of health problems.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 过敏是许多健康问题的根源。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The love of money is the root of all evil .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贪财是万恶之源。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A competent mechanic should be able to get to the root of the problem find out the cause of a problem .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 称职的机械师应该能够找到问题的根源。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the root causes of crime
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪的根本原因

Sense.DEF: the origin or main part of something such as a custom, law, activity etc, from which other things have developed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a legal system with roots in English common law
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 基于英国普通法的司法制度
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jazz has its roots in the folk songs of the southern states of the US.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爵士乐起源于美国南部诸州的民歌。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be/lie at the root of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the liberal economic policies which lie at the root of American power
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 成为美国国力基础的自由经济政策

Sense.DEF: your relation to a place because you were born there, or your family used to live there
Sense.TRAN: 某人的根〔指与出生地﹑家乡的联系〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: immigrants keeping in touch with their cultural roots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和自己的文化根脉一直保持着联系的移民
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alex Haley’s story about his search for his roots became a bestseller.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚历克斯·哈利写的关于他寻根的故事成了畅销书。

Sense.DEF: if you put down roots somewhere, you start to feel that a place is your home and to have relationships with the people there
Sense.EXAMPLE: Because of her husband’s job, they’d moved too often to put down roots anywhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为丈夫工作的关系﹐他们经常搬家﹐难以在一个地方扎下根来。

Sense.DEF: the part of a tooth, hair etc that connects it to the rest of your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’d pulled some of Kelly’s hair out by the roots.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她连根拔下了凯利的几根头发。

Subsense.DEF: if an idea, method, activity etc takes root, people begin to accept or believe it, or it begins to have an effect
Subsense.TRAN: 〔观点﹑方法﹑活动等〕扎根﹔深入人心﹔开始见效
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Economists believe that economic recovery will begin to take root next year.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济学家相信明年经济将开始复苏。

Subsense.DEF: if a plant takes root, it starts to grow where you have planted it

Sense.DEF: to search for something by moving other things around

the basic part of a word which shows its main meaning, to which other parts can be added. For example, the word ‘coldness’ is formed from the root ‘cold’ and the
suffix
‘ness’.
a number that, when multiplied by itself a certain number of times, equals the number that you have
Sense.EXAMPLE: 2 is the fourth root of 16.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 2是16的4次方根。

Sense.DEF: if you destroy or change something root and branch, you get rid of it or change it completely and permanently because it is bad
Sense.TRAN: 彻底地﹐永久地〔消除或改变不良事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a root and branch reform of the electoral system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对选举制度的彻底改革

Subsense.DEF: to grow roots
Subsense.EXAMPLE: New shrubs will root easily in summer.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新灌木在夏季容易生根。

Subsense.DEF: if a plant is rooted somewhere, it is held in the ground firmly by its roots
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a bush firmly rooted in the hard ground
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牢牢扎根于硬实土地的一丛灌木

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Clumps of thyme had rooted themselves between the rocks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一丛丛百里香在岩石中间扎了根。

Sense.DEF: to have developed from something and be strongly influenced by it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country’s economic troubles are rooted in a string of global crises.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家的经济困境是源于一连串的全球危机。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This feeling of rejection is often deeply rooted in childhood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种受排斥的感觉往往起源于童年﹐根深蒂固。

Sense.DEF: to search for something by moving things around

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Leila rooted through her handbag for a pen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉拉在手提包里翻找钢笔。

Sense.DEF: if a pig roots somewhere, it looks for food under the ground

GramExa.EXAMPLE: pigs rooting for truffles
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拱土寻找块菌的猪

Sense.DEF: so shocked, surprised, or frightened that you cannot move
Sense.TRAN: 〔震惊﹑惊讶或害怕得〕呆住不动
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stood rooted to the spot, staring at him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她呆若木鸡地站着﹐盯住他看。

Sense.DEF: to want someone to succeed in a competition, test, or difficult situation
Sense.TRAN: 给〔参赛者﹑应试者或处境困难的人〕支持﹔鼓励﹔声援
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can do it - I’m rooting for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你行的——我支持你。

Sense.DEF: to support a sports team or player by shouting and cheering
Sense.TRAN: 为〔参赛队或运动员〕欢呼[喝彩﹐加油]
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Los Angeles fans rooting for the Lakers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为湖人队喝彩加油的洛杉矶球迷

Sense.DEF: to find out where a particular kind of problem exists and get rid of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Action is being taken to root out corruption in the police force.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在采取措施根除警察队伍里的腐败现象。

Sense.DEF: to find something by searching for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll try and root out something for you to wear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会找些衣服出来给你穿。

Sense.DEF: to dig or pull a plant up with its roots
a sweet brown non-alcoholic drink made from the roots of some plants, drunk especially in the US
Sense.TRAN: 根啤﹐根汁汽水〔一种由某些植物根部制成的不含酒精的饮料﹐尤盛行于美国〕

Sense.DEF: the space inside the root of a tooth
Sense.EXAMPLE: root canal treatment treatment in which a dentist removes a diseased area in the root of a tooth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牙根管治疗

Sense.DEF: a vegetable or plant that is grown so that its roots can be sold
to search for something by moving many other things around
having nowhere that you feel is really your home
Sense.EXAMPLE: rootless people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漂泊不定的人

Sense.DEF:
a popular style of
reggae
which is a mixture of Jamaican
ska
and American styles such as
pop music
,
rock and roll
, and
rhythm and blues
Sense.TRAN: 根源雷鬼乐〔一种糅合了牙买加斯卡音乐和美国流行乐﹑摇滚乐及节奏布鲁斯的音乐〕

Sense.DEF: rootsy music is music that is played in the traditional way for a particular style of music
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rootsy blues album
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张传统风格的蓝调专辑

Sense.DEF:
a vegetable such as a potato or
carrot
that grows under the ground
Sense.TRAN: 根菜类疏菜〔如马铃薯﹑胡萝卜〕

Sense.DEF: very strong thick string, made by twisting together many thinner strings
Sense.EXAMPLE: They tied a rope around my waist and pulled me up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在我腰间系了一根粗绳子﹐把我拉了上去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The man was coiling a length of rope.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那人正在卷一段绳子。

PIC.HEADING: ROPE 绳
PIC.PICCONTENT: rope 粗绳；string 细绳；thread 线

Subsense.DEF: all the things someone needs to know to do a job or deal with a system
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I spent the first month just learning the ropes .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一个月我只是熟悉了情况。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He works repairing streets, and knows the ropes when it comes to safety.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是修路的﹐讲到安全﹐他很在行。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Miss McGinley will show you the ropes and answer any questions.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦金利小姐会教你怎么做﹐并解答你的所有问题。

Subsense.DEF:
the rope fence that surrounds an area used for
boxing
or
wrestling
Subsense.TRAN: 〔拳击或摔跤场地四周的〕围绳﹐圈绳

Sense.DEF: to be in a very bad situation, in which you are likely to be defeated
Sense.EXAMPLE: The army says the rebels are on the ropes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军方说叛军已经走投无路。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be at/near etc the end of your rope
Sense.DEF:
to have no more
patience
or strength left to deal with a problem or a difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: My son is causing endless problems, and I’m close to the end of my rope.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我儿子没完没了地惹麻烦﹐我快要忍无可忍了。

Sense.DEF: to give someone a lot of freedom to do something in the way they want to do it
Sense.TRAN: 给某人一些/足够等的自由
Sense.EXAMPLE: Managers have to decide how much rope to give their subordinates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经理人员必须决定应该给下属多少自由。

Sense.LEXUNIT: give sb enough rope to hang themselves
Sense.DEF: to give someone freedom to do what they want to do, because you think they will cause problems for themselves and you want them to look stupid
Sense.TRAN: 任由某人自作自受﹐听任某人自取灭亡

Sense.DEF:
pearl s
on a string, worn around your neck as jewellery
to tie things together using rope

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Suitcases were roped to the top of the car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 手提箱用绳子固定在车顶上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mountaineers rope themselves together for safety.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了安全﹐登山者用绳子把彼此连在一起。

Sense.DEF: to catch an animal using a circle of rope
Sense.EXAMPLE: The calves are roped and branded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用绳套捉住牛犊后将其打上烙印。

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone to help you in a job or join in an activity, especially when they do not want to
Sense.TRAN: 劝说〔尤指不愿意者〕帮忙[参加]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Denise roped me into selling tickets.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼丝拉我去卖票。

GramExa.PROPFORM: rope sb in to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anyone who could sing was roped in to help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凡是能唱歌的人都被拉去帮忙了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have you been roped in too?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你也被拉进去了？

Sense.DEF: to surround an area with ropes, especially in order to separate it from another area
Sense.TRAN: 用绳把〔某一区域〕围起来﹐用绳分隔
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stairs were roped off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 楼梯用绳子拦了起来。

Sense.DEF:
a
ladder
made of two long ropes connected by wooden pieces that you stand on
in bad condition or of bad quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: ropey old furniture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 破旧的家具

Sense.DEF: slightly ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m feeling a bit ropey this morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天早上我觉得有些不舒服。

Sense.DEF:
a
roll-on roll-off
ship
a method of testing someone’s character, by making them say what they think spots of ink with various shapes look like
Sense.TRAN: 罗夏测验〔让测试对象解释不同的墨迹图形﹐以判断其性格的一种测试方法〕

Sense.DEF:
a string of
bead s
used by Roman Catholics for counting prayers

the set of prayers that are said by Roman Catholics while counting rosary
bead s

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Three nuns knelt there, reciting the rosary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 三名修女跪在那儿念玫瑰经。

Sense.DEF: pink wine
a flower that often has a pleasant smell, and is usually red, pink, white, or yellow, or the bush that this flower grows on
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dozen red roses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一打红玫瑰
Sense.EXAMPLE: A large bouquet of roses arrived on her desk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大束玫瑰送到了她的桌子上。

Sense.DEF: a pink colour

Sense.LEXUNIT: sth is not a bed of roses
Sense.DEF: if a job or situation is not a bed of roses, it is not always pleasant and there are difficult things to deal with 【非正式】
Sense.TRAN: 某事不尽如人意﹐某事并非事事顺利
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s no bed of roses teaching in a secondary school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中学可不好教啊。

Sense.LEXUNIT: put the roses back in sb’s cheeks
Sense.DEF: to make someone look healthy again
Sense.TRAN: 使某人恢复健康的气色

Sense.DEF: to be happening or developing in the best possible way

Sense.LEXUNIT: come out of sth/come up smelling of roses
Sense.DEF: to do well or get an advantage from a situation, when you could have been blamed, criticized, or harmed by it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She managed to come out of the deal smelling of roses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把自己洗脱得干干净净。

Sense.DEF:
a circular piece of metal with holes in it that is attached to the end of a pipe or
watering can
so that liquid comes out in several thin streams
Sense.TRAN: 〔水管或洒水壶上的〕莲蓬式喷嘴

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
rise
pink in colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: rose velvet curtains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玫瑰色天鹅绒窗帘

Sense.DEF: pink
Sense.EXAMPLE: the roseate glow of the evening sun
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夕阳的玫瑰色余晖

Sense.DEF: an American football game held in January every year in Pasadena, California between two of the best college football teams in the US
Sense.TRAN: 玫瑰杯赛〔每年1月在加利福尼亚州帕萨迪纳举行的美式橄榄球赛﹐参赛双方为美国两支最优秀的大学橄榄球队〕

Sense.DEF:
the
stadium
where this game is played. The Rose Bowl is also used for other American football games, as well as other sports games, such as soccer.
Sense.TRAN: 玫瑰碗体育场〔举行玫瑰杯赛的体育场﹐也用来举行其他美式橄榄球﹑足球等赛事〕

Sense.DEF: the flower of a rose before it opens
a mouth or lips that have a small round shape and are very red
pink
if you see or view something through rose-coloured glasses, you think it is better than it really is
Sense.TRAN: 玫瑰色的眼镜〔表示乐观地看待事物〕

Sense.DEF: the small red fruit produced by some kinds of rose bushes, used in medicines and juices
the narrow leaves of a bush, used as a herb, or the bush that these leaves come from
Sense.TRAN: 迷迭香叶〔用作香草〕﹔迷迭香

Sense.DEF: a large ancient stone that was found in Egypt in 1799, which had the same piece of writing on it in three different writing systems: Greek letters, Egyptian letters, and ancient Egyptian hieroglyphics. This important discovery made it possible for people to translate hieroglyphics for the first time. The stone is now kept in the British Museum. Something that could provide the answer to a problem, especially in a particular area of science, is sometimes called a Rosetta Stone.
Sense.TRAN: 罗塞塔石碑〔1799年在埃及发现的一块巨型石碑﹐碑文用希腊文﹑埃及文和古埃及象形文字三种不同的书写体系刻写﹐这一重要发现使现代人首次得以解读古埃及象形文字。此说法有时喻指可为某疑问提供答案的事物﹐尤用于科学领域〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The study of genes in mice could be the Rosetta Stone for establishing the functions of human genes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对老鼠基因的研究可能成为确定人类基因功能的关键。

Sense.DEF:
a circular
badge
made of coloured
ribbon
that is given to the winner of a competition, or that people in Britain wear to show support for a particular football team or political party
Sense.TRAN: （玫瑰）花结〔授予比赛胜利者的一个圆形奖章﹔在英国亦是支持某个足球队或政党的标志〕

Sense.DEF: a shape like a round flat flower that has been made in stone or wood
a liquid made from roses which has a pleasant smell
a circular window in a church, especially one with coloured glass in it
Sense.TRAN: 〔教堂的〕玫瑰窗﹐圆花窗〔尤指有彩色玻璃的圆窗〕

Sense.DEF: a hard dark red wood, used for making expensive furniture
the Jewish new year holiday

a solid slightly sticky substance that you rub on the
bow
of a
violin
etc, to help it move smoothly on the strings
a list of the names of people on a sports team, in an organization etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The club has outstanding players on the roster.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 俱乐部的花名册上不乏优秀球员。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The campaign has a roster of 500 volunteers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次活动有500名志愿者参加。

Sense.DEF: a list that shows when each person in a group must do a particular job
Sense.EXAMPLE: duty roster
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 值勤表

Sense.DEF: to put someone’s name on a roster
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某人的名字〕列入人员名单[值勤表]中

Sense.DEF:
a small
platform
that you stand on when you are making a speech or
conduct ing
musicians
Sense.TRAN: 讲坛[台]﹔〔乐队指挥站的〕指挥台

Sense.DEF: seeming to offer hope of success or happiness
Sense.TRAN: 充满成功希望的﹐美好的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a company that sees a rosy future for itself
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 认为业务前景一片光明的公司
Sense.EXAMPLE: Letters to relatives in Europe painted a rosy picture of life in the United States.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 写给欧洲亲戚的信把美国的生活描绘得如花似锦。

Sense.DEF: pink
Sense.EXAMPLE: the kids’ rosy cheeks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们红润的双颊

Sense.DEF: to decay by a gradual natural process, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Candy will rot your teeth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吃糖会腐蚀牙齿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trees were cut and left to rot .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树被砍伐后任其腐烂。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the woodwork was rotting away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 木结构部分都在腐烂。

Sense.DEF: to suffer or be punished for a long time – used especially when you are angry with someone
Sense.TRAN: 烂在地狱里/监狱里〔尤用于表示对某人生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope the people who did this rot in hell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望做这件事的人不得好死。

Sense.DEF: the natural process of decaying, or the part of something that has decayed
Sense.EXAMPLE: the smell of rot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 腐烂的气味
Sense.EXAMPLE: wood that is soft with rot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 腐烂变软的木头

Sense.DEF: a state in which something becomes bad or does not work as well as it should
Sense.EXAMPLE: He criticized the talk shows as ‘cultural rot’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他批评这些清谈节目是“文化垃圾”。

GramExa.GLOSS: stop a bad situation getting worse
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The team has enough good players to stop the rot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支球队有不少优秀球员﹐足以止住颓势。

GramExa.GLOSS: a situation started to get worse
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was after he left the company that the rot set in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司是在他离开之后开始走下坡路的。

Sense.DEF: nonsense
Sense.EXAMPLE: You do talk rot!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你尽说蠢话！

Sense.DEF: a list that shows when each person in a group must do a particular job
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cleaning rota
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卫生轮值表

Sense.DEF: turning in a circle around a fixed point, like a wheel
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rotary movement of the helicopter blades
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直升机螺旋桨叶的转动

Sense.DEF: having a main part that turns like a wheel
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rotary engine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旋转式发动机

Sense.DEF:
a
roundabout 1 1
an organization of business people in a town who work together to raise money for people who are poor or sick
Sense.TRAN: 扶轮社〔城市中的商界人士为贫困者和病人筹款的组织〕

Sense.DEF: to turn with a circular movement around a central point, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Earth rotates on its axis once every 24 hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地球每24小时绕地轴自转一周。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rotate the pan halfway through the baking time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烘烤到一半时把盘子转一下。

Sense.DEF: if a job rotates, or if people rotate jobs, they each do a particular job for a particular period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chairmanship of the committee rotates annually.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会主席的职位每年轮换一次。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Employers may rotate duties to give staff wider experience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇主会安排轮换工作岗位﹐以丰富员工的经验。

Sense.DEF: to change the places of things or people, or to change places, especially in a circular direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rotating the tyres every few months helps them last longer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每隔几个月给轮胎换位一次﹐可延长其使用寿命。

Sense.DEF: to regularly change the crops grown on a piece of land, in order to preserve the quality of the soil
when something turns with a circular movement around a central point

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the rotation of the Earth on its axis
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地球绕地轴的自转

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the planet’s rotation around the sun
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 行星围绕太阳的公转

Sense.DEF: one complete circular turn around a central point
Sense.EXAMPLE: The blades spin at 100 rotations per minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叶片每分钟转100圈。

Sense.DEF: the practice of regularly changing the thing that is being used or done, or the person who does a particular job
Sense.EXAMPLE: job rotation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作的轮换

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Three plays will be performed in rotation during the drama festival.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戏剧节期间将有三个剧目轮流上演。

Sense.DEF: a period of time spent doing a particular job, when you will soon change to a different job for the same employer
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young doctor on a rotation in the children’s ward
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮岗到儿童病房的一名年轻医生

Sense.DEF: the people who each take a turn to do a particular job in a regular order
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rotation included two rookies, Hernandez and Saunders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮岗的人中有两个新手——埃尔南德斯和桑德斯。

Sense.DEF: when you learn something by repeating it many times, without thinking about it carefully or without understanding it
Sense.EXAMPLE: In old-fashioned schools, much learning was by rote .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在旧式学校里﹐很多学习都是靠死记硬背。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rote learning of facts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对资料的死记硬背

Sense.TRAN:
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= rolling on the floor laughing , used by people communicating in
chat room s
on the Internet to say that they are very amused by something that someone else has written 笑得在地上打滚〔网上聊天室用语〕

Sense.DEF: strong cheap low-quality alcohol
a piece of equipment for cooking meat by turning it around and around on a metal rod over heat
a part of a machine that turns around on a central point

the long flat part that turns around and around on top of a
helicopter
badly decayed and no longer good to use
Sense.EXAMPLE: the smell of rotten eggs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坏鸡蛋的气味
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the wood was completely rotten.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些木头完全腐烂了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The apples went rotten very quickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苹果很快就腐烂了。

Sense.DEF: very bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: What rotten luck !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真倒霉！
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rotten idea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个馊主意
Sense.EXAMPLE: The service was rotten.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 服务很差劲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a rotten driver.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个蹩脚的司机。

Sense.DEF: if someone is rotten, they are unpleasant, unkind, or dishonest
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕不友善的﹐刻薄的﹐不诚实的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why are you being so rotten?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么这么刻薄啊？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rotten little brat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个讨厌的小坏蛋

Subsense.DEF: to feel ill
to feel unhappy and guilty about something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I felt rotten about lying to him.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对他撒了谎﹐感觉很不好。

Sense.DEF: used when you are angry
Sense.TRAN: 令人讨厌的〔用于表示生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want your rotten money!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我才不要你的臭钱！

Sense.DEF: extremely dishonest
Sense.TRAN: 极不正当的﹐败坏透顶的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole government is rotten to the core.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个政府都腐败透顶。

Sense.DEF: one bad person who has a bad effect on all the others in a group
to treat someone too well or too kindly, especially a child, so that they think they should always have what they want
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was the favorite, and his mother spoiled him rotten.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是最宝贝的一个﹐他母亲都把他宠坏了。

Sense.DEF: to be extremely attracted to someone in a sexual way – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 被某人迷得神魂颠倒﹐ 对某人极为迷恋〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: an unpleasant person who treats other people badly
a type of strong and dangerous dog, often used as a guard dog
Sense.TRAN: 罗特韦尔犬﹐罗威纳犬〔一种强壮凶猛的狗﹐多作看门用〕

Sense.DEF: having a fat round body – used humorously

a round building or hall, especially one with a
dome
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指有圆顶的〕圆形建筑﹔圆形大厅

Sense.DEF: the standard unit of money in Russia and Belarus
Sense.TRAN: 卢布〔俄罗斯和白俄罗斯的货币单位〕

Sense.DEF: a man who believes that pleasure is the most important thing in life – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 浪荡子﹐酒色之徒〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: pink or red powder or cream that women put on their cheeks
having an uneven surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her hands were rough from hard work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的双手因为干重活而变得很粗糙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rough terrain at the base of the mountains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 山脚下崎岖不平的地形
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were bumping over the rough ground .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在崎岖的地面上颠簸而行。

Sense.DEF: not exact, not containing many details, or not in a final form
Sense.TRAN: 不确切的﹐粗略的﹐大致的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rough sketch of the house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子的草图
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rough translation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粗略的翻译
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you give me a rough idea what time you’ll be home?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能告诉我你大概什么时候在家吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rough estimate of the cost
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对成本的粗略估计
Sense.EXAMPLE: First do a rough draft of your essay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先给你的文章写一个草稿。

Sense.DEF: a rough period is one in which you have a lot of problems or difficulties
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first year was rough, but things have gotten better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一年很艰难﹐但现在已经好起来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sounds like you had a rough day .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听上去你这一天很不顺。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve been through some rough times together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们曾经共渡难关。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My boyfriend and I were going through a rough patch .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和我的男朋友之间有点麻烦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bill is in for a rough ride in the Senate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项议案在参议院受阻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s been rough going , but we’ve almost finished now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很费劲﹐不过我们现在基本上已经完成了。

Sense.DEF: using force, anger, or violence
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rugby is a very rough sport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 橄榄球是一项非常粗野的运动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be too rough - she’s only little.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别太粗暴——她还小。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul gave her a rough shake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗使劲地摇晃她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: equipment capable of withstanding rough treatment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坚固耐用的设备
Sense.EXAMPLE: The referee won’t allow any rough stuff violent behaviour .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 裁判不允许出现任何粗暴行为。

GramExa.GLOSS: treat someone unkindly or criticize them in an angry way
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t you think you were a little rough on her?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不觉得你对她有点凶吗？

Sense.DEF: a rough area is a place where there is a lot of violence or crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rough part of town
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城里龙蛇混杂的地区

Sense.DEF: with strong wind or storms
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ship went down in rough seas .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船在汹涌的波涛中沉没了。

Subsense.DEF: not sounding soft or gentle, and often rather unpleasant or angry
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Barton’s deep, rough voice
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴顿低沉沙哑的嗓音

Subsense.DEF: having an unpleasant sound, especially because there is something wrong with a machine
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指机器出现故障时发出的声音〕刺耳的﹐难听的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The clutch sounds rough – better get it checked.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离合器的声音不对头﹐最好检查一下。

Sense.DEF: simple and often not very well made
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rough wooden table
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粗糙的木桌

Sense.DEF: uncomfortable, and with difficult conditions
Sense.EXAMPLE: The journey was long and rough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅途漫长而艰苦。

Subsense.DEF: to have some parts that are not as good as they should be, but that are not a serious problem
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The team has a few rough edges, but they’re winning more games.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支球队虽然有些小问题﹐但他们在赢得更多的比赛。

Subsense.DEF: if a person is rough around the edges, they are not very polite, educated etc

Sense.DEF: a night when you did not sleep well
Sense.TRAN: 不眠之夜﹐辗转反侧的一夜
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mickey had a rough night last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米基昨晚睡得很不安稳。

Sense.DEF: something that happens to you that is unfair or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 不公平的待遇﹔不愉快的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s had a rough deal with his wife leaving him like that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的妻子就这样离开他﹐这对他很不公平。

Sense.DEF: to feel ill
to look untidy, dirty, or unhealthy
Sense.TRAN: 看上去邋遢[肮脏﹐不健康]
Sense.EXAMPLE: After travelling for two days we must have looked pretty rough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在路上走了两天﹐我们肯定是蓬头垢面的。

Sense.DEF: not perfect, but good enough for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tests are only a rough and ready guide to a pupil’s future development.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些测试只能大致看出一个学生未来的发展。

Sense.DEF: punishment that is not decided in a court in the usual legal way, and that is often severe or unfair
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gangs practise a kind of rough justice on their members.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑帮对其成员用私刑。

Exponent.DEF: having a surface that is not flat or smooth
Exponent.EXAMPLE: rough ground
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 崎岖的地面
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a rough mountain path
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 崎岖的山路
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The walls were all rough.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙面都毛糙不平。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her hands were rough and work-hardened.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的双手粗糙﹐且因干活而变得硬邦邦的。

Exponent.DEF: an uneven surface has areas that are not flat or not all at the same level
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The floor was uneven.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 地板不平。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She climbed the uneven steps with great care.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她小心翼翼爬上凹凸不平的台阶。

Exponent.DEF: a bumpy road, path, or area of land has a lot of holes and raised parts in it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the bumpy track down to the farm
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 通向农场的崎岖小道
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The field was too bumpy to play football on.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这块场地不平﹐无法踢足球。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a bumpy journey (=on a road that has a very rough surface)
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 颠簸的旅程

Exponent.DEF: having a rough surface that feels slightly hard – used especially about materials such as cloth or wool
Exponent.EXAMPLE: coarse woollen blankets
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 粗毛毯
Exponent.EXAMPLE: coarse grass
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 粗草

Exponent.DEF: land that is rugged is very rough and uneven and is often in a high place
Exponent.TRAN: 〔地面〕不平的﹐崎岖的〔常指高地〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the rugged terrain near the mountains
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 山区附近的崎岖地形

Sense.DEF: uneven ground with long grass on an area where people play golf

Sense.LEXUNIT: take the rough with the smooth
Sense.DEF: to accept the bad things in life as well as the good ones
Sense.TRAN: 既能享乐也能吃苦﹔好坏都能接受
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to learn to take the rough with the smooth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要学会无论身在顺境还是逆境都能泰然处之。

Sense.DEF: a picture drawn very quickly, not showing all the details
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rough of the proposed housing development
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拟建住宅区的草图

Sense.DEF: if you write or draw something in rough, you do it without paying attention to details or tidiness, because you are going to do it again later
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s best to work in rough first, and then write it out neatly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好先打一个草稿﹐然后再工整地誊写出来。

Sense.DEF: someone from a lower social class than you, with whom you have a sexual relationship
Sense.TRAN: 〔社会地位比自己低的〕性伴侣

Sense.DEF: to live for a short time in conditions that are not very comfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t mind roughing it for a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偶尔艰苦一下﹐我无所谓。

Sense.DEF: to draw or write something without including all the details
Sense.EXAMPLE: a diagram the engineer had roughed out on his notepad
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工程师在记事本上画的一幅草图

Sense.DEF: to attack someone and hurt them by hitting them
to sleep outside with nothing to protect you from the weather, especially because you have no home to live in
Sense.EXAMPLE: the number of people sleeping rough on the street
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露宿街头的人数

Sense.DEF: to play in a fairly violent way

a substance contained in some vegetables, fruits, and grains that helps your
bowel s
to work
a situation in which people compete with each other, often in a cruel way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the rough and tumble of public life
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共生活的激烈竞争

Sense.DEF: noisy rough behaviour when playing or fighting, especially by children
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指孩子的〕喧闹﹐打闹﹐粗野的举止

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数男孩都喜欢打打闹闹。

Sense.DEF:
a rough surface on the outside of a building, made of
plaster
mixed with little stones or broken shells
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物外墙的〕粗灰泥墙面﹐拉毛墙面

Sense.DEF: someone who seems rude, rough, or unfriendly, but is actually nice and generous
to become rough, or to make something rough
Sense.EXAMPLE: hands roughened by work
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为干活而变粗糙的双手

Sense.DEF: rough-hewn wood or stone has been cut without much care and its surface is not yet smooth
Sense.TRAN: 〔木材〕粗砍成的﹔〔石头〕粗凿成的

Sense.DEF: to play roughly or pretend to fight
Sense.EXAMPLE: Okay, guys, slow down. No more roughhousing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐伙计们﹐歇会儿吧﹐不要闹了。

Sense.DEF: not exactly
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were roughly 200 people there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那儿大约有200人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Azaleas flower at roughly the same time each year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杜鹃花每年的开花时间大致相同。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: two rocks of roughly equal size
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大小基本相同的两块岩石

GramExa.GLOSS: used when saying something without giving exact details or information
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Roughly speaking, I’d say we need about $500.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 粗略地说﹐我认为我们大约需要500美元。

Sense.DEF: not gently or carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: He grabbed her roughly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他粗暴地抓住她。

Sense.DEF:
someone who works on an
oil well
a man who usually behaves in a rough, rude, or angry way
Sense.TRAN: 粗暴的人﹐脾气暴躁的人

Sense.DEF: paper that is used for writing or drawing things that will later be changed or copied more neatly
to behave in a way that ignores other people’s feelings or opinions
Sense.TRAN: 对某人/某事不予理睬﹐轻蔑地对待某人/某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: We cannot ride roughshod over the concerns of the local community.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不能对当地社区的忧虑不闻不问。

Sense.DEF: a game in which a small ball is spun around on a moving wheel, and people try to win money by guessing which hole the ball will fall into
surrounding or on all sides of something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sat round the table playing cards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们围桌而坐玩纸牌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gather round! I have an important announcement to make.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家围拢来！我有重要事情要宣布。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He put his arm gently round her waist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他轻轻地搂着她的腰。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I kept the key on a chain round my neck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给钥匙穿了根链子挂在脖子上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ballroom’s huge, with windows all the way round .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舞厅很大﹐四周都是窗户。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a lovely courtyard with tables all round .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一个漂亮的庭院﹐四周都是桌子。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something turns so that they face in the opposite direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: When he turned round I recognised him immediately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他转过身来﹐我立即认出了他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Graham glanced round, startled by the voice behind him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷厄姆听到背后的声音一惊﹐回头扫了一眼。

Sense.DEF: in or to many places or parts of an area
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reggie went round making sure all the lights were off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷吉走了一圈﹐确保所有灯都关了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leah showed me round on my first day at the office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上班第一天﹐利娅带我在办公室走了一圈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A guide took us round the palace and gardens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名导游带我们参观了宫殿和花园。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spent a whole year travelling round Europe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他花了整整一年周游欧洲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked round the room as though leaving it for the last time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她环顾房间﹐那样子就像要永远离开这里了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: changes that are affecting the weather all round the world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影响全球气候的一些变化

Sense.DEF: moving in a circle
Sense.EXAMPLE: She watched the clock hands go round.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看着钟的指针转动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: An aeroplane was circling round far overhead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一架飞机在高空盘旋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Until the 16th century people believed that the sun went round the earth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直至16世纪人们一直认为太阳围绕地球转。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stared at the washing machine, just watching the clothes go round and round .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他盯着洗衣机﹐看着衣服一圈圈地转。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shoal of tiny fish swimming round in circles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群转圈游动的小鱼

Sense.DEF: if you go round to someone’s house, you go to their house, usually to visit them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I might go round to Nigel’s this evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今天晚上可能去奈杰尔家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s invited us round for dinner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他邀请我们去他家吃晚饭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll be round will arrive at seven.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将在7点到。

Sense.DEF: to other people or positions
Sense.TRAN: 分给〔其他人〕﹔移至〔其他地方〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A big box of chocolates was handed round.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大盒巧克力分给了大家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’d moved his furniture round.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把家具换了位置。

Sense.DEF: on the other side of something, or to the other side of it without going through it or over it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ran round to open Kate’s door for her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他跑过去给凯特开门。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There must be another entrance round the back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后面一定还有个入口。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I watched the two boys disappear round the corner .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看着这两个男孩拐过弯不见了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She came round to his side of the desk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她绕到桌子那头他坐的一边。

Sense.DEF: in the area near a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Much of the countryside round Hinkley Point is given over to agriculture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辛克利角附近的乡间有许多地区都被用于农业开垦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you live round here ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你住在附近吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: He owned all the land round about in the surrounding area .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一带的土地都是他的。

Sense.DEF: used when guessing a number, amount, time etc without being exact
Sense.EXAMPLE: We got there round about half past nine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们大约9点半到了那儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s round about the same age as my son.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他大概和我儿子差不多年龄。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It must have been round midnight when I saw him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到他的时候肯定已经是半夜前后了。

Sense.DEF: used to show that someone spends time in a place without doing anything useful
Sense.EXAMPLE: People were just standing round and not doing anything to help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旁边的人只是站着﹐也不做点什么帮一下。

Sense.DEF: if something is organized round a particular person or thing, it is organized according to their needs, wishes, ideas etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Working from home, she could arrange her hours round her children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在家工作﹐她就可以按照孩子的需要安排时间了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had built his whole existence round her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的全部生活都以她为中心。

Sense.DEF: a way round a difficult situation or problem is a way to solve it or avoid it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s going to have to buy a car. I can’t see any other way round it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只能去买一辆车了﹐我看没有其他办法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: strategies to get round solve the problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 解决这个问题的策略

Sense.DEF: used to show the length of a line surrounding something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The park was about five miles round.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公园的外围大概有五英里。

Sense.DEF: shaped like a circle
Sense.EXAMPLE: a big round table
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张大圆桌
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jamie’s eyes grew round with delight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰米高兴得瞪圆了眼睛。

Sense.DEF: shaped like a ball
Sense.EXAMPLE: small round berries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小圆浆果

Sense.DEF: fat and curved
Sense.EXAMPLE: round chubby cheeks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圆嘟嘟的脸颊

Sense.DEF: a round number or figure is a whole number, often ending in 0
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s make it a round figure: say £50?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们就凑个整数吧﹐50英镑怎么样？

GramExa.GLOSS: expressed as the nearest 10, 100, 1,000 etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Altogether, in round figures, there are about three thousand students here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 算整数﹐这儿总共有大约3,000名学生。

GramExa.GLOSS: a complete hundred etc

Crossrefto.REFLEX: a square peg in a round hole

Sense.DEF: a round of events is a series of related events, which are part of a longer process

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a third round of peace talks
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 第三轮和平谈判
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Government’s latest round of expenditure cuts
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府最近一次削减支出

Sense.DEF: one of the parts of a competition that you have to finish or win before you can go on to the next part

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I got beaten in the first round.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在第一轮就被打败了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two of their candidates made it through to the next round.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的候选人中有两名进入了下一轮。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the final round of the championship
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 锦标赛的最后一轮

Sense.DEF: a round of activities is a regular series of activities, especially activities that are not very exciting
Sense.TRAN: 一系列常规活动﹔惯常的活动
Sense.EXAMPLE: an endless round of meetings and interviews
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没完没了的会议和采访
Sense.EXAMPLE: He continued with his usual round of private and business engagements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他生活依旧﹐除了私事就是公事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the daily round of commuting and shopping
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上下班和购物的日常例行事务

Sense.DEF: the usual visits that someone, especially a doctor, regularly makes as part of their job
Sense.TRAN: 巡访﹔〔尤指医生的〕定期巡诊

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry. The doctor is out on her rounds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐医生出去巡诊了。

Sense.DEF:
when people
clap
for a short time to show that they enjoyed something or approve of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She got a big round of applause .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她博得一阵热烈的掌声。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The passengers gave the pilot a round of applause .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘客给飞行员一阵掌声。

Sense.DEF: a complete game of golf
Sense.TRAN: 一场〔指打完球场里所有的洞〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I played a round of golf on Sunday morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期天早上我打了一场高尔夫球。

Sense.DEF:
one of the periods of fighting in a
boxing
or
wrestling
match
Sense.TRAN: 〔拳击或摔跤比赛的〕一个回合

Sense.DEF: if you buy a round of drinks in a bar, you buy drinks for all the people in your group
Sense.TRAN: 〔在酒吧为同伴买的〕一巡〔饮料〕

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say whose turn it is to buy drinks for all the people in your group
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 这一巡轮到我/你等请客
GramExa.EXAMPLE: What are you having? It’s my round.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们喝什么？这一巡我请客。

Sense.DEF: if a story, idea, or illness does the rounds, it is passed on from one person to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: a joke doing the rounds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个正在流传的笑话

Sense.DEF: to go around from one place to another, especially looking for work or advertising something
Sense.TRAN: 去各处做某事〔尤指找工作或作宣传〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ryan is making the rounds of talk shows to promote her new movie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瑞安正到处出席访谈节目﹐宣传她的新片。

Sense.DEF: a single shot from a gun, or a bullet for one shot
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve only got ten rounds of ammunition left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就剩十发子弹了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Richards fired a few rounds .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理查兹开了几枪。

Sense.DEF: something that has a circular shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: Slice the potatoes into rounds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把马铃薯切成圆形薄片。

Sense.DEF: a regular visit to a number of houses, offices etc to deliver or sell things

GramExa.GLOSS: a job in which you deliver newspapers, milk etc to people’s houses
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I used to do a paper round .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前干过上门送报纸的活。

Sense.DEF: a song for three or four singers, in which each one sings the same tune, starting at a different time

sandwich es
made from two whole pieces of bread
Sense.TRAN: 〔用两整片面包做成的〕三明治

Sense.DEF:
one whole piece of bread that has been
toast ed
a play that is performed in the round is performed on a central stage surrounded by the people watching it
Sense.TRAN: 舞台设在中央的〔观众围绕在舞台四周〕

Sense.DEF: to go round something such as a bend or the corner of a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: As they rounded the bend and came in sight of the river, Philip took her hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们转过弯﹐看到河的时候﹐菲利普牵起了她的手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tide was coming in as he rounded the rocks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他绕过岩石的时候正在涨潮。

Sense.DEF: to make something into a round shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stones were then rounded, polished and engraved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接着石头被打圆﹑磨光﹑刻上图案。

Sense.DEF: if your eyes round, you open them wide because you are shocked, frightened etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Barbara’s eyes rounded in surprise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芭芭拉惊讶得眼睛都睁圆了。

Sense.DEF: to reduce an exact figure to the nearest whole number
Sense.TRAN: 把〔数〕向下舍入﹐把…去掉零头取整数
Sense.EXAMPLE: For the 1841 census it was decided to round down ages over fifteen to the nearest five.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1841年的人口普查决定把15岁以上的年龄下舍取五的倍数。

Sense.DEF: to do something as a way of ending an event, performance etc in a suitable or satisfactory way
Sense.TRAN: 使〔活动﹑表演等〕圆满完成

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can round off the evening with a visit to the nightclub.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后可以光顾一下这家夜总会﹐开心地结束一个晚上的活动。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She rounded off the meal with some cheese.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她最后来了些干酪﹐满意地结束了这顿饭。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the perfect way to round off the season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个赛季这样结束再圆满不过了。

Sense.DEF: to take the sharp or rough edges off something
Sense.TRAN: 去掉〔某物〕的锋利边缘﹐把〔某物〕修圆磨光
Sense.EXAMPLE: Round off the corners with a pair of scissors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用剪刀把角剪圆。

Sense.DEF: to change an exact figure to the nearest whole number

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Prices are rounded off to the nearest dollar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 标价用美元﹐都四舍五入成整数。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly turn and attack someone when they do not expect it, either with words or physically
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the door closed, Crabb rounded on Edwards. ‘You stupid idiot!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门一关上﹐克拉布就大骂爱德华兹道:“你这个愚蠢的白痴！”

Sense.DEF: to make an experience more thorough or complete
Sense.EXAMPLE: African percussion and Native American flute round out the show.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非洲打击乐器和印第安人的笛子使得演出更加精彩。

Sense.DEF: if police or soldiers round up a particular group of people, they find them and force them to go to prison
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thousands of men were rounded up and jailed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成千上万的人被捕入狱。

Sense.DEF: to find and gather together a group of people, animals, or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: See if you can round up a few friends to help you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想办法找几个朋友帮帮你呀！
Sense.EXAMPLE: His dog Nell started to round up the sheep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的狗内尔开始把羊群赶到一起。

Sense.DEF: to increase an exact figure to the next highest whole number
a raised circular area where three or more roads join together and which cars must drive around
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn left at the first roundabout.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在第一个环岛向左转。

Sense.DEF: a round structure for children to play on in a park. Children sit on it while someone pushes it around and around.

a
merry-go-round
a roundabout way of saying something is not clear, direct, or simple
Sense.TRAN: 〔说话〕绕弯子的﹐不直截了当的﹐拐弯抹角的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was a roundabout way of telling us to leave.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是转弯抹角地要我们走。

Sense.DEF: a roundabout way of getting somewhere is longer and more complicated than necessary
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bus took a very long and roundabout route .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车路线很长﹐绕着圈子走。

Sense.DEF: having a round shape
