having a wide range of qualities that make someone or something pleasant, balanced, and complete
Sense.TRAN: 全面的﹔一应俱全的﹔完善的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Psychology tests found me to be thoroughly rounded in skills and attitudes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 心理测试表明我能力全面﹐心态正常。

Sense.DEF: a circular design, for example one used to make a military aircraft recognizable
Sense.TRAN: 〔军用飞机等的〕圆形识别标志

Sense.DEF: a British ball game, similar to baseball, in which players hit the ball and then run around the edge of an area
having eyes which are wide open because of shock, fear etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔因为吃惊﹑害怕等〕两眼圆睁的

Sense.DEF:
to
condemn
, criticize etc someone strongly and severely
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the major political parties roundly condemned the attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各大政党都强烈谴责这次袭击。

Sense.DEF: a competition in which every player or team plays against every other player or team
Sense.EXAMPLE: a round robin tournament
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 循环锦标赛

Sense.DEF: someone who is round-shouldered has shoulders that are bent forwards or slope downwards
Sense.TRAN: 圆肩的﹔拱背曲肩的﹔溜肩膀的

Sense.DEF: a round-table discussion is one in which everyone can talk about things in an equal way
Sense.TRAN: 〔讨论〕圆桌的〔指每个人平等参与〕

Sense.DEF:
the table at which King Arthur and his
knight s
sat, according to old stories. As it was round, all the places at it were equal. The expression ‘round table’ is used to describe a peaceful way of reaching an agreement.
Sense.TRAN: 圆桌〔传说中亚瑟王与骑士所坐的圆桌﹐席位不分主次﹐喻指以和平方式达成协议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The treaty was signed following a round table discussion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 协议经圆桌讨论后签署。

Sense.DEF:
a
charity
organization for men under 40, who hold meetings and do work for their local areas. It is related to the Rotary Club, whose members are usually a little older.
Sense.TRAN: 青年圆桌协会〔40岁以下男士参加的慈善组织﹐会员举行会议并为本地做慈善工作。 该协会与扶轮社有关联﹐后者的社员通常年龄稍长〕

Sense.DEF: happening all the time, both day and night
Sense.EXAMPLE: round-the-clock medical care
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 24小时医护

Sense.DEF: a journey to a place and back again
Sense.EXAMPLE: a round-trip ticket from Los Angeles to New York
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从洛杉矶到纽约的往返票

GramExa.PROPFORM: 30 mile/360 kilometre/2 hour etc round trip
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A coachload of supporters made the 700-mile round trip to South Devon.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 满满一车的支持者前往南德文郡﹐往返路程700英里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a round trip of 90 miles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 来回有90英里的路程。

Sense.DEF: a round-trip ticket includes the journey to a place and back again
a short description of the main parts of the news, on the radio or on television

GramExa.EXAMPLE: First, with a round-up of the day’s local news, here’s Paul Kirby.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先是今天的本地新闻提要﹐我是保罗·柯比。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: our Friday sports round-up
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的周五体育新闻提要

Sense.DEF: when people or animals of a particular type are all brought together, often using force
Sense.TRAN: 集拢﹐聚拢〔常指强行将某类人或动物集合到一起的情况〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a round-up of suspected drug-dealers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 围捕涉嫌贩毒的人

Sense.EXAMPLE: the annual cattle round-up
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年一次的赶牛

Sense.DEF:
a small round
parasite
that lives in the bodies of animals and sometimes humans
to wake someone who is sleeping deeply
Sense.EXAMPLE: His banging roused the neighbours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他重重的关门声把邻居都吵醒了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A persistent ringing roused Christina from a pleasant dream.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话铃响个不停﹐把克里斯蒂娜从美梦中吵醒。

Sense.DEF: to make someone start doing something, especially when they have been too tired or unwilling to do it
Sense.TRAN: 激励﹐使振奋〔尤当对方很疲倦或不愿意做某事时〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She roused herself stiffly from her chair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她僵直地从椅子上站起来。

GramExa.PROPFORM: rouse sb to sth/to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a campaign designed to rouse the younger generation to action
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 旨在激励年轻一代行动起来的活动

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel a particular emotion, such as anger or fear
Sense.EXAMPLE: We don’t want to rouse any suspicions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不想引起任何怀疑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Paul strode forward, roused to anger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗被激怒了﹐大步走上前去。

Sense.DEF: angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: When roused, he could be violent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一旦发怒﹐就会很粗暴。

Sense.DEF: a rousing song, speech etc makes people feel excited and eager to do something
Sense.TRAN: 〔歌曲﹑演讲等〕激动人心的﹐振奋人心的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rousing chorus of ‘Happy Birthday’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人感动的生日快乐歌合唱

Sense.DEF: to make someone move from a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: We rousted him out of bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把他从床上拖了起来。

Sense.DEF:
a man who does work for which he needs to be strong but not skilled, especially in a port, an
oilfield
, or a
circus
Sense.TRAN: 非熟练工﹐普通工﹔场地工〔尤指在港口﹑油田或马戏团干重活的人〕

Sense.DEF: to defeat someone completely in a battle, competition, or election
Sense.TRAN: 〔在战斗﹑竞赛或选举中〕击溃﹐彻底击败

Sense.DEF: a complete defeat in a battle, competition, or election
Sense.TRAN: 〔战斗﹑竞赛或选举中的〕溃败﹐彻底失败
Sense.EXAMPLE: The battle turned into a rout.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战斗彻底失败。

Sense.DEF: a way from one place to another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s the best route to Cambridge?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到剑桥的最佳路线怎么走？

GramExa.GLOSS: use a route
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We weren’t sure about which route we should take.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们拿不准应该走哪条路线。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the most direct route home
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最直接的回家路线

Sense.DEF: a way between two places that buses, planes, ships etc regularly travel

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is your office on a bus route?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的办公室在公共汽车线上吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: a way between two places that only people on bicycles can use

Sense.DEF: a way of doing something or achieving a particular result

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the surest route to disaster
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 必定会酿成大祸的做法

Sense.EXAMPLE: Kennedy arrived at the same conclusion by a different route.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯尼迪用不同的方法得出了同样的结论。

Sense.DEF: used to show the number of a main road in the US
Sense.TRAN: 66号/54号等公路〔在美国用于表示干道的编号〕

Sense.DEF: to send something somewhere using a particular route

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They had to route the goods through Germany.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们必须经由德国运送这些货物。

Sense.DEF: a famous road in the US that is mentioned in books, films, and songs. It was built in the early 1930s, and was the first road to go across the US, from Chicago to Los Angeles.
Sense.TRAN: 66号公路〔美国的一条著名公路﹐常在书﹑影片和歌曲中被提及﹐是首条横贯全美的公路〕

Sense.DEF: a long march done by soldiers when they are training
a piece of electronic equipment that makes sending messages between different computers or between different networks easier and faster
the usual order in which you do things, or the things you regularly do
Sense.EXAMPLE: John’s departure had upset their daily routine .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰的离去打乱了他们的日常生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to get into a routine develop a fixed order of doing things .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量养成一套习惯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: my daily exercise routine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每天的锻炼习惯
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dressing is a task which we do every day as a matter of routine done regularly and not unusual .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿衣打扮是我们每天必做的事情。

Sense.DEF: a set of movements, jokes etc that form part of a performance
Sense.TRAN: 〔演出中的〕一套动作﹐一组笑话
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dance routine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套舞步

Sense.DEF: a set of instructions given to a computer so that it will do a particular operation
happening as a normal part of a job or process
Sense.EXAMPLE: You mustn’t worry. These are just routine enquiries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不必担心﹐这只是例行的询问。
Sense.EXAMPLE: routine maintenance work
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 例行的维修工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: a routine operation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 常规操作

Sense.DEF: ordinary and boring

GramExa.EXAMPLE: routine tasks such as washing up
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗碗之类的单调工作

Sense.DEF: if something is routinely done, it is done as a normal part of a process or job
Sense.EXAMPLE: This vaccine is already routinely used.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疫苗的使用已经常规化。

Sense.DEF: a mixture of flour, butter, and milk that is used for making sauces
Sense.TRAN: 〔做调味汁用的〕黄油牛奶面粉糊

Sense.DEF: to travel from one place to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: a salesman roving the country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全国各地跑的推销员

Sense.DEF: someone who works for a newspaper or television company and moves from place to place
if someone’s eyes rove, they look continuously from one part of something to another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Benedict’s eyes roved boldly over her sleeping body.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝内迪克特的眼睛放肆地扫视着她熟睡中的身体。

Sense.DEF: to always be looking for a chance to have romantic relationships – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 时刻寻找艳遇﹐好色〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a line of things or people next to each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a row of houses
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一排房子
GramExa.EXAMPLE: rows of trees
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一行行树木

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children were asked to stand in a row.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们被要求站成一列。

Sense.EXAMPLE: row upon rowmany rows of shelves stacked with books
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一排又一排堆满书的架子

Sense.DEF: a line of seats in a theatre or cinema
Sense.TRAN: 〔剧院或电影院里的〕一排座位
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sat in the front row.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们坐在前排。

Sense.DEF: happening a number of times, one after the other

GramExa.PROPFORM: 4 nights/3 weeks etc in a row
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s been out four nights in a row.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她连续四个晚上都外出。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve beaten her three times in a row .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经连续赢了她三次。

Sense.DEF: used in the name of some roads
Sense.EXAMPLE: 22 Church Row
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教堂街22号

Sense.DEF: used to say that a particular situation is difficult
a short angry argument, especially between people who know each other well

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had just had a row with his wife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他刚刚和妻子吵了一架。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What was the row about?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吵什么呀？

Sense.EXAMPLE: a family row
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭争吵
Sense.EXAMPLE: a blazing row a very angry argument
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愤怒的争吵

Sense.DEF: a situation in which people disagree strongly about important public matters
Sense.TRAN: 〔对重要公众事件的〕争议﹐争论

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new row over government secrecy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于政府机密的一个新争议

Sense.DEF: a loud unpleasant noise that continues for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔持续时间长的〕喧闹声﹐吵嚷声
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop that row - I’m trying to get to sleep!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别吵啦﹐我要睡觉了！

Sense.DEF:
to make a boat move across water using
oar s

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She rowed across the lake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她划船到湖对岸。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Jenny used to row at college as a sport .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮以前在大学里经常参加划船运动。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Why don’t we go for a row ?
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们为什么不去划船呢？

Sense.DEF: to argue in an angry way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They rowed about money all the time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们总是为了钱吵架。

Sense.DEF: a small tree with red berries

a small boat that you move through the water with
oar s
behaving in a noisy rough way that is likely to cause arguments and fighting
Sense.EXAMPLE: gangs of rowdy youths
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几伙吵闹的年轻人

Sense.DEF: someone who behaves in a rough noisy way
a house that is part of a line of houses that are joined to each other
Sense.TRAN: 排屋〔一排相连房屋中的一幢〕

Sense.DEF:
the sport or activity of making a boat move through water with
oar s

a small boat that you move through the water with
oar s long poles that are flat at the end
a piece of exercise equipment on which you perform the action of rowing a boat

one of the U-shaped pieces of metal that holds the
oar s
of a rowing boat
relating to or belonging to a king or queen
Sense.TRAN: 国王的﹔女王的﹔王室的﹔皇家的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the royal palace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 王宫
Sense.EXAMPLE: the royal family
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 王室

Sense.DEF: used in the names of organizations that serve or are supported by a king or queen
Sense.TRAN: 皇家的〔用于为国王﹑女王服务或受其支持的组织的名称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Royal Navy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皇家海军
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Royal College of Music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皇家音乐学院

Sense.DEF: very impressive, as if done for a king or queen
Sense.EXAMPLE: a royal welcome
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 隆重的欢迎

Sense.DEF: the use of the word ‘we’ instead of ‘I’ by the Queen or King
Sense.TRAN: 朕﹐寡人〔女王或国王的自称﹐以代替I〕

Sense.DEF: a member of a royal family

a four-day horse-racing event at Ascot, England, that takes place every June. It is known as a social event, especially for
upper-class
people, where women wear expensive fashionable clothes and hats.
Sense.TRAN: 皇家阿斯科特赛马会〔每年在英格兰阿斯科特举行﹐尤属上层人士的社交活动〕

Sense.DEF: a bright deep blue colour
a group of people chosen by the British government to make suggestions about a subject that the government thinks may need new laws
Sense.TRAN: 皇家委员会〔英国政府任命的一个委员会﹐就政府认为需要立法的事项提出建议〕

Sense.DEF:
a set of cards that someone has in a card game, which are the five most important cards in a
suit one of the four different types of card
used when speaking about or to a royal person, especially a prince or princess
Sense.TRAN: 殿下〔对王室成员尤其是王子或公主的称呼〕

Sense.DEF: someone who supports their country’s king or queen, or believes that a country should be ruled by kings or queens
Sense.TRAN: 保皇主义者﹔君主主义者

Sense.DEF:
the British
post office
as a whole
members of a royal family
Sense.EXAMPLE: At school the other children treated them like royalty .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在学校里﹐其他孩子将他们奉若王族。

Sense.DEF: a payment made to the writer of a book or piece of music depending on how many books etc are sold, or to someone whose idea, invention etc is used by someone else to make money
Sense.TRAN: 〔付给书或乐曲作者的〕版税﹔〔发明等的〕使用费
Sense.EXAMPLE: the royalties from his latest book
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他新书的版税
Sense.EXAMPLE: royalty payments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 版税款

Sense.DEF: the form of British pronunciation that many educated people in Britain use, and that is thought of as the standard form

used to describe the speed at which something turns, especially an engine or a
record player
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指发动机或唱机的〕每分钟转数﹐转/分

Sense.DEF: used in addresses in country areas of the US, to show which postal delivery area a letter should go to
Sense.TRAN: 乡村投递路线〔用于美国乡村地区的通信地址中〕

Sense.DEF:
pains in your hands, arms etc caused by doing the same movements many times, especially by using a computer
keyboard
or
mouse
Sense.TRAN: 重复劳损性损伤〔手或手臂等因重复做相同的动作而引致的疼痛﹐尤指使用计算机键盘或鼠标所致的损伤〕

Sense.DEF: software that tells an Internet user when a website has new information on it
Sense.TRAN: 丰富站点摘要〔通知因特网用户某一网站有更新信息的一种软件〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our free RSS feeds include headlines and news summaries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们免费的RSS发布包含标题和新闻摘要。

Sense.DEF: used on invitations to ask someone to reply
a system used to arrange and show the information in computer documents
Sense.TRAN: RTF格式﹐富文本格式﹐多文本格式〔计算机文件的一种格式〕
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=Right Honourable 阁下〔对英国议会议员的尊称〕

Sense.DEF: to move your hand, or something such as a cloth, backwards and forwards over a surface while pressing firmly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She yawned and rubbed her eyes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她打了个呵欠﹐揉了揉眼睛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She began rubbing her hair with a towel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始用毛巾擦头发。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to rub harder if you want to get it clean.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想把它弄干净﹐就得更使劲地擦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hurriedly rubbed myself dry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我赶紧把自己擦干。

Sense.DEF: to make something press against something else and move it around

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She stood by the oven, rubbing one bare foot against the other.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她站在烤箱旁边﹐两只光脚丫互相蹭着。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cat purred loudly, rubbing against her legs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只猫咕噜咕噜地大声叫着﹐在她的腿上蹭来蹭去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We tried to make a fire by rubbing two pieces of wood together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把两块木头相互摩擦﹐试图生出火来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He rubbed his hands together with embarrassment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他尴尬地搓着手。

Sense.DEF: if shoes, clothes, or parts of a machine rub, they move around while pressing against another surface, often causing pain or damage
Sense.EXAMPLE: Badly fitting shoes are bound to rub.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不合适的鞋子肯定磨脚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The front left fender was smashed and rubbing against the wheel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 左前轮挡泥板被撞碎﹐蹭到了轮子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The skin under my sock was rubbed raw the skin had come off .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我袜子下面的皮肤被磨破了。

Sense.DEF: to put a substance into or onto a surface by pressing it and moving it about with your fingers or something such as a cloth
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you rub some sun cream on my back for me?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我的背上抹些防晒霜好吗？

Sense.DEF: to meet and spend time with people, especially rich and famous people
Sense.TRAN: 与某人交往〔尤指富人和名人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a reporter he gets to rub shoulders with all the big names in politics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身为记者﹐他有机会与所有政界大人物打交道。

Sense.DEF: to make a bad situation even worse for someone
Sense.TRAN: 在伤口上抹盐﹐加深〔某人的〕痛苦

Sense.LEXUNIT: rub sb up the wrong way
Sense.DEF: to annoy someone by the things you say or do, usually without intending to
Sense.TRAN: 〔一般指无意地〕惹恼某人﹐触怒某人

Sense.DEF: to be pleased because something has happened which gives you an advantage, especially because something bad has happened to someone else
Sense.TRAN: 〔因某事发生给自己带来好处而〕高兴地搓着手〔尤指幸灾乐祸〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: rub sb’s nose in it/in the dirt
Sense.DEF: to keep reminding someone about something they did wrong or failed to do, especially in order to punish them
Sense.TRAN: 不断提起某人的过失﹐揭某人的伤疤〔尤指为了惩罚某人〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: not have two pennies/halfpennies/beans to rub together
Sense.DEF: to not have any money
to have a friendly relationship with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: We rub along well most of the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们大部分时间都相处得很好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: By and large the Poles and Germans of the city had shown that they could rub along together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总的来说﹐城里的波兰人和德国人能友好相处。

Sense.DEF:
to make a surface smooth by rubbing it with
sandpaper
Sense.EXAMPLE: That door needs rubbing down before you paint it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那扇门需要打磨一下再上油漆。

Sense.DEF:
to dry a person or animal by rubbing them with a cloth,
towel
etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The groom rubbed down the horses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马夫把马擦干。

Sense.DEF:
to
massage
someone, especially after exercise
to remind someone about something they want to forget, especially because they are embarrassed about it
Sense.TRAN: 提及〔某人感到尴尬之事〕﹔触及〔某人痛处〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Was he trying to rub in the fact that he didn’t think much of me?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是不是在提醒我﹐他认为我不怎么样？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know I should have been more careful, but there’s no need to keep rubbing it in .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道我本应更小心点的﹐但是你也没有必要老提呀。

Sense.DEF: to remove something from a surface by rubbing it, or to come off a surface because of being rubbed
Sense.TRAN: 擦掉﹐磨去﹔〔因摩擦而〕脱落﹐磨掉

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jack rubbed the mud off his face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克擦去脸上的污泥。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She rubbed off her lipstick and eye shadow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她擦掉自己的口红和眼影。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the gold paint had begun to rub off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些金漆已经磨掉了。

Sense.DEF: if a feeling, quality, or habit rubs off on you, you start to have it because you are with another person who has it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She refused to give up, and her confidence rubbed off on the others.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不肯放弃﹐她的自信心也感染了其他人。

Sense.DEF: to remove writing, a picture etc from a surface by rubbing it with a piece of rubber, a cloth etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用橡皮﹑布等〕把〔字迹﹑图等〕擦掉
Sense.EXAMPLE: Draw the outline lightly with a soft pencil. This can be rubbed out later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用一支软铅笔淡淡地画出轮廓﹐回头可以擦掉。

Sense.DEF: to murder someone

to rub something or
massage
someone for a short time
Sense.TRAN: 把某物擦一擦﹔给某人揉一揉
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give the table a good rub with a damp cloth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用湿布好好擦一擦桌子。

Sense.DEF: used when saying that a particular problem is the reason why a situation is so difficult – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 困难在于那里/这里〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a substance used to make tyres, boots etc, which is made from the juice of a tropical tree or artificially
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rubber ball
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 橡皮球

Subsense.DEF: a small piece of rubber or similar material used for removing pencil marks from paper

an object used for cleaning marks from a
blackboard

Sense.DEF:
a
condom
rubber shoes or boots that you wear over ordinary shoes when it rains or snows
Sense.TRAN: 橡胶套鞋〔雨天或雪天时套在平常穿的鞋子外面〕

Sense.DEF:
a series of games of
bridge
or
cricket

the piece of white rubber where the
pitcher person who throws the ball
stands in a baseball game
Sense.TRAN: 〔棒球比赛中投手站的〕投手板

Sense.DEF: a thin circular piece of rubber used for fastening things together
a tall boot made of rubber that keeps your feet and the lower part of your legs dry
Sense.TRAN: 防水橡胶靴﹐长筒橡胶雨靴

Sense.DEF: a bullet made of rubber that is not intended to seriously hurt or kill people, but is used to control violent crowds
public dinners where someone makes a speech, especially ones held in order to raise money for a political party
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is in demand on the rubber chicken circuit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人要她参加募款餐会。

Sense.DEF: a small rubber boat that is filled with air
to look around at something, especially something such as an accident while you are driving past – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 扭头看〔尤指在开车经过事故发生地点时﹔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: People rubbernecking in the southbound lane caused a second accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 南向行车道上的司机扭头看﹐造成了第二起事故。

Sense.DEF: a plant with large shiny dark green leaves that is often grown indoors
Sense.TRAN: 橡胶植物〔一种常于室内种植的植物﹐叶子大﹑深绿而有光泽〕

Sense.DEF: a small piece of rubber with a handle, used for printing dates or names on paper
to give official approval to something without really thinking about it – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 不加思考便机械式地批准〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The committee has already rubber-stamped the scheme.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会已经例行公事式地通过了这项计划。

Sense.DEF: looking or feeling like rubber
Sense.EXAMPLE: rubbery eggs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煮得很老的鸡蛋
Sense.EXAMPLE: rubbery lips
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富有弹性的嘴唇

Sense.DEF: if your legs or knees are rubbery, they feel weak or unsteady

a copy of a shape or pattern made by rubbing
wax
,
chalk
etc onto a piece of paper laid over it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a brass rubbing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黄铜纪念牌拓片[拓印图]

Sense.DEF: a type of alcohol used for cleaning wounds or skin
food, paper etc that is no longer needed and has been thrown away
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rubbish bin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 垃圾桶

GramExa.GLOSS: a place to take rubbish

Sense.DEF: objects, papers etc that you no longer use and should throw away
Sense.TRAN: 垃圾〔指不再使用应该扔掉的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got so much rubbish on my desk it’s unbelievable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我桌上有那么多垃圾﹐真是让人难以相信。

Sense.DEF: an idea, statement etc that is rubbish is silly or wrong and does not deserve serious attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: You do talk rubbish sometimes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有时候确实胡说八道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s a load of rubbish .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那都是废话连篇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The suggestion is absolute rubbish .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个建议绝对是一派胡言。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to tell someone that what they have just said is completely wrong

Sense.DEF: a film, book etc that is rubbish is very bad
Sense.TRAN: 水准低劣的电影[书籍等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: the usual Hollywood rubbish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好莱坞惯常的烂片

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the nouns rubbish, garbage, and trash in British and American English. 名词rubbish,garbage和trash在英国英语和美国英语中的使用频率。
Tail.PICCONTENT: 【英】【美】每百万；【英】【美】每百万；【英】【美】每百万
Tail.TailContent: In British English rubbish is commonly used to mean something that is thrown away, or something that is silly, wrong, or of bad quality. In American English garbage and trash are commonly used for these meanings. In British English trash is only used to mean something of bad quality, and garbage is only used to mean words, ideas etc that are stupid. 在英国英语中﹐rubbish经常用来指被扔掉的垃圾﹐或者指愚蠢﹑错误或质量低劣的东西。 在美国英语中则常用garbage和trash来表示这些意思。 英国英语中的trash只用来指质量低劣的东西﹐garbage只用来指愚蠢的话﹑想法等。

Sense.DEF: to say something is bad or useless
not skilful at a particular activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rubbish team
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一支蹩脚的球队

Sense.DEF: silly or of a very low quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: rubbishy magazines
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 垃圾杂志

Sense.DEF: broken stones or bricks from a building or wall that has been destroyed
Sense.TRAN: 〔被毁的建筑物或墙壁的〕碎石﹐碎砖﹐瓦砾

Sense.DEF: if you give someone a rubdown, you rub their body to make them relaxed, especially after exercise
if you give a surface a rubdown, you rub it to make it smooth or clean
someone, usually from the country, who has no experience of other places and thinks in a simple way – used to show disapproval
an infectious disease that causes red spots on your body, and can damage an unborn child
to do something that will have extremely important effects in the future and that you cannot change
Sense.TRAN: 破釜沉舟﹔断然采取行动

Sense.DEF: someone who is rubicund is fat and has a red face

the American spelling of
rouble
a set of instructions or an explanation in a book, examination paper etc
a title under which particular things are mentioned or discussed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The names were listed under the rubric ‘Contributors’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 名字列于“捐赠人”这个标题下面。

Sense.DEF: a red jewel
a dark red colour
a ruched curtain or piece of clothing has parts of it gathered together so that it has folds in it
Sense.TRAN: 〔窗帘﹑衣服等〕有褶子的﹐有褶饰的

Sense.DEF:
a group of
rugby
players trying to get the ball when it is lying on the ground
Sense.TRAN: 〔英式橄榄球赛中的〕密集争球

Sense.DEF: ordinary events or people, which seem rather boring compared to the lives of rich or famous people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Obtaining a good education was seen as a way out of the ruck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获得良好教育被认为是出人头地的一个途径。

Sense.DEF: a group of people standing very closely together or fighting
Sense.TRAN: 聚集在一起的人群﹔打架的一伙人

Sense.DEF: a fight
if a piece of cloth rucks up, or if you ruck it up, it forms folds in an untidy way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your coat’s all rucked up at the back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的外套后背都皱了。

Sense.DEF: a bag used for carrying things on your back, especially by people on long walks
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指长途步行用的〕背包﹐背囊

Sense.DEF: a noisy argument or confused situation
angry talk and complaints because many people are annoyed about a situation
a flat part at the back of a ship or aircraft that can be turned in order to control the direction in which it moves
without someone to lead you or give you an aim or direction
Sense.TRAN: 无人领导的﹔无人指引的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a company left rudderless by the resignation of its CEO
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因首席执行官辞职而变得群龙无首的一家公司

Sense.DEF: a ruddy face looks pink and healthy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ruddy complexion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红润的脸色
Sense.EXAMPLE: ruddy cheeks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红润的面颊

Sense.DEF: red
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fire cast a ruddy glow over the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炉火把房间映得通红。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize what you are saying, especially when you are annoyed with someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 可恶的﹐讨厌的﹐该死的﹐十足的〔用于加强语气﹐表示愤怒〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish that ruddy dog would stop barking!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望那只该死的狗不要再叫了！

Sense.DEF: speaking or behaving in a way that is not polite and is likely to offend or annoy people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rude remark
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粗鲁的话
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t mean to be rude, but I had to leave early.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我并不想显得无礼﹐但我不得不早走。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why are you so rude to her?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为何对她如此粗鲁？

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is rude to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s rude to stare.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 盯着人看是不礼貌的。

Sense.DEF: rude jokes, words, songs etc are about sex
Sense.TRAN: 〔玩笑﹑话语﹑歌曲等〕粗俗的﹐下流的

Sense.DEF: a situation in which you suddenly realize something unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: If they expect the match to be friendly, they’re in for a rude awakening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是他们以为比赛将会友好进行﹐那么他们很快就会清醒了。

Sense.DEF: very healthy
made in a simple basic way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rude wooden hut
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简陋的小木屋

RunOn.EXAMPLE: We were rudely awakened by the storm.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们被暴风雨猛然惊醒。
他十分粗鲁地回了我一句。

Exponent.DEF: not following the rules of good social behaviour or treating other people with a lack of respect
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s rude to interrupt.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 插嘴是不礼貌的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s the rudest man I’ve ever met.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从没见过像他那么粗鲁的人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: rude remarks about her stomach
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 评论她肚子的无礼言语

Exponent.DEF: not following the rules of good social behaviour. Impolite sounds rather formal.
Exponent.TRAN: 无礼的〔impolite听起来颇为正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It is impolite to stare.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 盯着人看是不礼貌的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s not polite to talk with your mouth full of food.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘴里塞满食物说话是不礼貌的。

Exponent.DEF: behaving in a way that is a little rude, especially when this is amusing or annoying – used especially about children
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a cheeky grin
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 顽皮的咧嘴一笑
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Let go, you cheeky monkey (=cheeky child)!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 放手﹐你这没礼貌的捣蛋鬼！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Don’t get smart with me!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 别对我无礼！

Exponent.DEF: saying things that are likely to upset or embarrass someone, without intending to
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a tactless remark
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不得体的话
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How could you be so tactless?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么这么不会说话？

Exponent.DEF: speaking or behaving in a way that is likely to upset or offend someone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His remarks are offensive to African-Americans.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话冒犯了非裔美国人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: offensive language
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 冒犯性的语言

Exponent.DEF: speaking or behaving in a way that is very rude and offensive to someone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: comments that are insulting to women
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 侮辱女性的话
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The article was full of insulting language.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇文章全是侮辱性语言。

Exponent.DEF: rather rude. Discourteous sounds very formal and is often used when talking about being careful not to upset someone’s feelings.
Exponent.TRAN: 失礼的〔该词听上去很正式﹐常用于表示要避免伤害他人感情〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He did not wish to appear discourteous towards his host.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不想显得对主人失礼。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It would seem discourteous to refuse her offer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 拒绝她的提议似乎不礼貌。

Exponent.DEF: behaving in a rude way, especially because you have never been taught how to behave politely
Exponent.TRAN: 举止粗鲁的〔尤指没有教养的〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Ill-mannered movie-goers talked throughout the entire picture.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 没教养的观众整场电影都说个不停。

Exponent.DEF: not showing the proper respect for someone or something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I felt her comments were disrespectful to all the people who have worked so hard on this project.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得她的话不尊重所有为此项目辛勤付出的人们。

Exponent.DEF: not showing a proper respect for someone, especially by asking or talking about subjects that you do not have a right to know about
Exponent.TRAN: 莽撞的﹐不敬的〔尤指询问或谈论自己无权涉及的话题〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an impertinent question about his private life
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于他私生活的无礼问题
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an impertinent young man
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 无礼的年轻人

Exponent.DEF: behaving in a way that is deliberately very rude to someone in authority
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The girl’s only response was an insolent stare.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩唯一的反应是傲慢无礼地瞪一眼。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Don’t be so insolent!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 别那么无礼！

Sense.DEF: a rudimentary knowledge or understanding of a subject is very simple and basic
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某学科的知识或理解〕基本的﹐初步的﹐粗浅的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gradually, I acquired a rudimentary knowledge of music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我逐渐掌握了基本的音乐知识。
Sense.EXAMPLE: my rudimentary German
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我粗浅的德语

Sense.DEF: rudimentary equipment, methods, systems etc are very basic and not advanced
Sense.TRAN: 〔设备﹑方法﹑系统等〕简陋的﹐不先进的
Sense.EXAMPLE: subsistence farming in its most rudimentary form
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最原始方式的自给性耕作
Sense.EXAMPLE: The classroom equipment is pretty rudimentary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教室里的设备相当简陋。

Sense.DEF: the most basic parts of a subject, which you learn first

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the rudiments of windsurfing
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 帆板运动入门

Sense.DEF: to wish that you had not done something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She learned to rue the day she had met Henri.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始后悔认识了亨利。

Sense.DEF: feeling or showing that you wish you had not done something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rueful smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 悔恨的苦笑

Sense.DEF: a stiff circular white collar, worn in the 16th century
Sense.TRAN: 飞边〔流行于16世纪的一种白色轮状硬领〕

Sense.DEF: a circle of feathers or fur around the neck of an animal or bird
a violent man, involved in crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gang of ruffians
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一伙流氓

Sense.DEF: to make a smooth surface uneven
Sense.TRAN: 把〔平整的表面〕弄乱[弄皱]﹐使起伏不平
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ruffled her hair affectionately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他亲昵地拨弄她的头发。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A light wind ruffled the water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵轻风吹皱了水面。

Sense.DEF: to offend or upset someone slightly
Sense.TRAN: 使有点生气﹐使略为不快
Sense.EXAMPLE: Louise’s sharp comments had ruffled his pride.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路易斯尖刻的话伤了他的自尊。

GramExa.GLOSS: offend someone

Sense.DEF: a band of thin cloth sewn in folds as a decoration around the edge of something such as a collar
a piece of thick cloth or wool that covers part of a floor, used for warmth or as a decoration
a large piece of material that you can wrap around yourself, especially when you are travelling
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指旅行用﹑可裹身的〕大毛毯

Sense.LEXUNIT: pull the rug (out) from under sb/sb’s feet
Sense.DEF: to suddenly take away something that someone was depending on to achieve what they wanted
Sense.TRAN: 突然停止对某人的支持

Sense.DEF:
a
toupée
– used humorously

an outdoor game played by two teams with an
oval egg-shaped
ball that you kick or carry
a type of rugby played by teams of 13 players
a type of rugby played by teams of 15 players
land that is rugged is rough and uneven
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rugged coastline
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 崎岖不平的海岸线
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rugged beauty of the Highlands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏格兰高地崎岖起伏的美景

Sense.DEF: a man who is rugged is good-looking and has strong features which are often not perfect
Sense.EXAMPLE: his rugged good looks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他粗犷而英俊的容貌

Sense.DEF: a vehicle or piece of equipment that is rugged is strongly built and not likely to break easily
rugged behaviour is confident and determined but not always polite
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为举止〕自信而坚决的﹐坚毅的
Sense.EXAMPLE: rugged individualism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坚定的我行我素

Sense.DEF: Rugby Union
to spoil or destroy something completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: This illness has ruined my life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个病毁掉了我的生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His career would be ruined.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的事业将被毁掉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All this mud’s going to ruin my shoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这泥巴会把我的鞋弄坏。

Sense.DEF: to make someone lose all their money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jefferson was ruined by the lawsuit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰弗逊因为那场官司倾家荡产。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which you have lost all your money, your social position, or the good opinion that people had about you
Sense.EXAMPLE: small businesses facing financial ruin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面临破产的小企业

GramExa.PROPFORM: be on the road to ruin
GramExa.GLOSS: be doing something that will make you lose your money, position etc

Sense.DEF: the part of a building that is left after the rest has been destroyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: an interesting old ruin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一处有意思的古老废墟
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ruins of a bombed-out office block
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被炸毁的办公楼的废墟

Sense.DEF: the parts of something such as an organization, system, or set of ideas that remain after the rest have been destroyed
Sense.TRAN: 〔组织﹑体制﹑思想等的〕残余部分
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ruins of a government that once held so much promise
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曾经大有希望的一个政府的残余力量

Subsense.DEF: if a building is in ruins, it has fallen down or been badly damaged

if someone’s life, a country’s
economy
etc is in ruins, it is affected by very great problems
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Her marriage was in ruins.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的婚姻破裂了。

Sense.DEF: if something falls into ruin, it gets damaged or destroyed because no one is taking care of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had let the farm go to ruin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他任凭农场败落下去。

Sense.DEF: to make someone lose all their money, their good health, the good opinion that other people have of them etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Drinking was the ruin of him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酗酒毁了他。

Sense.DEF: a process in which someone or something is ruined, or the cause of this – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 毁灭﹔毁坏﹔崩溃﹔毁灭之原因﹐祸根〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a ruined building has been almost completely destroyed
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物〕毁坏了的﹐严重受损的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ruined castle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 破败的城堡

Sense.DEF: causing a lot of damage or problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ruinous civil war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场毁灭性的内战

Sense.DEF: costing much more than you can afford
Sense.TRAN: 导致破产的﹔耗资巨大的
Sense.EXAMPLE: ruinous rates of interest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨额利率

Sense.DEF: a building that is ruinous has been almost completely destroyed
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物〕毁坏了的﹐严重受损的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an old ruinous chapel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老旧破败的小教堂

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the ruinous state of the city walls
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 城墙破败的样子

Sense.DEF: an official instruction that says how things must be done or what is allowed, especially in a game, organization, or job
Sense.TRAN: 规则﹔章程﹔规定〔尤用于游戏﹑组织或工作〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the rules of the game
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 游戏规则

GramExa.PROPFORM: under the rules/according to the rules
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Under the rules, the company must publish its annual accounts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据规定﹐该公司必须公布年度账目。

Sense.DEF: what you should do in a particular situation, or a statement about this
Sense.TRAN: 〔特定情况下〕应做的事﹔规定﹐规则
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are no hard and fast rules clear and definite rules about what to wear to classes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于上课着装并没有硬性规定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are two basic rules of survival.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有两条基本的生存规则。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The rule is: if you feel any pain you should stop exercising immediately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原则是: 如果觉得疼痛﹐就应立即停止锻炼。

Sense.DEF: something that is normal or usually true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: As a general rule most students finish their coursework by the end of May.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一般来说﹐大多数学生在5月底结束他们的课程。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Early marriage used to be the rule in that part of the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去在那个地方早婚是常见现象。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A series of payments used to be the exception rather than the rule .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在过去分期付款并不多见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unfortunately there is an exception to every rule .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很遗憾﹐每项规则都有例外。

Sense.DEF: the government of a country or area by a particular group of people or using a particular system

GramExa.EXAMPLE: people living under colonial rule
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活在殖民统治下的人们

Sense.EXAMPLE: the end of colonial rule
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 殖民统治的结束
Sense.EXAMPLE: a period of military rule
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军政府统治的时期
Sense.EXAMPLE: direct rule from Westminster
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国议会的直接统治
Sense.EXAMPLE: the restoration of majority rule government by the party that most people have voted for to Northern Ireland
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北爱尔兰恢复由获多数选票的政党执政

Sense.DEF: a statement about what is usually allowed in a particular system, such as the grammar of a language, or a science

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the rules of English punctuation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英语标点符号的用法

Sense.DEF: a situation in which the laws of a country are obeyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are here to uphold the rule of law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在这里是要维护法治。

Sense.DEF: what people believe to be right and fair
Sense.EXAMPLE: The governor failed to observe the rules of natural justice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总督不讲公道。

Sense.DEF: a rough figure or method of calculation, based on practical experience
Sense.TRAN: 〔基于实际经验的〕粗略的数字[计算方法]
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a general rule of thumb, children this age should not spend more than one hour on homework.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按照实际经验﹐这个年龄的儿童花在家庭作业上的时间不应超过一小时。

Sense.LEXUNIT: make it a rule (to do sth)
Sense.DEF: to try to make sure that you always do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I make it a rule never to mix business with pleasure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我定下一个规矩﹐绝不把工作和娱乐混在一起。

Sense.DEF:
a
ruler

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not obey it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had clearly broken the official rules.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他显然违反了官方的规定。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She wasn’t going to obey their silly rules.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不会去遵守他们的愚蠢规定。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: obey it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: All members must comply with the rules of the organization.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有成员都必须服从组织的规定。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: obey them
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We all have to stick to the rules.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都必须恪守规定。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’m only an assistant manager – I don’t make the rules.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是个经理助理——规则不是我定的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The rule says that you must be standing inside the line.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 按规定﹐必须站在线内。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it concerns them
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 规定适用于某人/某事物

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do what is expected and agreed
allow someone to do something that is not normally allowed
make them less strict
make them stricter
make sure that it is obeyed

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They have very strict rules about gambling.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于赌博﹐他们有严格的规定。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The rules of the game are quite simple.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一游戏的规则很简单。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: unreasonable rules about unimportant things
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There are hundreds of petty rules.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几百条琐碎的规定。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 学校/监狱/俱乐部等规章
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had broken one of the school rules.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他违反了一条校规。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a rule of behaviour that everyone in a group understands
not be allowed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was against the rules to talk in class.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在课堂上讲话是不守规矩。

Collocate.COLLOC: the rules concerning/governing/relating to sth formal
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the rules about something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: the rules governing food labeling
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 食品标签规定

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a rule must be obeyed

Exponent.DEF: an instruction that says what people are allowed to do or not allowed to do, for example in a game, school, or company
Exponent.TRAN: 〔游戏﹑学校或公司等的〕规则﹔章程﹔规定
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the rules of baseball
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 棒球规则
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He disobeyed the school rules.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不遵守校规。

Exponent.DEF: an official rule that everyone in a country, city, or state must obey
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It is against the law to carry a concealed weapon.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 携带秘密武器是违法的。

Exponent.DEF: an official rule or order, which is part of a set of rules made by a government or organization
Exponent.TRAN: 〔政府或机构制定的〕规章﹔条例
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the regulations for applying for a passport
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 申领护照之规定
Exponent.EXAMPLE: building regulations
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 建筑规定

Exponent.DEF: an official rule that limits what people can do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: new restrictions on immigration
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的移民限制规定
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The government is planning to impose restrictions on the amount of alcohol you can bring into the country.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府正计划对可携带入境的酒品数量实行限制。

Exponent.DEF: rules or instructions about the best way to do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the Department of Health’s guidelines for a healthy diet
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 卫生部健康饮食准则

Exponent.DEF: a set of rules that people or organizations agree to obey but are not forced to obey
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The school has a dress code for its students.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那所学校有学生着装规定。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the company’s code of conduct
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的行为准则

Exponent.DEF: a law that has been officially approved by a parliament, council etc, and written down
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The statute banned corporal punishment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条法令禁止体罚。

Sense.DEF: to have the official power to control a country and the people who live there
Sense.EXAMPLE: Queen Victoria ruled England for 64 years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维多利亚女王统治英格兰64年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: African tribal societies were traditionally ruled by a council of elders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非洲部落社会传统上由长老会统治。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Alexander the Great ruled over a huge empire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚历山大大帝统治一个庞大的帝国。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He announced that henceforth he would rule by decree make all the important decisions himself .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他宣布他将从此实行专制统治。

Sense.DEF: if a feeling or desire rules someone, it has a powerful and controlling influence on their actions
Sense.EXAMPLE: the passion for power and success which rules her life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 支配着她生活的对权力和成功的强烈渴望

Sense.DEF: to make an official decision about something, especially a legal problem
Sense.TRAN: 判定﹐裁定〔尤指法律问题〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The judge ruled that she should have custody of the children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官判定孩子的监护权归她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Supreme Court has yet to rule on the case.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最高法院尚未裁定此案。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tribunal ruled in her favour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 特别法庭作出了有利于她的裁决。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This part of the bill was ruled unconstitutional.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法案的这部分内容被判定违反宪法。

Sense.DEF: to be the most powerful person in a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: His wife rules the roost in their house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们家里他妻子说了算。

Sense.LEXUNIT: rule sb/sth with a rod of iron

Variant.LEXVAR: rule sb with an iron fist/hand

Sense.DEF: to control a group of people in a very severe way
Sense.TRAN: 对某人/某事物实行严酷的高压统治
Sense.EXAMPLE: Although he was a fair man, he ruled us with an iron fist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然他是个正直的人﹐但他对我们实行高压管理。

Sense.DEF: used to say that the team, school, place etc mentioned is better than any other
Sense.TRAN: 某人/某事物最好〔指球队﹑学校﹑地方等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Arsenal rules OK.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿森纳队必胜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: graffiti saying ‘Poheny High rules’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 写着“波黑尼高中最棒”的涂鸦

Sense.DEF: to draw a line using a ruler or other straight edge
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rule a line under each answer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在每个答案下面画一条线。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: let your heart rule your head

Sense.DEF: to decide that something is not possible or suitable
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police have ruled out suicide.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方已经排除了自杀的可能。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has refused to rule out the possibility of singing again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在是否再唱歌的问题上﹐她给自己留下了回旋余地。

Sense.DEF: to make it impossible for something to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mountainous terrain rules out most forms of agriculture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多山的地形使大多数农耕形式都无法采用。

Sense.DEF: to state that someone will not be able to take part in a sports event
Sense.TRAN: 表示〔某人〕无法参加比赛

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has been ruled out of the match with a knee injury.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因膝伤无法参赛。

Sense.DEF: to obey exactly the rules about how something should be done
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I went by the rulebook, I’d have to report this conversation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果按照规定去做﹐我就必须汇报这次谈话。

Sense.DEF: a book of rules, especially one that is given to workers in a job
ruled paper has parallel lines printed across it
someone such as a king or queen who has official power over a country or area
a long flat straight piece of plastic, metal, or wood that you use for measuring things or drawing straight lines
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 12-inch ruler
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把12英寸的尺子

Sense.DEF: an official decision, especially one made by a court

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the recent Supreme Court ruling on defendants’ rights
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最高法院最近就被告权利的裁决

Sense.DEF: the ruling group in a country or organization is the group that controls it
Sense.EXAMPLE: A ruling class clearly existed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 统治阶级显然是存在的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ruling body of American golf
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国高尔夫球运动的管理机构

Sense.DEF: a ruling interest or emotion interests someone more than anything else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Football remains the ruling passion of many men.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球仍是许多男人最大的爱好。

Sense.DEF: a strong alcoholic drink made from sugar, or a glass of this drink
Sense.TRAN: 朗姆酒〔一种由糖制成的烈酒〕﹔一杯朗姆酒

Sense.DEF: unusual or strange
a popular dance from Cuba, or music for this dance
to make a series of long low sounds, especially a long distance away from you
Sense.TRAN: 发出隆隆声〔尤指来自远处〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We could hear thunder rumbling in the distance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们听见远处雷声隆隆。

Sense.DEF: to move slowly along while making a series of long low sounds
Sense.EXAMPLE: We watched the tanks rumbling past the window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看着坦克从窗前隆隆驶过。

Sense.DEF: if your stomach rumbles, it makes a noise, especially because you are hungry
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指肚子因饥饿〕发出咕噜声

Sense.DEF: to find out what someone is secretly intending to do
Sense.TRAN: 识破﹐看穿〔某人的秘密企图〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How did you rumble them?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是怎么识破他们的？

Sense.DEF: to fight with someone
if a disagreement rumbles on, it continues for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The row about pay is still rumbling on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于工资的争论还在继续。

Sense.DEF: a series of long low sounds

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the low rumble of traffic in the distance
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 远处低沉的隆隆车流声
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the distant rumble of gunfire
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 远处隆隆的枪炮声

Sense.DEF: a number of raised lines across a road which make a loud noise when you drive over them to warn you to slow down
Sense.TRAN: 震动带﹐隆声带〔路面的隆起带﹐车辆驶过时会发出声响﹐以提醒司机减速〕

Sense.DEF: remarks that show that people are starting to become annoyed, or that a difficult situation is developing
Sense.TRAN: 怨声﹔〔情况恶化的〕传闻﹐风声
Sense.EXAMPLE: rumblings of discontent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啧有烦言
Sense.EXAMPLE: There have been rumblings about the need for better computers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们一直抱怨说需要更先进的电脑。

Sense.DEF: a series of long low sounds
Sense.EXAMPLE: We heard a rumbling behind us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们听到后面传来隆隆的声音。

Sense.DEF: full of energy, fun, and noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: rumbustious football fans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喧闹的足球迷

Sense.DEF: an animal such as a cow that has several stomachs and eats grass
to think carefully and deeply about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He sat alone, ruminating on the injustice of the world.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他独自坐着﹐思考世事的不公。

Sense.DEF:
if animals such as cows ruminate, they bring food back into their mouths from their stomachs and
chew
it again
thinking deeply and carefully about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a typically ruminative speech
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 典型的有深度的演说

Sense.DEF: to search for something by moving things around in a careless or hurried way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Looks like someone’s been rummaging around in my desk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好像有人翻过我的书桌。

Sense.DEF: a careless or hurried search for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have a rummage in my jewellery box and see if you can find something you like.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我的首饰盒里翻翻﹐看有没有你喜欢的。

Sense.DEF: old clothes, toys etc that you no longer want
an event at which old clothes, toys etc are sold as a way of getting money, for example to help a school or church
Sense.TRAN: 旧杂物义卖〔为资助学校﹑教堂等〕

Sense.DEF: a simple card game in which players try to collect series of cards
Sense.TRAN: 拉米纸牌游戏〔玩者要尽可能组成套牌〕

Sense.DEF: information or a story that is passed from one person to another and which may or may not be true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve heard all sorts of rumours about him and his secretary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听说了有关他和他秘书的种种传闻。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s an unsubstantiated rumour that Eddie is bankrupt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个未经证实的传言﹐说埃迪破产了。

Sense.DEF: the people, considered as a group, who discuss something and pass rumours to each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: His name has come up in the rumour mill as a possible director for the project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有谣传说他可能出任这个项目的主管。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A rumour spread that he had been killed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有传闻说他遇害了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a rumour is passed among people
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There are a lot of rumors going around that they’re going to sell the company.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人都说他们打算把公司卖了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it is being said
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Rumour has it that they plan to get married.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 据传他们打算结婚。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I heard a rumour that she was leaving.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到传闻说她要走了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Someone has been spreading rumours about us.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人一直在散布关于我们的谣言。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say that it is true

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He says that the rumours are completely unfounded.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说﹐这些传言毫无根据。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: are talked about by a lot of people
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Rumours were rife that the band had refused to play.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 盛传那支乐队拒绝表演。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The arrests followed widespread rumours of police corruption.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 盛传警察腐败﹐之后便有多人被捕。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that keeps being repeated for a long time
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Despite persistent rumours of an affair, his wife stood by him.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管绯闻一直流传不息﹐他的妻子仍然支持他。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a rumour that is likely to be true
one that is completely untrue
a false one that someone spreads to make trouble
one that has not been proved to be true
a damaging and false rumour

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘a rumour spreads out’. Say 而要说 a rumour spreads .

Exponent.DEF: information or a story that is passed from one person to another and which may or may not be true
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The band denied the rumours that they may be splitting up.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该乐队否认了他们会解散的传言。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The truth finally came out after months of rumour.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 传言纷扰了数月之后﹐真相终于水落石出。

Exponent.DEF: a situation in which a lot of people are talking about something that is happening, especially something that is happening in politics or public life, and trying to guess what the truth is
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指关于政治或公众事件的〕猜测﹐推测
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was a great deal of speculation about a possible merger involving Belgium’s largest banks.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 比利时最大的几家银行有可能合并﹐人们对此猜测纷纷。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The report fuelled speculation caused more speculation that he was about to resign.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 报道引起了对他即将辞职一事的更多猜测。

Exponent.DEF: things that people say about what they think has happened in other people’s private lives, which is usually not true
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She tells me all the latest gossip from the office.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把办公室里最新的八卦新闻都对我说。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The magazine was full of gossip about celebrities.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本杂志上全是名人的花边新闻。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t believe every piece of gossip you hear.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不该对听到的每一句闲话都信以为真。

Exponent.DEF: something that people talk about a lot but which is not official
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The government has dismissed talk of a military strike on the country.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府否认了对该国进行军事袭击的传言。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s been a lot of talk of him resigning.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有很多传言说他要辞职。

Exponent.DEF: something that you have heard from someone else, but cannot prove whether it is true or untrue – often used in legal contexts
Exponent.TRAN: 道听途说〔常用于法律语境〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: All the accounts were based on hearsay rather than eye-witness reports.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有叙述全都基于传闻﹐而非目击报告。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: hearsay evidence
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 传闻证据

Sense.DEF: if something is rumoured to be true, people are saying secretly or unofficially that it may be true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was rumoured that Johnson had been poisoned.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 传言说约翰逊是被毒死的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was rumoured to be a millionaire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说她是个百万富翁。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a young man widely rumoured to be her lover
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 盛传是她情人的一个年轻男子

Sense.DEF: someone who tells other people rumours – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 散布谣言的人﹐造谣的人〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: the part of an animal’s back that is just above its legs
good quality meat that comes from the rump of a cow
the part of your body that you sit on – used humorously
the part of a group or government that remains after most of the other members have left
to make hair, clothes etc less tidy
Sense.TRAN: 把〔头发﹑衣服等〕弄乱﹐弄皱
Sense.EXAMPLE: He rumpled her hair playfully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开玩笑地拨弄她的头发。

Sense.DEF: a lot of noise, especially made by people quarrelling
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a real rumpus going on upstairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 楼上正吵得不可开交。

Sense.DEF: a room in a house that is used by the family for games, parties etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔家庭的〕聚会室﹐游艺室﹐娱乐室

Sense.DEF: sexual activity – used humorously

Subsense.DEF: to move very quickly, by moving your legs more quickly than when you walk

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I ran down the stairs as fast as I could.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我尽可能快地跑下楼梯。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was running towards the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正朝着门口跑去。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She turned and ran away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她转身跑掉了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boys ran off into the crowd.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩们跑进了人群。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several people ran to help her when she fell.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她摔倒了﹐好几个人跑去扶她。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: The children came running out of the house.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们从屋里跑出来。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Women ran screaming , with children in their arms.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妇女们抱着孩子﹐一边跑一边尖叫。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Jane struggled free and ran for her life ran in order to avoid being killed .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简挣脱出来﹐赶紧逃命。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Hurry! Run for it run as quickly as possible in order to escape !
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快！ 快逃！
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He picked up the child and ran like hell . ran very quickly, especially in order to escape
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抱起孩子﹐拼命奔逃。

Subsense.DEF: to run a particular distance
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Firefighters are to run 500km to raise money for a children’s charity.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防人员将跑500公里﹐为一个儿童慈善机构筹款。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He ran the length of the corridor.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从走廊的这头跑到另一头。

Subsense.DEF: to run in a race
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’d never run a marathon before.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前从未参加过马拉松比赛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Murray has said she will consider running in the 3,000 metres.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 默里说她将考虑参加3,000米赛跑。

Subsense.DEF: if a race is run at a particular time or in a particular place, it happens at that time or in that place
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The Derby will be run at 3 o’clock.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德比马赛将于3点钟举行。

Sense.DEF: to organize or be in charge of an activity, business, organization, or country
Sense.EXAMPLE: For a while, she ran a restaurant in Boston.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一段时间她在波士顿开餐馆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people don’t care who runs the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人不在乎由谁统治国家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Courses are currently being run in London and Edinburgh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前伦敦和爱丁堡两地都开设了这些课程。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people belong to a pension scheme run by their employers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人参加了由雇主管理的养老金计划。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hotel is well-run and extremely popular.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店经营得很好﹐十分受欢迎。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a state-run controlled by the government television station
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国营电视台

Sense.DEF: to do something or go somewhere quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Run and ask your mother where she’s put the keys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快去问你妈﹐她把钥匙放在哪儿了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I need to run to the store for some more milk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得赶快到商店去再买点牛奶。

Subsense.DEF: if a bus, train etc service runs, it takes people from one place to another at fixed times
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The buses don’t run on Sundays.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车星期天停驶。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The number 61 bus runs to the city centre.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 61路公共汽车开往市中心。

Subsense.DEF: if a company or other organization runs a bus, train etc service, they make it operate
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They’re running special trains to and from the exhibition.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有往返展览会的专线列车。

Subsense.DEF: if a computer program runs, it operates

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The software will run on any PC.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个软件可在任何一台个人电脑上运行。

Subsense.DEF: if you run a program, you make it operate
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The RS8 system runs both Unix and MPX-32. RS8
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 系统既可运行Unix﹐也可运行MPX-32。

Subsense.DEF: if a machine or engine runs, it operates
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She got out of the car and left the engine running.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她下了车﹐让引擎开着。

GramExa.GLOSS: get its power from electricity etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 用电/用煤气/用汽油等驱动
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most cars run on unleaded fuel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数汽车使用无铅汽油。

GramExa.GLOSS: use something for power
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It runs off batteries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 它使用电池作为动力。

Subsense.DEF: if you run a machine or engine, you make it operate
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t keep the engine running when the car is standing still.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车停下来时﹐不应该让引擎空转。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I often run the washing machine more than once a day.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我经常一天不止一次使用洗衣机。

Subsense.DEF: if a tape is running, it is recording
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t realize the tape was running as she spoke.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有意识到她说话的时候﹐磁带正在录音。

Subsense.DEF: if you run a tape, you make it move backwards or forwards
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Run the tape back to the beginning.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把磁带倒到开头。

Subsense.DEF: to print something in a newspaper or magazine, or broadcast something on television
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The company is running a series of advertisements in national newspapers.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司正在全国性报纸上刊登一系列广告。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A local TV station ran her story.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家地方电视台报道了她的事迹。

Subsense.DEF: if a program runs on television, it is shown. If a story runs in a newspaper or magazine, it is printed.
Subsense.TRAN: 〔节目在电视上〕播放﹔〔故事在报纸或杂志上〕刊登
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The series ran for 20 episodes and was extremely popular.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个系列片播了20集﹐极受欢迎。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Conan Doyle’s stories ran in ‘The Strand’ magazine.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柯南·道尔的小说在《河滨》杂志上连载。

Sense.DEF: to move too fast or in an uncontrolled way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her car ran off the road and into a tree.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的汽车冲出路面﹐撞到一棵树上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The truck ran out of control and hit a house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡车失控﹐撞上了一栋房子。

Sense.DEF: to own and use a vehicle
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t afford to run a car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我养不起车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A bicycle is relatively cheap to buy and run.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自行车买和用都相对便宜。

Sense.DEF: to take someone somewhere in your car
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shall I run you home?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要我开车送你回家吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let me run you to the station.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开车送你去车站吧。

Sense.DEF: to try to be elected in an election

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Salinas is running for a second term as President.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨利纳斯正在竞选连任总统。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an attempt to encourage more women to run for office
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鼓励更多女性竞选公职的尝试

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Feinstein will win if she runs against Lungren.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 范斯坦如果和朗格伦竞争﹐将会胜选。

Sense.DEF: if something long such as a road or wire runs in a particular direction, that is its position, or that is where you put it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The road runs along a valley.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条路沿山谷延伸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Developers want to run a road right through his farm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开发商想修一条路﹐正好穿过他的农场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Run the cables under the carpet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把电缆铺在地毯下面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Sierra mountain range runs the length of the north west coast of Majorca.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢拉山脉横贯马略卡岛西北海岸。

Sense.DEF: to move something lightly along a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charles ran his fingers through her hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯用手指拢着她的头发。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Run the scanner over the bar codes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用扫描器扫描条形码。

Sense.DEF: to flow in a particular direction or place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tears started to run down her cheeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼泪开始顺着她的脸颊淌下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Water was running off the roof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水从屋顶流下来。

Sense.DEF:
if a
tap
is running, water is coming out of it, or if you run a tap, you make water come out of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you leave the tap running?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是不是没关水龙头？
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ran the tap until the water was really hot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开着水龙头﹐直到流出的水很烫。

Sense.DEF: to fill a bath with water
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could hear her running a bath upstairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到她在楼上放洗澡水。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Could you run me a nice hot bath while I finish my meal?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 趁我吃饭的时候你给我放一浴缸热水好吗？

Sense.DEF: if someone’s nose is running, liquid is flowing out of it
if something runs for a particular length of time, it can officially be used for that time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The contract runs for a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合同有效期为一年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My car insurance only has another month to run.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的汽车保险只剩一个月了。

Sense.DEF: to continue being performed regularly in one place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The play ran for two years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该剧连续演出了两年。

Sense.DEF: to happen in a particular way or at a particular time
Sense.TRAN: 〔以某种方式或在某个时间〕发生
Sense.EXAMPLE: Andy kept things running smoothly happening in the way they should while I was away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不在的时候﹐安迪把一切都安排得井井有条。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was given a further three month prison sentence to run concurrently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他另外又获刑三个月﹐合并执行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The course runs over a three year period.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个课程为期三年。

Sense.DEF: to be at a particular level, amount, or price
Sense.TRAN: 处于﹐达到〔某个水平﹑数量或价格〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Inflation was running at 5%.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 通货膨胀率为5%。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cost of repairing the damage could run to $5,000.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 修理损坏的费用可能达5,000美元。

Sense.DEF: if a story, discussion etc runs in a particular way, it has those particular words or events
Sense.EXAMPLE: The story runs that someone offered Lynch a further $500.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事情是这样的: 有人又给了林奇500美元。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘President’s marriage really over’ ran the headline in a national newspaper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家全国性报纸的头条新闻是“总统的婚姻真的完了”。

Sense.DEF: if something runs its course, it continues in the way you expect until it has finished
Sense.EXAMPLE: Recession in the country has run its course and left an aftermath of uncertainty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的经济衰退已经偃旗息鼓﹐但是余波未了﹐未来仍然捉摸不定。

Sense.DEF: if a subject, discussion, event etc will run and run, people will continue to be interested in it for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔话题﹑讨论﹑事件等〕将持续很长时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is a story that will run and run.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个故事将会一直流传下去。

Sense.DEF: if a feeling runs through you, or a thought runs through your mind, you feel it or think it quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A feeling of excitement ran through her body as they touched.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们彼此碰到时﹐她全身一阵激动。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The same thought kept running through his mind.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个想法一直萦绕在他的脑海里。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A cold shiver ran down my back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的后背一阵发凉。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I felt a sharp pain run down my leg.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到腿上一阵剧痛。

Sense.DEF: if feelings run high, people are very angry, upset, excited etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tension ran high and fights broke out among the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 气氛紧张﹐人群中发生了打斗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Feelings have been running high in the town, following the murder of a young girl.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个年轻女孩被害之后﹐镇上群情激愤。

Sense.DEF: to keep telling someone what they should do all the time, in a way that annoys them
Sense.TRAN: 对某人的生活不断指手画脚
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t try to run my life!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别想主宰我的生活！

Subsense.DEF: to run towards a place where you will be safe, especially to avoid bullets
Subsense.TRAN: 跑向安全的地方〔尤指为躲避子弹〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He was shot in the leg as he ran for cover.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他跑着找地方躲避的时候﹐腿部中了弹。

Subsense.DEF: to try to protect yourself from a bad situation or from being criticized
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His success at backing winning horses has had the bookmakers running for cover.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他赌马总是押对﹐已经让赌马经纪人避之唯恐不及。

Sense.DEF: if colour runs, it spreads from one piece of clothing or one area of cloth to another when the clothes are wet
Sense.EXAMPLE: The T-shirt ran and made all my other clothes pink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: T恤衫渗色﹐把我其他衣服都染成粉红色了。

Sense.DEF: if paint runs, it moves onto an area where you did not intend it to go
to arrange for someone or something to be checked or tested

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ask your doctor to run a test on your blood sugar levels.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让医生给你测一下血糖水平。

Sense.DEF:
if a hole in
tights
or
stocking s
runs, it gets bigger in a straight line
to bring drugs or guns into a country illegally in order to sell them
if something such as a quality, disease, or skill runs in the family, many people in that family have it
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种品质﹑疾病﹑技能等〕在家族中遗传﹐是家族特征
Sense.EXAMPLE: Diabetes appears to run in families.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 糖尿病似乎是家族遗传的。

Sense.DEF: to have a body temperature that is higher than normal, because you are ill
to try very hard to avoid a particular situation or person because you do not want to deal with them
Sense.TRAN: 尽量避而远之﹐躲得远远的
Sense.EXAMPLE: If someone asked me to marry them, I’d probably run a mile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果有人来向我求婚﹐我可能会躲得远远的。

Sense.DEF: to arrive, go somewhere, or do something late, early, or at the right time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m running late, so I’ll talk to you later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我晚了﹐回头再和你谈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the train runs on time, we’ll be there by ten.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果火车准时﹐我们10点钟之前可以到那儿。

Sense.DEF: to feel worried because someone who you are competing against is becoming very successful or powerful
Sense.TRAN: 〔因对手越来越成功或强大而〕担心﹐烦恼
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party are running scared.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党有了危机感。

Subsense.DEF: to react in a very eager way when someone asks or tells you to do something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He thinks he’s only got to look at me and I’ll come running.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以为只要他使个眼色﹐我就会赶紧照他说的办。

Subsense.DEF: to ask someone for help, advice, or sympathy when you have a problem

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Well I warned you, so don’t come running to me when it all goes wrong!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我警告过你的﹐所以出了问题别来求我！

Sense.LEXUNIT: run your eyes over/along etc sth
Sense.DEF: to look quickly at something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ran his eyes along the books on the shelf.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他扫了一眼书架上的书。

Sense.DEF: to try to do something difficult before you have learned the basic skills you need
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of language students want to run before they can walk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多学习语言的学生都好高骛远。

Sense.DEF:
to drive quickly through a red
traffic light
instead of stopping

Exponent.DEF: to move very quickly, by moving your legs more quickly than when you walk
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My five-year-old son runs everywhere.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我五岁大的儿子到处跑。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I go running twice a week.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一星期跑步两次。

Exponent.DEF: to run quite slowly for exercise over a long distance
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A few people were jogging in the park.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些人在公园里慢跑。

Exponent.DEF: to run somewhere as quickly as you can, especially because you have to do something urgently
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He dashed across the road to the police station.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他飞快地穿过马路奔向警察局。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We raced to the bus stop and got there just in time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们奔到公共汽车站﹐好赶上。

Exponent.DEF: to run as fast as you can for a short distance
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I saw the runners sprinting past.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到选手们冲了过去。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He sprinted up the stairs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他飞奔上楼。

Exponent.DEF: to run very quickly and without really looking where you are going, because you are in a hurry
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He tore down the street and around the corner.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在街上飞奔﹐然后转过街角。

Exponent.DEF: to run quickly and with a lot of energy, so that you might knock down anyone or anything that gets in your way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They all charged out of the school gates at 4 o’clock.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一到4点﹐他们全都冲出校门。

Exponent.DEF: to start running away very quickly, especially to escape or because you are afraid
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The men took to their heels as soon as they saw the police.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些男子一看到警察就逃。

Exponent.DEF: to run fairly slowly, taking short steps – used especially about horses and dogs
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A little dog was trotting behind her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只小狗跟在她身后跑。

Exponent.DEF: if a horse gallops, it runs very quickly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The horse galloped off across the field.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那匹马飞奔穿过田野。

Exponent.DEF: to suddenly run somewhere very fast, especially in order to escape
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Suddenly a fox bolted out from beneath a hedge.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然﹐一只狐狸从树篱下逃窜出来。

Sense.DEF: to meet someone or find something by chance
Sense.TRAN: 与…不期而遇﹐偶然碰见﹔偶然发现
Sense.EXAMPLE: I ran across him at a conference in Milan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在米兰的一次大会上碰到过他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I ran across some old love letters while I was clearing out a cupboard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在清理柜子时找到一些旧情书。

Sense.DEF: to chase someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ran after her, calling her name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他叫着她的名字在后面追她。

Sense.DEF: to try to start a sexual relationship with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s always running after younger women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他老是追求年轻女子。

Sense.DEF: to do a lot of things for someone else as though you were their servant
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t keep running after you all day!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不可能整天跟在你后面伺候你！

Sense.DEF: used to tell a child to leave, or to tell someone that you must leave
Sense.TRAN: 走开〔用于命令小孩〕﹔离开〔用于告诉别人你得走了〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Run along now! I’ve got work to finish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赶紧走开！我有工作要完成。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, it’s late. I’d better be running along.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐时候不早了﹐我得走了。

Sense.DEF: to run in an area while you are playing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children were running around in the garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们在花园里跑来跑去。

Sense.DEF: to be very busy doing many small jobs
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maria was running around trying to get the house tidy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚在忙着收拾房子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were all running around like headless chickens trying to do a lot of things, in an anxious or disorganized way .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都跟无头苍蝇似的在瞎忙。

Sense.DEF: to do a lot of things for someone else as though you were their servant
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve spent all day running around after the kids.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我整天都在侍候孩子们。

Sense.DEF: to spend a lot of time with someone, especially someone that other people disapprove of
Sense.EXAMPLE: He started running around with a gang of teenagers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始和一帮小混混厮混。

Sense.DEF: to leave a place, especially secretly, in order to escape from someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Toby ran away from home at the age of 14.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 托比14岁时离家出走。

Sense.DEF: to try to avoid dealing with a problem or difficult situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can’t just run away from your responsibilities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能逃避责任。

Sense.DEF: to secretly go away with someone in order to marry them or live with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: They ran away together to get married.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一起私奔去结婚。

Sense.DEF: to secretly go away with someone in order to marry them or live with them – usually used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: His wife has run away with another man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的妻子跟别的男人走了。

Sense.DEF: if your feelings, ideas etc run away with you, they start to control how you behave
Sense.TRAN: 〔感情﹑思想等〕控制〔某人〕﹐使按捺不住
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t let your imagination run away with you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要想入非非！

Sense.LEXUNIT: your tongue runs away with you
Sense.DEF: if your tongue runs away with you, you say something that you did not intend to say
Sense.TRAN: 说了不想说的话﹐说漏嘴

Sense.DEF: to think that something is true when it is not
Sense.TRAN: 有…的错误想法/印象﹐误以为
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t run away with the impression that he doesn’t care.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要以为他不在乎。

Sense.DEF: to win a competition or sports game very easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Reds ran away with the championship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红人队轻松夺冠。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone something so that they can give you their opinion
Sense.TRAN: 〔为征询意见〕把〔某事〕告诉〔某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let me run some figures by you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给你说几个数据吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just wanted to run it past you and see what you thought.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是想说给你听听﹐看看你有什么想法。

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone to repeat what they have just said because you did not completely understand it
Sense.TRAN: 再说一遍〔用于因没有完全听懂而要求某人重复〕

Sense.DEF: to drive into a person or animal and kill or injure them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their daughter was run down by a car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的女儿被车撞了。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone or something in a way that is unfair
Sense.TRAN: 贬低﹔诋 毁﹔说…的坏话
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a lot of good things about homeopathic treatment. I’m certainly not running it down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顺势疗法有很多优点﹐我当然不是在贬低它。

Sense.TRAN: 〔钟﹑机器等因缺乏动力〕停止﹔〔电池〕耗尽

Sense.DEF: to make a company, organization etc gradually reduce in size, especially in order to close it in the future, or to gradually reduce in size
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔公司﹑组织等的规模〕逐渐缩减〔尤为了日后停办〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many smaller local hospitals are being run down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多较小的地方医院都在逐渐缩减规模。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The business had been running down for a long time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该企业缩减规模已经有很长时间了。

Sense.DEF: if a supply of something runs down, or if you run it down, there gradually becomes less of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Crude oil reserves are running down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原油储备在逐渐缩减。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Electricity generating companies are running down stocks and cutting purchases.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 发电公司正在缩减备用物资﹐减少采购。

Sense.DEF: to read a list of people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let me just run down the list of people who’ve been invited.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我来读一下受邀者名单。

Sense.DEF: to find someone or something after searching for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔经过长时间寻找而〕找到某人/某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I finally ran him down at his new office in Glendale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后我在格伦代尔他的新办公室找到了他。

Sense.DEF: to drive a new car slowly and carefully for a period of time so you do not damage its engine
Sense.TRAN: 小心［磨合］驾驶〔新车﹐让发动机进入状态〕

Sense.DEF: if the police run a criminal in, they catch him or her
to start to experience a difficult or unpleasant situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ran into criticism after remarks he made in a television interview.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因为在一个电视访谈节目中的言论而受到批评。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The business ran into financial difficulties almost immediately.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司几乎立刻就陷入了财务困境。

Sense.DEF: to reach an amount of several hundred, several thousand etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cost of repairing the damage could run into millions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 修理损坏之处的费用可能要好几百万。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The list ran into hundreds of pages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 名单有几百页。

Sense.DEF: to hit someone or something with a vehicle
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ran into the back of another car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他撞到了另一辆车的尾部。

Sense.DEF: to meet someone by chance
Sense.EXAMPLE: Guess who I ran into in town today!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猜猜今天我在城里碰见了谁！

Sense.DEF: to leave a place or person in a way that people disapprove of
Sense.EXAMPLE: Amy’s husband had run off and left her with two children to bring up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃米的丈夫遗弃了她﹐还把两个孩子丢给她抚养。

Sense.DEF: to quickly print several copies of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll run off a few more copies before the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开会前我赶紧再印几份。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to leave a place
Sense.TRAN: 逼迫某人离开某地﹐把某人赶出某地
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone tried to run me off the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人想把我逼出公路。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smith had run them off his property with a rifle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史密斯用来复枪把他们赶出了他的房子。

Sense.DEF: to write a speech, poem, piece of music etc quickly and easily
Sense.TRAN: 迅速地写出〔演讲稿﹑诗﹑乐曲等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He could run off a five-page essay in an hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一个小时内就可以写出一篇五页的文章。

Sense.DEF: to talk too much
to get rid of weight by running
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m trying to run off some of my excess fat!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正在努力跑步减肥！

Sense.DEF: to secretly go away with someone in order to marry them or live with them – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liz shocked us all by running off with a married man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利兹和一个已婚男人私奔﹐让我们都很震惊。

Sense.DEF: to steal something and go away
Sense.EXAMPLE: a con-man who makes a habit of running off with people’s savings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总是骗走人们积蓄的一个骗子

Sense.DEF: to continue happening for longer than expected or planned
Sense.EXAMPLE: These things always run on longer than people imagine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些事情持续的时间总是比人们想象的要长。

Subsense.DEF: to use all of something and not have any more left
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got money you can borrow if you run out.
