Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你钱用光了﹐我有钱可以借给你。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They ran out of money and had to abandon the project.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的钱用光了﹐不得不放弃这个项目。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’d run out of ideas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已经想不出任何办法了。

Subsense.DEF: if something is running out, there will soon be none left
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We must act now because time is running out.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时间不多了﹐我们必须立即行动。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My patience was running out.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我快没耐心了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His luck had run out there was none left .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的好运到头了。

Sense.DEF: if an agreement, official document etc runs out, the period for which it is legal or has an effect ends
Sense.EXAMPLE: My contract runs out in September.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的合同9月份期满。

Sense.DEF: to have no more energy or no longer be interested in what you are doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team seemed to have run out of gas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队似乎已经筋疲力尽了。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to leave a place, because they have done something wrong
Sense.TRAN: 〔因某人做错事而〕把某人赶走﹐把某人驱逐出去

Sense.DEF:
to end a player’s
innings
in the game of
cricket
by hitting the
stump s
with the ball while they are running
Sense.TRAN: 〔板球比赛中以球触三门柱〕使〔正在跑的击球手〕出局

Sense.DEF: to leave someone when they are in a difficult situation – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 抛弃〔身处困境的人﹐含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ran out on her when she became pregnant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她怀孕后﹐他就抛弃了她。

Sense.DEF: to hit someone or something with a vehicle, and drive over them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was run over and killed by a bus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被一辆公共汽车轧死了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She got run over outside the school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在学校外被车碾过。

Sense.DEF: to think about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark’s mind raced, running over all the possibilities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克的脑子飞快地转着﹐把各种可能一一作了考虑。

Sense.DEF: to explain or practise something quickly
Sense.TRAN: 快速地解释[练习]某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll just run over the main points again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就把几个要点再很快讲一下。

Sense.DEF: to continue happening for longer than planned
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meeting ran over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议超时了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The talks have run over the 15 November deadline.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会谈超过了11月15日的最后期限。

Sense.DEF: if a container runs over, there is so much liquid inside that some flows out

to
run
something
by
someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔为征询意见〕把〔某事〕告诉〔某人〕

Sense.DEF:
to
run around
to repeat something in order to practise it or make sure it is correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s run through the first scene again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把第一场再排练一下吧。

Sense.DEF: to read, look at, or explain something quickly
Sense.TRAN: 很快地读[看﹐解释]某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Briefly, she ran through details of the morning’s events.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她简单地介绍了上午活动的细节。

Sense.DEF: if a quality, feature etc runs through something, it is present in all of that thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: This theme runs through the whole book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个主题贯穿于整本书。

Sense.DEF: to push a sword completely through someone
to reach a particular amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cost of repairing the damage could run to $1 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 修理损坏之处的费用可能达到100万美元。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The treaty ran to 248 pages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 条约长达248页。

Sense.DEF: to be or have enough money to pay for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our budget won’t run to replacing all the computers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的预算不够更换所有的电脑。

Sense.DEF: to ask someone to help or protect you
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t keep running to your parents every time you have a problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能一有问题就跑去找你的父母帮忙。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s taste runs to something, that is what they like
Sense.EXAMPLE: His taste ran to action movies and thrillers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喜欢动作片和惊悚片。

Sense.DEF: to use so much of something, or borrow so much money, that you owe a lot of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: She ran up an enormous phone bill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她积欠了一大笔电话费。

Sense.DEF: to achieve a particular score or position in a game or competition
Sense.TRAN: 〔在比赛或竞争中〕获得〔分数或名次〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He quickly ran up a big lead in the polls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不久就在民意调查中遥遥领先。

Sense.DEF: to make something, especially clothes, very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She can run up a dress in an evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一个晚上就能赶制出一条连衣裙。

Sense.DEF: to raise a flag on a pole
to have to deal with unexpected problems or a difficult opponent
Sense.TRAN: 遭到﹐遭遇﹐碰到〔突如其来的问题或难应付的对手〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The museum has run up against opposition to its proposals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 博物馆的建议遭到了反对。

Sense.DEF: to be covered with a liquid that is flowing down
Sense.EXAMPLE: His face was running with blood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他血流满面。

Sense.DEF: a period of time spent running, or a distance that you run
Sense.EXAMPLE: a five-mile run
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五英里跑
Sense.EXAMPLE: She usually goes for a run before breakfast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她通常在早餐前去跑步。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was still following me, and in a panic I broke into a run .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他仍然在尾随我﹐我吓得跑了起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sarah left the house at a run.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉跑着离开了房子。

Sense.DEF: later in the future, not immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: Moving to Spain will be better for you in the long run.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从长远来看﹐搬到西班牙对你更合适。

Sense.DEF: in the near future
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sufficient supply, in the short run, will be a problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 短期内能否有充足供应将会是个问题。

Sense.DEF: the usual type of something
Sense.TRAN: 一般/正常/普遍类型的某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The place was very different from the normal run of street cafés.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这地方和一般的街头咖啡馆大不相同。

Sense.DEF: a series of successes or failures
Sense.TRAN: 一连串﹐一系列〔成功或失败〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unbeaten run of 19 games
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 连续19场不败

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Losing my job was the start of a run of bad luck that year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业是我那年一连串噩运的开始。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His extraordinary run of successes has been stopped.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那种无往不利的成功势头已经结束。

Sense.DEF: an amount of a product produced at one time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a limited run of 200 copies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 200册的限量

Subsense.DEF: to be trying to escape or hide, especially from the police
Subsense.TRAN: 在逃跑﹐在躲藏〔尤指为逃避警察〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: wanted criminals on the run from police
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 逃避警方追捕的通缉犯

Subsense.DEF: if an army or opponent is on the run, they will soon be defeated
to be very busy and continuously rushing about
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Typical of stress is this feeling of being continuously on the run.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种一直奔波不停的感觉就是压力的典型表现。

Sense.DEF: to do something while you are on your way somewhere or doing something else
Sense.TRAN: 在赶路[做其他事]的时候做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always seem to eat on the run these days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些天我好像总是边赶路边吃饭。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly start running, in order to escape
if you have the run of a place, you are allowed to go anywhere and do anything in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had the run of the house for the afternoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下午我们可以在房子里自由活动。

Subsense.DEF: a situation in which lots of people suddenly buy a particular product
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There’s always a run on roses before Valentine’s Day.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情人节前玫瑰花总是很热销。

Subsense.LEXUNIT: a run on the dollar/pound etc
Subsense.DEF: a situation in which lots of people sell dollars etc and the value goes down
an occasion when a lot of people take their money out of a bank at the same time

Sense.LEXUNIT: give sb a (good) run for their money
Sense.DEF: to make your opponent in a competition use all their skill and effort to defeat you
Sense.TRAN: 〔在竞争中〕让某人使出浑身解数才获胜
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve given some of the top teams a run for their money this season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个赛季他们让一些顶级球队赢得很艰难。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a (good) run for your money
Sense.DEF: to succeed in doing something successfully for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Investors have also had a good run for their money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 投资者的运气也一直很好。

Sense.DEF: a continuous series of performances of a play, film etc in the same place
Sense.EXAMPLE: His first play had a three-month run in the West End.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的第一部戏在伦敦西区连续上演了三个月。

Subsense.DEF: a journey by train, ship, truck etc made regularly between two places
Subsense.TRAN: 〔火车﹑船﹑卡车等的〕固定行程[航程]
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s only a 55-minute run from London to Brighton.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦到布赖顿不过55分钟车程。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the daily school run the journey that parents make each day taking their children to and from school BrE
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母每天接送孩子上学放学的行程

Subsense.DEF: a short journey in a car, for pleasure
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Let’s take the car out for a run.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们开车兜兜风去。

Sense.DEF: an enclosed area where animals such as chickens or rabbits are kept
Sense.EXAMPLE: a chicken run
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 养鸡场

Sense.DEF:
a point won in
cricket
or baseball
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jones made 32 runs this afternoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼斯今天下午得了32分。

Sense.DEF:
a special area or track on a mountain for people to
ski
or
sledge
down
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ski run
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滑雪道

Sense.DEF: an attempt to be elected to an important position

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is preparing a run for the presidency.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他准备竞选总统。

Sense.DEF:
a line of torn stitches in
tights
or
stocking s

a set of notes played or sung quickly up or down a
scale
in a piece of music
Sense.TRAN: 〔按音阶顺序快速上行或下行的〕急奏﹔急唱

Sense.DEF: a set of cards with numbers in a series, held by one player
a small car used for short journeys
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于短途旅行的〕轻便小汽车

Sense.DEF: to deliberately avoid giving someone a definite answer, especially when they are asking you to do something
Sense.TRAN: 敷衍某人﹐对某人顾左右而言他〔尤当被某人要求做事时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every time we ask the landlord about fixing the roof, he gives us the runaround.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每次我们要求房主修理屋顶﹐他就敷衍我们。

Sense.DEF: a runaway vehicle or animal is out of control
Sense.EXAMPLE: a runaway horse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一匹脱缰的马

Sense.DEF: happening very easily or quickly, and not able to be controlled
Sense.TRAN: 轻易的﹔迅速的﹔控制不住的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film was a runaway success .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影一炮而红。
失控的通货膨胀
Sense.EXAMPLE: a runaway victory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻而易举的胜利

Sense.DEF: a runaway person has left the place where they are supposed to be
someone, especially a child, who has left home without telling anyone and does not intend to come back
a building or area that is run-down is in very bad condition
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物或地区〕破旧的﹐破落的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a run-down inner-city area
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 破旧的市中心贫民区

Sense.DEF: someone who is run-down is tired and not healthy
Sense.EXAMPLE: You look a bit run-down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看上去有点疲倦。

Sense.DEF: the process of making a business or industry smaller and less important

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the rundown of British Steel’s activities in Scotland
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国钢铁公司在苏格兰业务的缩减

Sense.DEF: a quick report or explanation of an idea, situation etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔某个想法﹑情况等的〕简要报告﹐扼要说明﹐梗概

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Connors promised to give me a rundown on local police activity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 康纳斯答应给我简单介绍一下当地警方活动。

Sense.DEF: one of the letters of the alphabet used in the past by people in Northern Europe
Sense.TRAN: 如尼字母〔古代北欧人使用的一种字母〕

Sense.DEF: a magic song or written sign

the past participle of
ring 2
one of the bars that form the steps of a ladder
a particular level or position in an organization or system

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Humans are on the highest rung of the evolutionary ladder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类在进化阶梯中居于最高一级。

Sense.DEF: an argument or disagreement, especially with someone in an official position
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指与公务人员的〕争吵﹐争执

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Michael got drunk and had a run-in with the police.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克尔喝醉了﹐跟警察发生了争执。

Sense.DEF: a small stream or passage that water flows along
someone who runs for sport or pleasure
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long-distance runner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长跑运动员
Sense.EXAMPLE: a marathon runner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马拉松运动员

Sense.DEF: a horse that runs in a race
Sense.EXAMPLE: The runners and riders appear in Friday’s Racing Post.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赛马和骑师都会上星期五的《赛马邮报》。

Sense.DEF: to leave somewhere quickly in order to avoid paying for something or having to meet someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔为避免付款或遇到某人而〕迅速逃离﹐溜掉
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the time the police got there, the boys had done a runner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察到达那里时﹐那些男孩子已经溜掉了。

Sense.DEF:
one of the two thin pieces of metal under a
sledge
, or the single piece of metal under a
skate
Sense.TRAN: 〔雪橇底部的〕滑板﹔〔冰鞋底部的〕冰刀

Sense.DEF: the bar of wood or metal that a drawer or curtain slides along
Sense.TRAN: 〔抽屉或帘子的〕导轨﹐滑槽﹐滑道

Sense.DEF: a stem on a plant that grows along the ground and then puts down roots to form a new plant

a long narrow piece of cloth or
carpet

a vegetable that grows as a long green
pod seed container
on a climbing plant
the person or team that comes second in a race or competition
the activity or sport of running
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you go running this morning?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你今天早上去跑步了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: New facilities include a pool and a running track.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新设施包括一个游泳池和一条跑道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: running shoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跑鞋

Sense.DEF: the process of managing or organizing a business, home, organization etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brian took over the day-to-day running of the company while his father was away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲不在期间﹐布赖恩接手公司的日常管理。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He praised the smooth running of the election.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他称赞竞选组织得很顺利。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in the running/out of the running
Sense.DEF: to have some hope or no hope of winning a race or competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who’s in the running for the world title this year?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁有希望获得今年的世界冠军称号？

Sense.DEF: to be the person who makes most of the suggestions in a relationship, plan, activity etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在关系﹑计划﹑活动等中〕主动﹐带头

Subsense.DEF: if a house has running water, it has pipes which provide water to its kitchen, bath, toilet etc
water that is flowing or moving
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the sound of running water
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 流水的声音
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Rinse the vegetables thoroughly under running water.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用流水将蔬菜彻底冲洗干净。

Sense.DEF: a spoken description of an event, especially a race or game, made while the event is happening
Sense.TRAN: 〔对比赛或体育运动等事件的〕现场实况报道﹐现场描述
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave us a running commentary on what was happening in the street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她就街上的情况向我们作现场报道。

Sense.DEF: a total that keeps being increased as new costs, amounts etc are added
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep a running total of your expenses as you go along.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 进行的同时记个开支流水账总数。

Sense.DEF: an argument or joke that continues or is repeated over a long period of time
Sense.TRAN: 持久的争论/反复讲的笑话

Sense.DEF: a sore area on your skin that has liquid coming out of it
a machine that is in running order is working correctly
the order in which the different parts of an event have been arranged to take place
used to tell someone to go away and stop annoying you
Sense.TRAN: 滚开〔用于告诉某人不要打扰你〕

Sense.DEF: for three years etc without a change or interruption
Sense.EXAMPLE: She won the prize for the fourth year running.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她连续第四年获奖。

Sense.DEF: the amount of money needed to operate an organization, system, machine etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔组织﹑系统﹑机器等的〕运营费用

Sense.DEF: the person chosen by someone who is trying to become president, leader etc to help win an election, and be the second most important political person if they are elected
small things that you do to something to keep it in good working order
the length of time that a film or television programme takes to run from beginning to end
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影或电视节目的〕片长﹐持续时间

Sense.DEF: a runny nose, runny eyes etc have liquid coming out of them, usually because you have a cold
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常因感冒而〕流鼻涕的﹐流泪的

Sense.DEF: food that is runny is not as solid or thick as normal or as desired
Sense.EXAMPLE: The butter had gone runny in the heat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黄油遇热后融化了。

Sense.DEF: a second competition or election that is arranged when there is no clear winner of the first one
Sense.TRAN: 〔比赛打平后的〕重赛﹔〔得票相同者之间的〕决胜选举

Sense.DEF: rain or other liquid that flows off the land into rivers
Sense.TRAN: 径流﹐溢流〔指流入河流中的雨水或其他液体〕

Sense.DEF: not special or interesting in any way
Sense.TRAN: 普通的﹐一般的﹐不突出的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a run-of-the-mill performance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平淡无奇的表现

Sense.DEF:
a sentence that has two main
clause s
without connecting words or correct
punctuation
Sense.TRAN: 连写句〔含有两个主句﹐但没有连接词或正确的标点符号〕

Sense.DEF: a calculation of how much money a company or project will spend or earn in a year. It is usually made by looking at how much it has spent or earned in a three-month period and multiplying that by four.
Sense.TRAN: 运转率 〔公司或项目一年的收支﹐一般以一季的收支乘以四来计算〕

Sense.DEF: the smallest and least developed baby animal of a group born at the same time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the runt of the litter
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一窝中最弱小的幼崽

Sense.DEF: a small, unpleasant, or unimportant person
Sense.TRAN: 矮小[讨厌﹐无足轻重]的人

Sense.DEF: a short practice before a performance, test etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a final run-through of the play
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部戏的最后一次简短排练

Sense.DEF: the period of time just before an important event
Sense.EXAMPLE: in the run-up to the election
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在选举的前夕

Sense.DEF: the act of running, or the distance that you run, before you kick a ball, jump over a pole etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔踢球﹑跳高等之前的〕助跑﹐助跑距离

Sense.DEF: a long specially prepared hard surface like a road on which aircraft land and take off

a long narrow part of a stage that stretches out into the area where the
audience
sits
the standard unit of money in India, Pakistan, and some other countries
Sense.TRAN: 卢比〔印度﹑巴基斯坦等国家的货币单位〕

Sense.DEF: the standard unit of money in Indonesia
Sense.TRAN: 盾〔印度尼西亚的货币单位〕

Sense.DEF: an occasion when something suddenly breaks apart or bursts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the rupture of a blood vessel
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 血管爆裂

Sense.DEF: a situation in which two countries, groups of people etc suddenly disagree and often end their relationship with each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个国家﹑团体等之间关系的〕突然决裂﹐突然破裂

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The eleventh century saw the formal rupture between East and West.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 11世纪东西方正式决裂。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rupture with his father was absolute.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和他父亲一刀两断﹐没有和好的余地。

Sense.DEF:
a medical condition in which an organ of the body, especially one near the
abdomen
, sticks out through the wall of muscle that normally surrounds it
to break or burst, or to make something break or burst
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pipe will rupture at its weakest point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管道最薄弱的地方会破裂的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His liver was ruptured when a brick wall collapsed on him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一堵砖墙坍塌压住了他﹐导致他的肝脏破裂。

Sense.DEF: to damage good relations between people or a peaceful situation
Sense.TRAN: 使〔友好关系〕破裂﹔破坏〔平静〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The noise ruptured the tranquility of the afternoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吵闹声打破了下午的宁静。

Sense.DEF:
to cause an organ of the body, especially one near the
abdomen
, to stick out through the wall of muscle that normally surrounds it
happening in or relating to the countryside, not the city
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rural setting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乡村环境
Sense.EXAMPLE: rural bus routes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乡村公共汽车路线

Sense.DEF: like the countryside or reminding you of the countryside
Sense.TRAN: 像乡村的﹔使人想起乡村的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s very rural round here, isn’t it ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这周围很像乡村﹐对不对？

Sense.DEF: a clever trick used to deceive someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Agnes tried to think of a ruse to get Paul out of the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿格尼丝试图想个办法把保罗从屋子里骗出来。

Sense.DEF: to move very quickly, especially because you need to be somewhere very soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: A small girl rushed past her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个小女孩从她身边匆匆经过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mo rushed off down the corridor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫匆匆走过走廊。

Sense.DEF: to do something very quickly and without delay
Sense.EXAMPLE: I rushed to pack my suitcase before she came back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 趁她还没回来﹐我赶紧把手提箱收拾好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He rushed to help his comrade.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他赶紧去帮他的同事。

Sense.DEF: to do or decide something too quickly, especially so that you do not have time to do it carefully or well
Sense.EXAMPLE: He does not intend to rush his decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不想仓促作出决定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m not rushing into marriage again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不急于再婚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She rushed through her script.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她匆匆读完稿子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When we first met, neither of us wanted to rush things.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们刚认识时﹐谁也不想心太急。

Sense.DEF: to take or send someone or something somewhere very quickly, especially because of an unexpected problem
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因意外事件而〕急送〔某人或某物去某处〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Red Cross rushed medical supplies to the war zone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 红十字会将医疗物资火速送往战区。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Dan was rushed to hospital with serious head injuries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹因头部重伤被急速送往医院。

Sense.DEF: to try to make someone do something more quickly than they want to
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry to rush you, but we need a decision by Friday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很抱歉催你﹐不过我们得在星期五之前作出决定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They felt they were being rushed into choosing a new leader.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们觉得自己是被催着去选一位新领导。

Sense.DEF: if water or another liquid rushes somewhere, it moves quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Water rushed through the gorge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水流冲过峡谷。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone’s face becomes red because they feel embarrassed
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt the blood rush to my face as I heard my name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听到我的名字﹐我感到自己一下子涨红了脸。

Sense.DEF: to attack a person or place suddenly and in a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: They rushed the guard and stole his keys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们突袭卫兵并偷走了他的钥匙。

Subsense.DEF:
to give parties for students, have meetings etc, in order to decide whether to let them join your
fraternity
or
sorority type of club
Subsense.TRAN: 〔大学生联谊会通过舞会﹑聚会等〕招纳﹐吸引〔新会员〕

Subsense.DEF: to go through the process of trying to be accepted into one of these clubs
Subsense.TRAN: 争取加入〔大学生联谊会〕

Sense.DEF: to carry the ball forward
to try to do a lot of things in a short period of time
Sense.TRAN: 〔在短时间内〕赶做许多事﹔匆匆忙忙地做﹐奔忙
Sense.EXAMPLE: Get things ready early so that you don’t have to rush around at the last minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早点把东西准备好﹐以免在最后时刻匆匆忙忙的。

Sense.DEF: to make a new product, book etc available for sale very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new edition was rushed out just before Christmas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新版正好赶在圣诞节前推出。

Sense.DEF: to deal with official or government business more quickly than usual

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The legislation was rushed through parliament.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项法规在议会仓促通过。

Sense.DEF: a sudden fast movement of things or people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt a cold rush of air as she wound down her window.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她摇下窗子﹐感到一股冷风吹来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her words came out in a rush.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的话一下子说了出来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: At five past twelve there was a mad rush to the dinner hall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 12点零5分﹐人们疯狂地冲向餐厅。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which you need to hurry
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew there would be a last-minute rush to meet the deadline.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就知道最后赶期限的时候会很紧张。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, there’s no rush . We don’t have to be at the station until 10.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐不用急的﹐我们10点到车站就可以。

GramExa.GLOSS: do something quickly because you need to hurry
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had to do my homework in a rush because I was late.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得赶紧做家庭作业﹐因为已经迟交了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, I can’t talk now - I’m in a rush.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我现在不能聊﹐我在赶时间。

Sense.DEF: the time in the day, month, year etc when a place or group of people is particularly busy
Sense.EXAMPLE: The café is quiet until the lunchtime rush begins.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在午饭高峰时间开始之前﹐这家小餐馆很清静。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Christmas rush
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节购物热潮

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a lot of people suddenly try to do or get something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s always a rush on swimsuits in the hot weather.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了大热天泳衣总是很抢手。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the rush to put computers in all schools
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 给所有学校都安装电脑的热潮

Subsense.DEF: a sudden strong, usually pleasant feeling that you get from taking a drug or from doing something exciting
Subsense.TRAN: 〔服用毒品或做了兴奋的事后产生的〕快感﹐亢奋
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The feeling of power gave me such a rush.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手握权力的感觉让我如此兴奋。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: an adrenalin rush
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵亢奋

Subsense.DEF: a sudden very strong feeling of anger etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I felt a rush of excitement when she arrived.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她来到的时候﹐我感到一阵激动。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A rush of jealousy swept through her.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她心中突然涌起一阵嫉妒。

Sense.DEF: a type of tall grass that grows in water, often used for making baskets

the first prints of a film before it has been
edit ed

the time when students in American universities who want to join a
fraternity
or
sorority type of club
go to a lot of parties in order to try to be accepted
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国大学生联谊会的〕纳新活动时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: rush week
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳新活动周

Sense.DEF: done very quickly or too quickly, because there was not enough time
Sense.EXAMPLE: We did have a meeting, but it was a bit rushed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们是开了会﹐但是很仓促。

Sense.DEF: if you are rushed, you are very busy because you have a lot of things to do quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll talk to you later - I’m a bit rushed at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我回头和你谈——我现在有点忙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been rushed off my feet extremely busy all day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一整天都忙得不可开交。

Sense.DEF: the time of day when the roads, buses, trains etc are most full, because people are travelling to or from work
Sense.TRAN: 〔上下班的〕高峰时间﹐交通拥挤时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got caught in the morning rush hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早上交通高峰时间我遇上了堵车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: heavy rush hour traffic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高峰时间拥挤的交通

Sense.DEF: a hard sweet dry bread for babies to eat
Sense.TRAN: 〔婴儿食用的〕甜面包干﹐脆饼干

Sense.DEF: a reddish brown colour
relating to Russia, its people, or its language
Sense.TRAN: 俄罗斯[俄国]的﹔俄罗斯[俄国]人的﹔俄语的

Sense.DEF: someone from Russia
the language used in Russia
a game in which you risk killing yourself by shooting at your head with a gun that has six spaces for bullets but only one bullet in it
Sense.TRAN: 俄罗斯轮盘赌〔一种赌命的游戏﹐在有六个弹巢的左轮手枪内仅装一颗子弹﹐举枪对准自己的头部扣动扳机〕

Sense.DEF: the reddish-brown substance that forms on iron or steel when it gets wet
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were large patches of rust on the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车上有大片锈斑。

Sense.DEF: a plant disease that causes reddish-brown spots
to become covered with rust, or to make something become covered in rust
Sense.EXAMPLE: The metal had begun to rust.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金属开始生锈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The gate was old and badly rusted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大门很旧﹐锈得厉害。

Sense.DEF: to be gradually destroyed by rust
Sense.EXAMPLE: The blades of the swords have rusted away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剑刃已经锈坏。

Sense.DEF: an area in the northern US, including parts of the states such as Illinois, Michigan, Indiana, Ohio, and Wisconsin, where many large older industries, especially the steel and car industries, have become less successful and many factories have closed down
Sense.TRAN: 工业［经济］衰退带〔指美国北部的伊利诺伊﹑密歇根﹑印第安纳﹑俄亥俄及威斯康星诸州的部分地区﹐当地许多大型的传统工业出现衰落〕

Sense.DEF: simple, old-fashioned, and not spoiled by modern developments, in a way that is typical of the countryside
Sense.TRAN: 质朴的﹔乡村的﹔乡村风味的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The village had a certain rustic charm .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个村庄有一种迷人的田园风情。

Sense.DEF: roughly made from wood
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rustic chair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把粗木椅

Sense.DEF: someone from the country, especially a farm worker
if leaves, papers, clothes etc rustle, or if you rustle them, they make a noise as they rub against each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: She moved nearer, her long silk skirt rustling around her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走近了﹐真丝长裙窸窣作响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He rustled the papers on his desk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把桌上的报纸翻得沙沙响。

Sense.DEF: to steal farm animals such as cattle, horses, or sheep
to make a meal quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll rustle up a couple of steaks on the barbecue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会赶紧在烤架上烤几块牛排。

Sense.DEF: the noise made when something rustles

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the rustle of leaves in the wind
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 风吹树叶的沙沙声

Sense.DEF: someone who steals farm animals such as cattle, horses, or sheep

metal that is rustproof will not
rust

metal that is rusty is covered in
rust
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rusty nail
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生锈的铁钉
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new metal that will never go rusty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种永不生锈的新金属

Sense.DEF: if you are rusty, you are not as good at something as you used to be, because you have not practised it for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: My French is a bit rusty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的法语有点生疏了。

Sense.DEF: a deep narrow track left in soft ground by a wheel
living or working in a situation that never changes, so that you feel bored
Sense.TRAN: 〔生活或工作〕刻板乏味﹐一成不变
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was stuck in a rut and decided to look for a new job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的生活一成不变﹐所以我决定找一份新工作。

Sense.DEF:
the period of the year when some male animals, especially
deer
, are sexually active

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a stag in rut
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 处于发情期的雄鹿

Sense.DEF: a large round yellow vegetable that grows under the ground
Sense.TRAN: 芜菁甘蓝〔一种长在地下的圆形黄色蔬菜〕

Sense.DEF: so determined to get what you want that you do not care if you have to hurt other people in order to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ruthless dictator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无情的独裁者
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have shown a ruthless disregard for basic human rights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们冷酷地无视基本人权。

Sense.DEF: determined and firm when making unpleasant decisions
Sense.TRAN: 〔作出令人不快的决定时〕坚决的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ran the company with ruthless efficiency.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以铁面无情的高效率经营这家公司。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Throw away clothes you don’t wear - be ruthless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你不穿的衣服扔掉——要坚决。

Sense.DEF: a surface that is rutted has deep narrow tracks in it left by the wheels of vehicles
a large vehicle, usually with cooking equipment and beds in it, that a family can use for travelling or camping
Sense.TRAN: 野营车﹐活动房屋式旅游车
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=prescription处方

Sense.DEF: an important golf competition held every two years, in which two teams compete, one representing Europe and the other the US
Sense.TRAN: 莱德杯高尔夫球对抗赛〔每两年一次的重要高尔夫赛事﹐由欧洲队对美国队〕

Sense.DEF:
a type of grain that is used for making bread and
whisky
Sense.EXAMPLE: rye bread
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑麦面包

Sense.DEF:
a type of American
whisky
made from rye
Sense.TRAN: 黑麦威士忌酒〔一种美国威士忌酒〕

Sense.DEF: a type of grass that is grown as food for animals
Sense.TRAN: 黑麦草〔一种作动物饲料的草〕
